ZJMrk2BwAkN0Dtc73qtN8g.review_text: Love their happy hour specials, their art selection, the music. The vintage furniture in the front half goes really well with the location and the victorian building.  Bartenders are helpful and chill, no snooty pretense there.  The bouncers are really low key too, no douche-baggery to speak of, and it helps that the crowd is positive and friendly.  I've had close to 100% approval of their Dj's, which is rare.   Its a great place that sets a tone in the evolving western add'y neighborhood.

5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: Other than the Ernest Hemingway pun on the drink board, I felt no desire to come back to Madrone.  Maybe it was the clientele.  Maybe it was my odd tasting rum and diet.  Maybe it is the location.  I don't think this is necessarily a bad, but I also don't think I would ever vote to come back.

z3fyMSMx-yl8YndFCpO0wQ.review_text: Madrone is a tale of two nights. I first came here on a weekend a few months ago. It was all hip-hop, hoodies and hoodlums. I came back a few weeks later...on a Tuesday. That night it was upscale hipsters -- call them "hippers", as in hipper-than-thou.  Tuesday nights at this small lounge-cum-dancefloor feature the best urban-inspired DJ-ing west of Van Ness. The chill music and vibe draw a colorful crowd (sartorially and dermatologically) that skews  late 20s/early 30s. Lots and lots of eye candy.  While the clientele may be inconsistent over the week, one thing that stays good all the time is the creative drink specials. In September, the place was packed for $2.00 Red Stripe Tuesdays, while Saturdays featured five-buck Beer + Fernet.  All in all, I'd stick with a weeknight visit to Madrone. It's the best time to savor the lowkey atmosphere, and above all, you'll avoid paying $5 cover for thug love.

MtJpkMJ1edE_Q0ec8cmxVQ.review_text: Couches, cushioned seats, wood floors, wide open spaces, and a massive bar torn right out of a Tim Burton pirate movie all greeted me the moment I stepped in the door.  No one looked up to see if I was fuckable; I took this as a sign that Madrone is no meat-market as otherwise I'd be grabbing eyes like a 13th century Romanian witch.  The bartender didn't know what a Cuba Libre was but I didn't know it was some kind of fancypants vodka bar, so our mutual ignorance neutralized each other.  The drinks were strong, like my liver, and the two were in bed with each other in record time.  Regardless of how busy it got, the bartenders were on top of everything but the bar, which is good because Coyote Ugly is bullshit.  Later in the evening a DJ showed up and there was dancing, but it seemed to me to be more Flashdance than Fame so I bounced, and not "with it."

8Q0xnxT-KrvCl2pQF1qsFQ.review_text: forget what night we went there but it was niice.  straight themed out with 80's Prince vs. Jacko.  Hella heads were carrying either paper-cutouts of the two and playing videos of both on some screen behind the dj.  the place is not too small, not so big--for this night just right tho the place was packed.  we were all partying and dancing for a friends sobetsukai and we all walked away from the spot dripping wet-- fabulous in my book!

hA47j-aevMzc-vm1evT2nw.review_text: this bar makes me fall in love with san francisco all over again. the vibe. the music. the drinks. the people. the art. please stay cool madrone!

U-s_dzRDlhL5bQ_o71PGcA.review_text: As many others have alluded to, the quality of Madrone depends largely on the night of the week which you attend.  Sunday through Wednesday one can easily stroll up to the bar and quickly get a drink, the infused vodkas are delish, there usually isn't a cover, and the clientele is quite delightful.  Weekends on the other hand? There's barely enough room to move, let alone dance. I had to wait 20 minutes to get in last night for the Prince/Michael Jackson danceoff, and for the first hour regretted the fact that I had stumbled into a sauna. Not to mention the fact that it took another 20 minutes to get to the bar and order a drink (they really need to up the number of bartenders up to three on the weekends).  Luckily, my friends staked out a spot right next to one of the two giant fans which made it somewhat bearable. A lot of folks started to clear out around 12:30 since they couldn't stand the heat or the inability to bust-a-move. By this time the DJs finally kicked it up a notch and were busting out their A game (Erotic City/Wanna Be Startin' Somethin/Billie Jean/Let's Go Crazy /When Doves Cry/Workin Day and Night), so the final hour and half led to a super amazing time for all willing to stick it out. Nonetheless, I hope I never find myself at this place on a weekend ever again -- or at least until MJ v. Prince 5 next year...

9qMzUJhS46_KUHddw2JA7w.review_text: Madrone Art bar is easy on the eyes and pleasing to the senses. Artsy interior and exterior.. Artists who play live music and creative bartenders create cocktails to enthuse the crowd.. Loved, loved the "Lola" and the bartender who made it.. Cute * Crowded, even on Tuesday night.. the beats were funk and soul.. earlier that day we stopped in for a preview and found two musicians howling away their worries and cares to bluegrass and guitars..

176r_jDWk-burIiHnO2Z-g.review_text: I  write many review before some days ago but today ai want to update my review for this place. As l like this place so I go here about all the night. Their bar area was neat and clean and I love the area you can got there all kind of drinks. Drinks was so cheap than any other dance club. Thanks a million for their service.

QeMjVe17Z3A0vh1oZjCCTQ.review_text: Changing my review from 5 stars to 2. The bartenders are straight up RUDE. Whoever owns Madrone needs to make some major changes if they want to keep their local clientele. First, the staff. I don't care that you have crappy tattoos and a hoodie. You are there to make me a drink without a side of attitude. Second, when its cold outside, its cold inside Madrone. Ladies, you will freeze. Third, clean your bathrooms! Ewww. Lastly, the weekend cover charge is rediculous, given all of the above (and if you read all the other reviews, the crowd sucks too). You want to make money, try making some of these changes first. Its a cool small space with a great drink menu...no reason it live up to its potential.

aK4bx3iZKZuf3lgMKzpshA.review_text: i love this place.  blue walls, fantastic art by local artists scattered around the venue, cool visuals projected on a screen in the back, and usually good beats being spun.  on weekends it can get a little 'sceney,' so the bar is best vistied on a weeknight.  grab an old victorian couch, drink one of the 12 or so infused vodkas (i suggest the cucumber vodka), chill, and be sure to chat w/ the bartenders - they are all really cool. oh - i love the Nuts and Berries drink - it's my favorite alcoholic dessert.

ia9WOAZ6eXMbNgr4wvmJ1g.review_text: You know, not sure what to think. It was quaint.  The drinks were good. I could not begin to describe the vibe, but I was only there for an hour. I'd go back.

nJ3kSsqq57b0LtyqHj0Cvg.review_text: Sweet ambiance at this chill NOPA spot. Lots of good beers and a special every night.  Infused vodkas, that I have heard are very tasty  (if your into that sort of thing). And a constant array of good music. Free internet and bring your own food!! Excellent spot. I recommend the laid back sunday nights, but they close a little earlier than usual. Little packed on the weekends, but where isn't?

77yYWUD7hvvrHIXiGSR8yA.review_text: groovy new addition to the 'hood...awesome infused vodka selection, with a proprietary cocktail collection to go along with...i was rocking "the Lola" all Saturday night (cucumber-infused vodka with ginger and fresh lime)...it kept me feeling fresh and sprite on the dance floor all night long... p.s. just TRY to not look at the gender bending julianne moore-ish photograph.

7KVpIdVSWCzI5F7TGxQawA.review_text: I used to live a couple blocks up from this place, and came here religiously on nights I didn't feel like taking Muni up to. This place is a great casual set up with super nice people. The crowd can be a little obnoxious depending on which night you go, but overall everyone is pretty nice and it's chill-lax. Drinks are reasonable and the decor rocks.

CbwJmOCldNyzO1nh9ouNJA.review_text: Booooy  I been watchin you  Like a hawk in the sky  Oh I  Oh you are my prey (hey)  I been holdin back this secret from you  Prob'ly shouldn't tell it  Oh, hello 90's night at Madrone. Crowd sucks but I sure like your 90s music with accompanied 90's music videos.   I didn't like that there was a cover, but once you get inside the drinks are reasonably priced. And it's got some real nice decorations.

PECXedG2F9cOUN_9Otru6Q.review_text: Madrone just didn't do it for me.    The drinks were fine, the place is pretty nice inside, and we even went when it was quiet, so I could have a nice conversation with my drinking companions for the night.    There were a few folks setting up what looked like a sound system with nuclear deterrent capability at the end of the bar, so I was happy to leave before that got started.  It was just OK.  Nothing great, nothing bad.

w85ExtcWtZv2tZ35NxN9LA.review_text: Pretty enjoyable last night.  The crowd and drinks were both pretty good, although the DJ choice left something to be desired.  The couches and bar stools are both pretty comfortable.  I wouldn't mind lounging around there for a few hours.  It's good enough for a return visit to see if the DJ was just a fluke.

wbAnJpZ0Lmj3LeXg4pmq_w.review_text: On Tuesdays I would give this place Four Stars for two dollar red stripes, great staff and some great music.... BUT on Saturdays I would give this place Two Stars for a high, unnecessary cover and being way TOO crowded. Three dollar tall boy Budweisers EVERYDAY!!

DnsK9MRyD-N5RAD-mAMzSA.review_text: Awesome place. Cheap happy hour prices $2 Bud tall boys, $3 wells, $4 infused vodkas (a good and cheap time to try them if you're intrigued). Daily drink specials, DJ's every night. Great music, great people. cumfy couches. I might be biased cause I work their...

H0Jx9FwpQ-ZHuTwOExUEnA.review_text: $4 mojitos = love. They are good mojitos too, and in big glasses. They stop serving them at 9 when happy hour ends, so consider yourself warned and stock up before then. I've heard some bad things about this place from people who've tried to come here on a weekend night, but it being about three blocks from my current residence, I tend to show up at about 8 and leave before 10. Went for a drink with a friend last night, the bar was mostly empty, we polished off a pile of mojitos while curled up on the couches. There was a guy spinning records in the corner, the people at the bar were nice and conversational as I went up to get more drinks. It was super chill--this is definitely my favorite place for after work drinks.

KLLKsd5YzyDCMsDC9Ab6uQ.review_text: Always a good time here, although I'm not a big fan of the cover charge, especially with all the cash these guys are making at the bar. The wait may take a while, but it's worth it to see the art and share some good times.

BmxqEeNmHW2b2nju1vMhmQ.review_text: i liked the neighborhood better before Madrone moved in.  As my bf from Miami is fond of pointing out, if you have a velvet rope, you prolly shouldn't let people in who are wearing shorts and flip flops.  This is the wrong type of bar for this neighborhood.  It attracts a really weird crowd.

YS8zwKmUfYVcu77IjW8mDQ.review_text: Many moons ago the neighborhood fought to have this spot not fall prey to a fast food joint.  It then sat dormant for years and finally got phoenixed as Madrone.  As a resident, its fine addition.  Like the couches and the tall boys.

nH8hED18wsxWurL0cleebA.review_text: Ok, I'll admit it: I'm biased. The location of this place (on my block) means that the Stumbling Distance adds to its appeal. But know that's not the only reason I have found that I love my new "local."   First, the drinks. Infused vodka? You've made a fan out of me. (Unfortunately, you don't get to drink out of the ones on the back of the bar...they're just for appearance.) Still, I love me some vodka, especially when it has a hint of pomegranate or cucumber. Say it with me, fans: Tasty.  Next, the bartenders are genuinely friendly and helpful. Ashley (who works on Monday night) is so attentive that another drink is instantly placed in front of me before I even have the chance to order it (a trait much more appreciated when I've actually eaten dinner that night...drunk Connect Four definitely ensued.)  Like my men, I also appreciate a bar who understands that planning activities is a must. While I don't like sitting around all weekend in front of the television ALL of the time, nor do I enjoy going to the same ol' bar for the same ol' thing. I mean yes, we'll be drinking, but spice it up a bit. Add a DJ. Add a game night. Add local art. Madrone does this, and does this well. If Madrone was my boyfriend, he'd get a home-cooked meal in appreciation. And other stuff.  My favorite night of the week to come is Monday, when locals get the $2 highballs just for living in the neighborhood. YAY, 94117, you rock.  In short, Madrone: would you like to go out? Because I think I have a crush on you.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: This place is fun!     I went there last night for my first time for their 80's night and had a blast. The decor and ambiance of the spot is super cute. I want to have an art show here and I am actually going to look into what I have to do to make that a reality. Not cheap drinks but not super dooper expensive.The djs last night were so good and I was in heaven. I guess the only negative is size , it gets pretty fucking packed on the dancefloor/bar area and that is always bugging.  Madrone I like you, I'll be in touch again :)

SopImrCJcBF0fWYPqpjvnw.review_text: OK, I must add a disclaimer to this review by admitting I lived above Madrone for a year and a half of my life. I had just graduated college, lived with some of my best friends in the beautiful attached Victorian and was depressingly broke. It was the best time of my life, "all I did was party and get laid."  But I digress Madrone attracts an interesting mix of young professionals, hipsters and local party animals ( I fall into the latter). And even though their drinks are not the cheapest they have good happy hours and the best deal in the city every Tuesday night, when the dynamic duo serve up ice cold red stripes for $2 and Jameson shots or on the rocks for $3. The music is generally good, although occasionally borders on decibely oppressive.   Overall this place has been and still is the closest bar to me and offers a fun, high energy crowd with enough nightly specials to keep me and my credit card coming back.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I'm seriously impressed. Came here for a drink or two after dinner and surprisingly caught MC Radioactive and his guests perform some solid rap/techno fusion. I really don't know how to describe the sound, but it was pleasing to the ears and made me want to come back. The drinks are good as well, especially the cucumber vodka on the rocks. I did get a little pissed when one of the bartenders physically took a drink out of my hand since it was 12:15 and the bar closed at 12:00. I understand if they have some kind of law, but I didn't see any cops around ready to arrest them for keeping the bar open past midnight...

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Madrone has always been super fun every other time I've gone, but not necessarily when they have guest DJs or theme nights because...  a.) there is a cover (it's only $5 though which isn't too bad) b.) b/c it is sooo overly crowded and HOT, like heat stroke style hot (see Patricia P's review) c.) the line at the bar and to get in can get pretty long d.) the bathroom situation.  They only have two single bathrooms, which is baaaad, especially on a crazy busy night.  Otherwise, I love Madrone.  They have fancy delicious infused drinks, good bartenders, good DJs, and fun, eclectic, art and furniture.  I felt like you couldn't take in the ambiance to the fullest though on Friday night since it was 90s night.  I'd like to come back again on a week night for a low key happy hr with friends or with a date.

JB1e2xf0B1fLvywnTsFn-g.review_text: Cute place - smallish, cute decor with comfortable chairs... it feels like you're hanging out at a cool buddy's living room.  I was referred here by a really cool bartender and since all his other referals have been bang on, I was gravely disappointed when i finally got here.  Mostly disappointed by how badly the place was operated, the bartenders aren't very friendly and their infused vodkas actually suck!  I had two different ones (tomato and dried apricot) just to make sure.  Alas, I could've made way better ones myself.  Perhaps it's because I was there on a Saturday nite...  (disappointed sigh)

a6cza8qMp48gKrSUw40GMw.review_text: This place deserves a different price rating than it has for two very big reasons.  The first reason, happy hour goes until 9pm.  Second, there's a drink special every day of the week.  Besides these very big favorable factors, this place can be cliquish when not happening, and way too crowded when it is.  This place has potential, but there's something about it that just doesn't work for me.  The bartenders can be annoying as it sometimes seems more like they're there to have a good time than to serve drinks.  The clientele has come off at times to be pompous, though I wouldn't feel comfortable saying that as a general reference.  All this said, I know plenty of people who feel differently and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend that someone checks it out for themselves.

DrmRh7Dx5sLe21uOtSeZWw.review_text: Busy place even for a Monday. The bar is fully stacked with all kinds of poison, from Tekate to top shelf whiskey. Pretty knowledgeable bartender (2). Very friendly and fast. Need more barbacks to collect empty glasses and bottles. The place has pretty relax in security which is good. One entrance, & one exit. It can get pretty hot it there though, can get pretty packed, even though both doors are open, need more air circulation. Good queer-friendly vibe, open minded cool people. Cute crowd. First come first serve tables. Good music on Monday, $3 cover, not enough room to dance though. Do they have a coat check? Smoking on the curb, yes on ins & outs.  The place have rotating artists featured on the walls. Pretty cool.

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: The DJs are spinning and the music couldn't be better.  Madrone is the spot to go to when you want to get away from it all.  Great drinks and a great crowd, you can't really ask for more... oh but you can!  ART!  Check out some of the recent pieces and grab a drink while enjoying the juxtaposition.

LBoRkOP7V2OsDp8EVwCvcQ.review_text: this is a great night spot.  the setting is a combination of hip and trendy, vintage pieces scattered about and random photos cover the walls.  there are good, affordable drink specials and in general the drinks are not expensive.  they have a nice selection of dj's and it has a decent dance floor.  madrone will serve you a fun night out!

2UCF-ZpbilelJ6bMNpTkqw.review_text: WAYYYYYY TOO CROWDED. Trying to get to the bar is a challenge and don't even think about trying to walk around. It's been packed wall to wall every time I've been. The drinks are great, but being cash only is a major drawback. I really dislike bars that force you to use their ATMs to get cash out, since they're making money anyways!  The decor is on point with it's categorization as "hipster" and the drinks bear similarly clever names. All in all, probably a good place to go to on a random night, or just one stop during your night out. I wouldn't call this a place to meet new people or even a place to hang out in.

_Ti5EP_Ms7Ncus5d4jpK8A.review_text: this could possibly by my favorite lounge in the sf area. a good collection of infused vodkas and nice nightly deals. my friends and i get excited about the $2 red stripe tuesdays.   great art on the walls that changes frequently.  the music fits with the decor  and it is great to see MC's behind the dj adding a live element to the music.   its just a small beautiful place overall

6pryBgYDVCmp1JudhoKpmg.review_text: My Madrone experience as captured by pieces of Actual Dialogue:  Me: Where are you? My roommate: IT STARTS WITH M Me: Where is it? My roommate: THE CORNER OF MUMBLE AND FUZZ Me: Where?!? My roommate: THE CORNER OF MUMBLE AND FUZZ Me: WHERE?!?!?! McV (not even on the phone): She said Divis and Fell. I can hear her perfectly. Your WRIST! (physically flips hand over to stamp underside of wrist) Me: BOTH sides of my wrist are my wrist... My brain: GETTING FRESH WITH BOUNCERS NEVER ENDS WELL Me: ... Sir. Thank you.  Me: What do you think? McV: Hmm. The crowd is mixed, and the atmosphere is chill, but it's not worth a $5 cover. Me: Agreed. I, too, believe that ... OOOOH does that say honey vodka shots for 3 dollars?!? Let's do shots! What were we talking about?  Sample played by DJ: ...Pussy like that pussy like that pussy like that pussy like that... Sy_Gbxx6KcFWUisSXzmngw.review_text: Great music, fun crowd for the most part and $3 pbr....what else can you ask for? Crazy decor and a tiny dance floor make for good people watching and a sweaty good time at the neighborhood bar/club.

j_yNLTgzGzHDpg0EIJysQg.review_text: Loved the surfing exhibition they had recently: very cool, especially when cooped up in the city. Service is good, choice of drinks is ok, and the noise level is, well, a little much for intimate nights out, but good if you like good music. It's a small space, so prepared to get friendly with "strangers." Don't go if you get claustrophobic/ sweat easily...

bDA-jQRN8hjh13v-Ns4uxg.review_text: If you didn't have a chance to get your dance on during the weekend, Motown Monday will always make up for it. I recommend arriving a little early so that you can actually enjoy the dance floor before a flood of people arrive (at around 10:30). It's a pretty small bar so it can get crowded very quickly.

dkkMQorZE0EF-F5wOiqA7w.review_text: Enjoyed the rustic antique furniture, with nice tree art on the walls. I like tree art actually, and found last time i was in this neighborhood, I ate at Blue Jay Cafe, and they had tree art too.   Had a sidecar, but that didn't seem to be the norm, which was tall Budweiser cans.  Eclectic crowd with neat constantly changing art on the walls. Hip DJ music, and a nice local intimate feel.

cEg2Lp2NVkSRwlil2-idug.review_text: My buddy picked me up from the airport late one Monday night and on the way home we saw a line of beautiful girls and well dressed dudes outside this funky looking bar. Though work started early the next morning we could not help ourselves from stopping and grabbing a drink to see what all the people were waiting for on a Monday night. As i stepped into the bar my mouth instantly dropped as I saw countless beautiful girls dancing to funky mo-town music with doper then dope decorations of designer ak-47s and animal tusks. My love for the bar only grew as i made my way to the bar to grab a beer. Whatever kind of brew you want, they have, and at great prices. We then made are way back to the dance floor and a women giving messages for 1 dollar a minute, hells yea. We then jointed the girls on the dance floor and danced, I wasnt even drunk but the music was so good you could not help but groove.This bar is simply awesome. Good music, good drink, good art, and all done with the utmost taste and class. Most def one of my favorite bars in the city.

S1Yu4McDc-ecjMO5PgW2dQ.review_text: I first walked into Madrone to kill some time before a show at the Indy.  When I walked in I found that it was comedy night and the people onstage were super funny.  I loved the layout and decor of the bar - although I found it hard to pick a drink from their extensive menu.  I settled on a Herby Hancock (I loved the idea of fresh watermelon in my cocktail) and was blown away.  It is as refreshing as it is potent!  2 HH's later and I was ready to dance the rest of the night away at the show.  The drinks are reasonably priced, as well.  I also stopped by during one of the World Series games and discovered that they had a Gay Night on trial.  I ended up sharing the booth with 2 friendly and funny gay dudes and had a great night!  Every time I have stopped in I have enjoyed myself.  The drinks are delicious and the bartenders have never given me attitude - even when I stall and take 10 minutes perusing their drink menu. My thoughts are they are used to that happening.  :)

54hmkwNpGWt615FsKtH6mQ.review_text: Great spot.  Art changes all the time on the walls and the live music is usually something interesting (folksy piano player last evening).  $12 for a Big Daddy IPA and 2 Anchor Steams.  CASH ONLY.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: One of the first things you'll notice about madrone is the really high ceilings. They are so high, in fact, that I wouldn't be surprised if completely self contained weather systems form in there and it sometimes rains or snows, which would explain why most of the male patrons were wearing sweatshirts or jackets with the hoods up over their heads.  You will also notice you aren't as cool as the bartender or any of the patrons; In fact, the petit-burgoise banality of your presence is offensive to them. Don't worry, I'm not as cool as they are either, nor is anyone else I know. I am at peace with this.  But looking further, you'll notice the live DJ and sizeable dance floor, the comfortable antique chairs and couches (the kind of arts & craftsish one in the southwest corner of the room is particulary soft. USEFUL) and the appealing happy hour specials. These things make Madrone a decent choice for sundays or weeknight if you're secure and comfortable in your lameness.

CPdkpOswYgtdxMPUbZ0T9Q.review_text: Went here (finally) last night for a friend's birthday. I have to say, that I could get used to this spot. Cozy, cool art (the plaid fabric covered golden AK47's were DOPE!), and a fairly nice bar staff. The cocktails are reasonably priced given the quality and selection, and they're mixed quite well. If you see the younger bartender with the sort of afro thing going on, he's your man - great service from that guy!   On top of that, they seem to have a pretty friendly clientele, loaded with beautiful ladies (hey, this is the kind of crap that gets my attention, sue me), and fairly non-douchey dudes.   Madrone, you won me over, I will return!

QEn-hTSA2JzmW-2VVrL5jg.review_text: Chill and unpretentious with some great music to boot, this place is a keeper on my list of night time places to hit up.  Cover is $5.  It's small but big enough to get your groove thang on to some great house, mixed international and random other music.    I came here with two guy friends on a Friday night, and we had a good time dancing, observing the somewhat hipster crowd and the video backdrops to the music.   The DJs were spinning on the same level, so it was fun to watch them totally get into their zone. Check it out - it's spunky with its random art decor and good drinks!

J7wtpjI1pjkUSX8HHCGZug.review_text: If i could give Madrone 6 stars I would.  Madrone is my all time favorite bar in SF.  I have lived here for 6 years and been all over, but no place has been as consistently fun as madrone.  The nights are so diverse, each with a different type of music and awesome vibe.  Its got something for everybody.  Its a great place to go go dancing with your girlfriends or to stop in for a well rounded cocktail...the Lola is a very tasty, refreshing drink btw. The staff is awesome and the guy who bartends fri and sat nights is super hot!!! Go to Madrone on fri, sat or monday if you want to dance your butt off, or go during the week and have a more chill, but still super fun night!  Oh yea and the brass band on Tuesdays kicks ass! The best tuesday spot in SF.

vBQdfICu2PFFgsguUMZxLQ.review_text: Attitude at the bar, but not with the bartender or staff. The staff and space are still on point. The mellow vibe has been slightly skewed... It is not 2005 anymore. What happened to this neighborhood bar? It could be a representation/manifestation of the neighborhood itself.

2XPOmhs67nJIZonPPFJ5Ig.review_text: eff that.  $5 cover on a dead Thursday night even if it's my birthday and i'm bringing a bunch of girls in with me?  are you kidding?

3M_qi_MsjIDtPQc2MHNUBg.review_text: Are you people kidding me?    This pace blows to the fullest.  RUDE bartenders.  On a weeknight!!  Look assholes, you're lucky anyone is in here at all.  The place smells like wet baby diapers.  No, scratch that.  It smells like wet Depends. And the cd player skips!!  If it wasn't down the street from the Independent and Nopa, this place would get zero business.  ZERO!!

RiG5KD2v6rUdocp2ymuE9g.review_text: I've always heard that yelpers get crazy drunk on DYLs and didn't actually believe it until DYL at madrone. I've been to a couple DYLs before and apparently those were rather tame nights, because holey moley it was crazy at madrone! Or maybe madrone is always like that every friday because after a certain point, the crowd changed completely and I could not recognize anybody anymore (and it's NOT because I was drunk). Not that it matters, since nobody seemed to recognize me anyway. And those who met me that night probably forgot my name 5 seconds after I said it.  The place also became extremely crowded around 11 or so and the music became really loud. Too bad, it was nice when it's still kinda loungey and people could actually talk. Love the sofas, by the way. The anime on the big screen was a nice touch. Although if they had played some tentacle porn anime, they could've gotten even more customers and I'd be less bored.  Happy hour drinks were good. 2 beers, a lemon drop, and a rum & coke cost $15. Not bad, eh? They also have infused vodkas. I tried the coffee infused vodka ($7) and thought "this should be a latte, I could drink this everyday!".  Overall, I had a good time, and my companions seemed to enjoy themselves. Good company and good alcohol, what more can I ask for?

VRH20wFvmLuE2czrHm-KPg.review_text: Good for a thursday night.  $5 cover and understaffed bar do suck, but stiff drinks and $2 tall boys make up for it when you are running low on cash by the end of the night.  Music is danceable, equal opportunity like the crowd.  Come early - get your drink on, avoid the cover charge (before 10 i think?), and camp out some seats for relief from the crowds later on in the night.

YFG_qsnCwHTxgPAYYW-YQQ.review_text: Great spot. I felt like I was having a drink in my cool aunt's den--  blue walls, victorian velvet couches, and tasty tasty drinks.

rshFnj9YqfmO5Yp2jsPjrA.review_text: I don't go here often, but there are a couple things that I REALLY like about this place:  1. There's a ton of board games here. Get your Connect Four on.  2. Monday nights are 'Neighborhood Nights'. If you show ID proving you live in the 94117, you are welcome to really good deals on drinks.  That's about it.

Z7wYV7NVNAH_B0eE35d2wg.review_text: Flavored Vodkas...doesn't get much better than this.

S9kSawG9Ry10RlUkdGZvAQ.review_text: I have only been here for Prince vs MJ and the music is of course 5-stars all around.   The service is pretty friendly. The guy at the front door was nice, more on that later. The bartenders were cool.   There are some delicious cocktails; the Lola especially with the house made cucumber infused vodka. When I got my second drink of the night, the bartender noticed the bottle was running low, so he kinda shrugged and just dumped the rest of it in to my drink. I AM OKAY WITH THIS! I like booze. Make is strong, baby! The damage is around $8 for liquor.   The only real reason why I only give Madrone three stars is because it gets so ridiculously packed. I really wanted to dance. I desperately wanted to dance. But there is simply no room to do so. That's especially heart breaking when you love the classic tunes of Prince and MJ.   Because it gets so packed you also run in to the debacle of what becomes the restroom line. Where is the line? You can't really tell because it's so packed. When you exit the restroom, it's likely you'll accidentally slam the door in to a poor soul that thought they found a decent spot to stand or dance.  I really hope Madrone either expands for this event, or that the Prince vs MJ people take their show to a bigger venue. It's so jammed with people that despite my love for the music and the friendly service, I probably won't be back.  We left around 11pm because it was so suffocating. As we were leaving, some friends just walked in. They asked the guy at the front door if they could get their money back since we were leaving (and since they were there for a total of 2 seconds), and he did. Cool.

9Pgs_ictXWIkjhrb_aaqgA.review_text: 3 stars for the extreme lack of parking in this neighborhood.  The infused vodkas are nice.  Pineapple tasted like sweet, juicy pineapple.   Cran-apple was more apple than cran, and had a stronger vodka flavor.  Ginger vodka mixed with fresh squeezed lime and mango juice is sour and refreshing.   Pear vodka mixed with lychee juice was sweet and super easy to gulp down.   The crowd is mixed and the music is ok. Gets really hot and crowded on Saturdays.

Xi9rQmCT871UpMvNRzAfuw.review_text: I always have fun whenever I go here, whether it's a weeknight or Saturday evening. It's also a great place to go when you don't find your date going well. You can scope out some of the other singles hanging out.  Whether they charge a cover or not seems to depend on the mood of the doorman.

bk3LC4qjyk3VEVtpP4P68w.review_text: This place is decent, it gets at least one star for being two blocks from me.  It gets another star or two for their great open mike night (or afternoon actually) on sundays.  The cocktails are ok and the beer selection and prices not amazing.  But they have a Mickey Mouse figurine on a crucifix wearing a gold chain and that is just disturbing enough to make it worth a few stars.  The black and white film is usually distracting and something weird like psycho.  The place gets way to crowded at night with guys that want to feel you up.  They make you pay a cover on weekday nights just because they can and not because the band is worth it.  They do have a hottie bartender who wears pink pants.  But the fortune cookies container actually gave me a fortune that said "blow up dolls are not lovers, so stop it."  And well I have nothing to say about that.

lThzub113E9iCw_0XncXzA.review_text: Madrone is a long walk from my place since parking sucks in this area, but the infused vodka's make it totally worth it. My favorite drink used to be a dark and stormy (dark rum and ginger beer). Now it's a ginger vodka w/ ginger beer. The guy who makes these infusions is a genius. He turned swill (Seagram's vodka) into liquid gold. The lola (cucumber vodka and ginger beer)  is also great but too cucumbery to drink more than one. I'm guessing International night (reggae music mostly)  isn't one of their biggest draws as it emptied out once all the yelp crowd left.

cmAHVj0b5Wz5Tun6Op0ksw.review_text: I came here before a concert at the independent on a Friday night.  Around 930 the bar was still pretty empty, not hard at all to find a seat.  The decor is awesome. I love it. The chalkboard menu is awesome too.    I can't comment too much on the ambiance at night. But I did enjoy my beer and the decor.

aBbN7Y_eu4LSwioIXMl0QQ.review_text: Tuesdays. The vibe is really mellow and funky and the music is perfect for a mellow drunk/stoned week night. 3$ Jameson shots 2$ Red Stripes. Just make sure you don't have to wake up the next day.

VZqQtn-Q1fH8-mZ6SbcfQg.review_text: Really friendly owner, really intense, thoughtful drinks, fair prices, cool vibe and surroundings. Definitely somewhere to take someone who wants a "cool" place to hang out.   I love the idea of the drink that comes with a slap in the face, but I didn't order it so I can't personally vouch for the quality of the slap :-P  The one thing that seemed odd to me was the strange, sullen man posted up by the door (who could have been from the "homeless or hipster" website) but he wasn't bothering anyone so I'll let that go.

q_QQ5kBBwlCcbL1s4NVK3g.review_text: Madrone is fun, although the cover is yucky and best to be avoided ;)  The music can be hit or miss with fab sounds piggybacking weird latin wannabe tracks that make white guys dance how they shouldn't in public.   BUT there's a good drink price range and the crowd is attractive for the most part. When I was there it was kind of a sausage fest (no complaints) so I was sandwiched btwn tall collars and didn't get a good look at the decor.

I5UoeEc93c3edfBMJcFPcA.review_text: So I LOVE the 80s and the Prince v. Michael concept is brilliant, but I was there at midnight on Saturday and it was PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE TO MOVE, much less dance or make it to the bar.   My friend said the maximum capacity was actually posted as 75 (!) which is a complete joke. I would guess there were 200 people packed in, and the bouncers were still not bothering to form a line outside. They seriously should be investigated by the fire department.  I left after 10 minutes. Not a chance in hell I'll be back. ------------------  I am such a liar. I did go back for another rendition of Prince v. Michael. I'm adding two stars to my previous review. One star because my friends all got laid or almost laid that night. Half a star because Prohibition Ale was only $3. And another half a star because they were nice to me when I came back for my forgotten credit card 2 days later.

Qs-cFMvJbaEoyGzu88ZQIQ.review_text: you know those really jock bros you went to high school with... the ones that for some unknown reason to god or man have this incredible talent for drawing and art? and they graduate from high school, coaxed by their mother... they decide to go to college in an "artsy" place. lets just say this place is San Francisco.  well, when they finally pack their bags and move up north from san diego or whatever anonymous So Cal town they are from... some guy pulls them aside at the dorm and tells them of a magical place. a magical place where they can still be the football bro they once were but look like some kind of confused hipster.  a place called MADRONEEEEE.........  the people there suck. and only one good thing comes from this place.... cucumber vodka.

p_hZ_KQS9Y0Gq637A3YbNw.review_text: A couple of my friends wanted to go here to check out the "Prince vs. Michael" party on Saturday, which I had never heard of.  In preparation for that night, I spent some time reading the other reviews here, many of which give Madrone shitty-to-mediocre ratings.  I have to admit, the shitty ratings made me a little nervous (which just goes to show that I hold the highest regard for my fellow Yelpers!).  I felt that if this large group of diverse people are consistently having a crappy time here, then the probability of *me* having a crappy time here is pretty good.  Numbers don't lie, right?    Well, I didn't have a shitty time.  Actually, I had a pretty damn good time.  The energy was excellent on Saturday night...people were smiling and laughing and having fun.  Girls weren't being catty and dudes weren't groping.  Nor did it take forever to get a drink.  Then again, I *always* get my drink!  (If not from the bar then from the flask in mah purse!).  It *was* insanely crowded, and believe me, I am *not*  touchy person, but after awhile, I kind of felt that there was a camaraderie to it.  It was cozy in a sort of "March of the Penguins" huddling-for-warmth kind of way.  Whatever you do though, DO NOT EVER top four shots of Patron with a shot of Jack and expect to be "okay".  fuck...

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: So, there is always the token crazy dancer ... giving it stacks to the tunes on the dance floor .. pretty much any time of the evening any day of the week !   I like this bar alot ... i wish i visited more often ... i just keep forgetting its there!   The drinks are superb and the decor interesting. They have cool art work on the walls and the mixture of texture in the furniture gives it a really distinct ambience.  There are often cuties hanging out ... cool videograpy (is that even a word??) and more often that not some chilled tunes ..

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: Try the pear vodka/lychee juice concoction. Not sure what it's called, but it's pretty damn good. Beyond that, expect to pay a $5 cover on certain nights, and the crowd can vary widely depending on the night, but it's much better than at least 500 other bars in town, so it's all good.

QOlY5FYliVVvkgqgtjdP_w.review_text: I live 1/2 a block from the Madrone.  Its gravitational pull always coerces me to have "one more drink" after I get out of the cab from any other hood.  I am simply compelled (a la the power of christ) to have a drink here.  If you see me at 1 am, take pity.  perhaps buy me that stella i need to drink before stumbling home.  just know that i am helpless...

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: apparently drew barrymore and the apple dude was here last night, but that's not why i'm writing an update.  i'm writing an update to give big ups to the new owner, mike.  thanks for the drink and the passes and i wish you the best!

FeAVcwJ5XCJdjc9-atv1yA.review_text: So I got an e-mail from the owner of the place to let me know that it's an art bar because they have 30-odd pieces of art in the place that rotates piece by piece.  He also mentioned that the night I went was a 3.5 year anniversary party for the DJ so it was especially loud and dark in there that night.  If I had come in before 9, it would have been more "loungy".  Finally, he stated that the place has different programming each night to cater to a variety of crowds.    I thought it was nice of him to respond to my review.  I'm gonna go back and check it out on a different night.

iYeOigbzvpgtCfr_wbOawQ.review_text: It's on a corner. I am so dang partial to that. I can't say why, something about the view? the Feng Shui? I just like it. LOVE the sign 4shure as well as the big windows.   Decor is smooth and inviting.  I popped in on a TH nite in June09 after a show at The Independent. It was south of the border night full of girls who know how to swing their hips at birth. Cute, polite crowd.   Dance floor was spacious on a weeknight and I like how the DJ is right there to interact with the crowd.   A great place to post party if the show at The Independent closes early or you drop off a dud date and still want the night to end right.

o6Dyk-73MhSG3RPM4rLrhw.review_text: Good spot for a midweek dance party.  And Burberry shotguns.

HT8kyFqLLDsyHGZ34LMtcw.review_text: Good happy hour.  3 dollar wells, 5 dollar mojitos (which are quite tasty), 1 dollar off draft beers, and cheap PBR (if that's your thing).  Also a good selection of mixed drinks.  Good use of ginger beer in many of the drinks (I'm a big fan!).  My favorite shot to point out is the Ike Turner.  A shot of Henny followed by a slap to the face... I'm still waiting for a hot bartender to work the bar when I visit... so she can administer the slap =).

INB2_iiyysmYmnKXsM1uvA.review_text: A few years back, this was my favorite spot. Great art, hand-crafted infused vodka cocktails and a nice venue.  I've come to say "It's not my favorite" of recent trips. Why? Mostly the service.  We went in planning to spend 3 martini's here and do some serious chat-catch-up. The 1st round (we were sitting @ the bar) took about 10 minutes to get one of the 2 male bartenders attention. Our empty glasses sat on the bar right in front of one of them and the new bartender arrival as they talked and set up the well for the coming evening.   We were there about 7PM..... I finally flagged down the bartender (standing RIGHT in front of me, ignoring our 15 minute empty glasses) and ordered a 2nd round. I watched as he went to the register, pulled $ out and then seemed to tip out/count out and leave.  HUH?! The female bartender coming on eventually came to us and took the order, made the drinks as if we were interrupting her placing mats chore and gave them to us without so much as a smile.  The sign on the wall was what got me.  (and our 3rd drink to cease existence) It read(s): "Bartenders live complicated lives;  therefore all drinks on this menu are to be made at the bartenders discretion, depending on how busy he or she is, mood, or available ingredients."   --Sounds like a "we are better than you, so just wait and we'll get to you when we damn well feel like it"  Shame, could have been a good night.....  **PS. After writing this review, the owner, Mike has responded to me and I feel satisfied there is an action plan in the works so this doesn't happen anymore.   I don't mean to be mean, I just like good/friendly/prompt service (& tip healthy for it!) Thank You again Mike, I'll be in soon and look forward to saying a proper hello! (rating changed too!)

A5S0h5ACmIfRQMLchv8XPg.review_text: The drinks are pretty cheap here, about $5 for a mixed cocktail.  Kind of small, decent music if there's a good DJ, but parking is a biotch!!  This place would not be on the top of my fav bars to go to.  Not even if I'm that bored.

_mr1Zm77bB9uUlna-XfEvw.review_text: A fun, easy going - no fuss place. Great if you want to dance but don't want to dress up (although whats the point then ;P). Great crowd, a chilled happy vibe. Minus 2 coz my drink was too weak :\ next time (and there surely will be one) I plan to get happy before I get there ;)

Pf7FI0OukC_CEcCz0ZxoUw.review_text: I dub this bar "dance-closet."   Tell me I'm wrong.    But it does kinda rock, and I like that when I walk in I don't hear top-40 or whatever flavor of the day, I hear actual world beat, salsa, or something else rad. Plus, even with a pizzACKED bar, the 'tenders keep the drinks coming fast and furious.   Word up.

qYoqDt1X8x3g6O828-NSwA.review_text: Madrone?  Don't forget your tweed pub cap, and vintage tee.    I've been there twice, okay.  I'm just going to start right off with honesty.  However, both times were birthday parties I couldn't avoid.  No more birthday parties, no more Madrone.  Did you need more discouragement than the "Prince vs. Michael" party?  Do you really need to ask who's better?  No. You don't.    Yes, you're going to need a really stiff drink if you're being forced to stay here more than 90 seconds.  But, bad news for you, your drinks are being shipped  USP Ground which takes 5-7 business days and just happens to span a national holiday.  I'll pour my own drink, thanks.  Oh, wait, WTF is this, Budweiser?  Oh, shit, this just keeps getting worse.  This is one of those bars that makes me feel like I'm at a frat party .  You know how, when the frat daddies finally leave school, there's this slight metamorphosis into "stoner frat boy", "electronic music frat boy", "AC/DC frat boy" (this one really pisses me off), "Dave Matthews frat boy" and "Prince vs. Michael frat boy."  Well, they're all here at Madrone.   They're all here and they're all so damn cool.  Yep, it's a breeding pit in there.  And before you say anything, know this:  I know that I'm a completely sarcastic and acerbic asshole who just likes to dog on shit that other people like, but hey, not all the time, and hey, maybe someone out there is a bitter, sarcastic asshole too and needs to be warned, this place will send you into twitching paroxysms of discomfort.    The Page is only two blocks to the south; go there.  Like I just said to another Madrone reviewer, the great thing about The Page is, it's only two blocks away, so if you had a bazooka, you could destroy Madrone without leaving your drink unattended.

sgTNHoh04BaPE3xMVpFCDQ.review_text: This place was a four star before the epic fail that was their entertainment line up this last Saturday.  Let me start with the good. The Venue is a little small, but the dance floor is nice and big, and the bartenders move with speed. These, are all good things. It gets warm in here, but the giant fans and velvet couches help cool things off. This bar was an instant 3 stars in my book for offering 6 dollar martinis everytime I have been there. This makes daddy very very happy. This bar offers a good cheap drunk, without  scummy patrons.  On the more epic side, this bar has a Prince vs. Micheal Jackson dance party once a month. I have attended, and it is certainly fun. Who wins the battle you ask ? Prince. He slept with Carmen Electra. Micheal is into little boys.  After Hailey P.'s birthday dinner at Bar 821, we all came here again to get our dance on. We waited for a solid 45 minutes to get the dj to stop playing a mix of lame skateboard trick videos. I am serious. skateboarding tricks. If I want to see kick flips and ollies, I would of stayed home with youtube. Besides being lame, it totally killed on the Saturday night vibe. FAIL MADRONE ! CUT IT OUT !   Haiku !  Skateboarding vids lame Drown the anger with alcohol Dirty gins saved me  Talent Level ? This bar has a mixed bag of talent, and it always seems to have a ton of dudes. Luckily, when they are poorly groomed skateboarders, they do little more then take up space.

um9XhouzTg4zZC5fVwCMVw.review_text: Vodka infused drinks were medicore.  The music did not match the ambiance.  This is what my friend calls the Gangsta's Paradise.

QsJ3KhIeFW6cUEBrD7CaZA.review_text: Best place to order a red wine spritzer.  For some reason, on the way over there, I started craving a red wine spritzer...who does that? I've heard of a white wine spritzer, but not this.  But I ordered one.  I felt like I should have been in Connecticut or maybe even in a trailer eating a chicken pot pie.  If this means that I'm down the road to only enjoying white zin out of a box, then I may never be able to go here again.  Cuz, I'll clearly blame Madrone, not me.   Me: "Um, can I get a red wine spritzer?" (voice seeping in self-judgment) Bartender: "what?" Me: "can I get a red wine spritzer?"  Bartender: "I don't even know how to make that." Me: "it's red wine with a splash of soda." Bartender: "like 7Up?" Me: "No, like soda water." (silently judging bartender for her suggestion--but she redeemed herself because she not only gave me a hella huge ass pint glass for my red wine spritzer, but she also backed me up when my friend started raggin' on me--"no, that looks really refreshing.")  Came here on a Tuesday night, first time on a week night for me.     The Good:  The dj was awesome--and appropropriately upped the ante as the night wore on.  I got there around 8 to meet up with a new-ish friend, and we could talk easily enough for a while.  Then he, the dj,  gradually turned to heavier beats and louder volume as the crowd grew.  The bartenders were pleasant (see above) and efficient and didn't make me reach the $20 minimum in order to use a credit card, which was really nice of them.    The Eh:  No food.  Apparently that is "on its way" but that's not soon enough for me. And the crowd was not really that great.  It was good for people watching and talking shit about them all, but not for mingling or meeting attractive people...yeah, not really an attractive or interesting crowd.  There I said it.

zvKDfdMm6K_xcc1i4GT5Yg.review_text: My girls and I came here to celebrate our birthdays on Prince and Michael Jackson night. Absolutely loved it. The bouncers are really really cool, the crowd was cool, location is cool. One thing that made me only give it 4 stars though, it was too damn hot inside. Even with several fans all around, it felt like a sauna. I love the bouncers for letting us come in and out to get some air! Will definitely recommend this place and come prepared next time in a swimsuit and ponytail.  hahaha

hpr2GK6-7uPuh591RKLtfQ.review_text: We came here on an off day during happy hour, but this place is awesome. Free fortune cookies at the door, friendly regulars, unique drinks. Big ups to Jarveez for makin with the nice-nice and hookin up some samples. This is my new neighborhood watering hole for sure.

y3Gb0zhTZQO1SMS8xluoxA.review_text: Minus a star for charging a $5 cover for a lame 80s music DJ.  Plus a star for fresh squeezing the juice for my tequila gimlet.  Nice that there is a place with action in this 'hood.

0-TeFfTcygluUSekhnTntQ.review_text: Checked this place out on Motown Monday, and thought it was okay at best.  The music was fun, and they had a pretty good happy hour deal for drinks. I think rail booze was 4 bucks.  The decor was cool too, but there were way too many hipsters French kissing each other at the bar. So many ironic mustaches in so many mouths.

jcMYdym6lR3kTY-1Ep-m1Q.review_text: I can see why everyone calls this place a good happy hour spot and thats it.  Pause for a second to take a look around the room you are in. Chances are that where ever you are right now is bigger than Madrone.  This place is super small, and to make things worse, the live band/DJ take up what little space there is. While watching 2 bartenders try to work the only bar and both on one side of the bar, i see a sign that reads "Maximum Capacity 75 people" first off, they must have paid off the inspector just for that sign, because there was about 50 people there and it was unmovable. so after reading that sign I ask the guy standing in front of me how long he has been waiting for a drink; "10 minutes and counting". As I see both bartenders nowhere near our side i decide to make my way out while i can still see the door.  15 minutes there= $5 entry, 2 inches of personal space all around, and a view of the bartender's backside. Don't come here on a Saturday night.

0RHUgJ-dwwu7fR_FtzOh2w.review_text: I came to Madrone for two of my friend's birthdays and it was supposed to be 80's night. Midway through us being there I requested Prince (which I'm SUPER sad I missed the Prince vs. MJ Night -PRINCE WINS BTW!!!) but the DJ didn't even play it until WAY into the night... Anyway, my point is: the DJ could have been a little better about doing his homework, actually playing some 80s music, but it was still fun and danceworthy!  I was STOKED that they had Strongbow tall cans! (EEP! ONE of MY FAVEs FROM LONDON!  So who ever said they should stick to one "style"- Don't listen to them Madrone!!! Keep it class with your tall cans and whispy art on the walls.

dWD5j7Dg7dZUb29QbJeo4Q.review_text: Came here on a Sunday night and there were a fair number of people. From the other reviews, sounds like it gets packed. Anyways, it seemed like a lot of locals go there, but they are all really friendly, and talkative. A couple of times they would just start a conversation, really made me feel like I want to go back. We mostly went for the live music, who were really a mix of jazz and latin than pure jazz. They were still really good and played for 1.5hrs, took a break, then came back on.   And I am not sure if the bar is dog friendly, or if that was the owner, but there was a 6 month old mastiffe sniffing around lol.

JGCl9_pVdard7b316lhsmw.review_text: Chill Beats, Cozy Atmosphere, and Infused Vodka Drinks:  This is a great place to meet up with some friends and kick back.   Very relaxed atmosphere, they often have good beats, and the staff is friendly.  They also offer a nice selection of infused vodka drinks.  Good place.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: chill..friendly...hip...comfortable...i'm loungin'....come have a chat with me....i'll get you a drink...affordable....$3 beers...$5 well drinks....$6 for "other"...bargain drinks at happy hours....eclectic mix of tunes in the background....perfect to sip a drink and socialize....

QvyzSHhufjRiUnxUVyMLPg.review_text: Half off drinks on Industry night Sunday nights... Hold on one second while I crap myself... WOW! An awesome dj, cool decor, Death & Taxes on tap!  One star off for closing at midnight.

dhuWV1YmyMhjCTS4bh1uoA.review_text:
Came here with my bf last night for the Fela Kuti birthday tribute and it was awesome. The DJs were jammin' and we had a great time. 
  Very cool space with neat decor. It's one room and not very spacious. It's a art lounge and there are comfy sofas and chairs that line one side of the wall. I like the dark blue walls and the painting over the bar is awesome! 
  They have an extensive menu of infused vodkas and I went with the pear on the rocks. It was NOT good at all. I could hardly taste the pear. It just tasted like bad vodka. However, the boy tried the Oatmeal Stout and it was awesome - an after taste of toast. How cool is that??? 
  The only thing I did not enjoy, besides the infused vodka, was how they had a photographer taking pictures and the flash was super bright and blinding.
  I would definitely come back and check out another show.

8AmXdbnrRo2YKX90KRTKEA.review_text: I doubt this place needs my praises as there's 500 million reviews already on here but I went here after the Albert Hammond Jr Concert on Sunday, though it was not the first time I'd been there. It was the first time I realized that I really dig this place. There's always a new friend to meet, the couches are conductive to eavesdropping or giving some guy a thumbs up for his mad skills only to find out that he's gay and his female companion is more interested in making you understand that self-deprecating is no longer in. We all have to hot and nasty!  On warning though, just cause it's infused vodka doesn't mean that it's not vodka. Some of us found out the hard way or should I say some of don't even remember going to madrone, while others forgot to lock the WC and had someone walk in on them. So wear you nice panties. I recommend the cucumber! Cheers.

cj7jJnSOPaeZIJo9jJYsqg.review_text: Overall a good spot.  Good DJ and fun dancing (tight space but still, who cares if you have a "dent").  Fun times especially since I ventured out of my hood.  I would say it was worth it!

_XFhTYX3wS0ftGc9u4pLqw.review_text: Love the music, love the atmosphere, love the crowd.    Although the staff could use a slight attitude adjustment, but I'll deal - with decently priced drinks, a nice space for a dance floor, funky themed parties almost every night of the week, and ceiling and walls adorned with art, you really can't go wrong here.    Minus one star for a $5 cover. Just up the drink prices by $1 or $2!

uYs60IPTrCFXOrq7dUq0_g.review_text: I really like this spot. It's a nice place to chill out with friends or by yourself. The front of the bar is full of comfy seating that typically boasts at least a handful of laptops thanks to free WiFi. It has a very chill vibe (and super cheap drinks) until happy hour. The evening is still comfortable for nerding out even as the place starts to fill up.   They've had a live DJ every night I stuck around, and the new speaker system is aimed toward the back so you can have a decent conversation in the front. Bartenders are awesome, and after helping the doorman with his iPod I got a handful of drinks on him.   With lots of cool art on the walls and a solid wood bar that still boasts knots it's both unique and compelling. Definitely a good looking place with a great atmosphere and excellent service.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: This place has black toilets which sort of freaks me out. How can you tell if a black toilet is clean?   But, then, after a few house made infused vodka cocktails who the hell cares....it will probably be my friends puking in the bathroom anyhow, because I hang out with a classy bunch who knows moderation.   As with about 99/100ths of the bars in the city this place is best enjoyed on a weeknight. The prices are better and you will actually get to enjoy sitting on one of their antique chairs or couches, listening to DJs who know how to mix some decent tunes and might even manage to get a drink from the bartenders who tend to take their sweet ass time.   Sit back, relax and enjoy it, or get up and dance on their smallish dance floor if you are so inclined. They may even be playing one of the many many Godzilla movies projected on the back wall. Those movies are a whole new ballgame when you are seeing double!

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: Been here a couple times on Fri/Sat. nights. The crowd can get rowdy/fratty, which can be fun depending on what mood you're in.  The music is cool -- it definitely offers something different than other dance clubs and bars, and I like that it attempts to be a cross between the two. However, I'm not sure it achieves this hybrid successfully ... there isn't always enough space to dance and sometimes the music doesn't seem loud enough or even dancey enough. But there's not much space to sit and chat/enjoy your drinks either.   Personally, if I'm in the mood for dancing, I'd go elsewhere, and if I'm in the mood for not-dancing, I'd also go elsewhere. But if I'm dragged here by friends I'll have a good time.

EuF8YqE9Z425jf_AfFrPzA.review_text: I've only ever been to Madrone for the Prince and Michael Experience! First Saturday of every month :D I love this event and the bar itself isn't bad either. My only bone to pick is that it gets Hot. As. All. Hell. I have to make sure I'm wearing something airy and have my hair up, and even then I'm a sweaty mess when I walk out. Partly because we dance hard lol.. They've got a big fan running next to the door but it seems like they could do more for the temperature.  Drink prices aren't cheap but they're not a ripoff either. I wish the line wasn't so long, but hey, you have to respect that they observe the fire codes. Clubs are no fun when you can barely move.. and the art on the walls is always cool to look at during the Prince songs (I'm there for Michael) :P  The clientele are always nice young folks. No fights, no falling-down drunks, minimal slutty club girls.. and I always get compliments on my sequin glove :D

ghaEnX_Wzc8Vfc1kVm_NAQ.review_text: Madrone's MJ vs. Prince night was so fun, I didn't even mind the crowd.  And with the minimal $5 cover, reasonably priced and extensive drink selection, I can see why people pack themselves in!  The crowd was like someone gathered people from every neighborhood in the city, shook them up, and poured them all into Madrone.  We had your too-cool-for-school hipsters, "I'm just here to dance" kid, serious hip hoppers, and a few "diving" from the upscale neighborhoods-- just to name a few.  What did we all have in common?  Michael Jackson!!  Okay, that's not quite true.  But hey, it's a night of MJ vs. Prince, and you can guess who I rooted for...

e-Bh0XDCOgYMaC-BmdxkAQ.review_text: Nice and relaxed neighborhood bar/lounge with an art theme.  Hang with some friends and it's like being in someones living room, drinks on the coffee table with cool tunes in the background, only here you have access to a crew of bartenders and a selection of infused vodkas, niiiiice.    Bathrooms are clean and there is an overall good vibe here.  That's all i really ask for in a neighborhood bar.  i know, i'm easy.

ekaQsTZ_PlxR88xtHgZtcA.review_text: Native Americans used the majestic Madrone as an "air-conditioning" tree.  Due to it's unique ability to remain cool to touch even in hot temperatures, the people would climb up and lounge on the cool branches to chill out.  Madrone Art bar isn't exactly majestic or overly temperature-controlled, but it is a great place to chill out.  I like weekdays for their theme nights and lack of insane-crowdatude and not-enough-bathrooms-athon you get on weekends here.  Sundays have been pretty fun board-game nights in the past.  My current favorite is Tuesday with an awesome jazz band and $2 Jamesons (also $2 cover, $2 Tecate).  There's a fantastic bartender that night (who might be named Jake?), who makes perfect drinks out of the perfect recipes they boast here.  (Do try the house-made vodka infusions.)  Bathrooms are consistent with most run-of-the-mill bars in SF: slightly creepy, with black surfaces which you try not to touch in any way.  These are made up for, in part, by the interesting decor within the bar.  My favorite installations include the Morton salt girl TV display and the deer with guns for antlers (vegetarian much?).  Overall, a very pleasant weekday chill-out spot.

Md0_pZJPXnrS_tU6AzeIFQ.review_text: I've had many wonderful times here on a Monday night.  It's always random: either very empty, or really packed.  One night my room mate and I saw Michel Gondry's girlfriend showcase her music/films there (which uh kinda sucked, but made a fun story). Either way, its a cool place to be on week nights. Dunno about weekends tho, I don't like paying cover.  Monday night's bartender is named Ashley (sp?). He's super cool and getting his masters in design. He has 33 eye lashes on his left eye and his social security number is 432-234-4689. Yeah, i go here a lot.

2--3--v8yHU3a3FljCcBRg.review_text: I like this place.  The decor and wall art makes you feel like you're in some avant-garde painting.  Prices are decent and there's always a DJ spinnin the 1s and 2s.  I don't even know what that means but there is usually a DJ.  I haven't really been here when it's crowded, but watch out-- on the one or two hot days in SF, this place is an OVEN.    and if there's one place you don't want to be stuck in with a bunch of new-age artsy hippie types, it's a hot, sweaty oven.

kpp9pcXp6CwBJfGp0XD_yg.review_text: I was here on a Fringe night. Loved the music,  but I felt the videos were distracting me from dancing. I liked the art display a lot and the service at the bar was the BUSINESS!! Hella attentive, even when I stood far away from the bar to look at a menu, one of the bartenders waved ME down and took my order. I like when bartenders pay attention to their customers. I had fun here; it felt like I was in a Vice magazine filled with Vice Do's, I just wish I was drunk enough to dance. They have a photobooth, but I think you need tokens from the bar.  I wouldn't mind coming here again.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: Oh Madrone, you let me down.  A $5 cover on a Friday night and the music was terrible. Sure the crowd is fun, but when your drinks are weak and the music isn't poppin, it will take a lot for me to return.

JzmJ6U20uJ9pZonwKGvMuA.review_text: I'm ashamed to admit that I lived within a few blocks of Madrone for years and never went until a few months before I left the neighborhood.  DJ's/clubs aren't my scene, and that's the impression that I had of the place due to the lines/cover charges.  What it actually is, is a great local bar with an awesome cocktail selection and a good beer selection as well.  Just come here early and you'll have a great low key evening with some tasty beverages.  Later on though they bring in DJ's and charge a cover, so that's your signal to move down the street to the Page.  This place is also a great place to have a few cocktails while you wait for your table at Nopa down the street.  In short Madrone Happy Hour - Chill and awesome Madrone Evening - Too cool for school crowd/clubby/hipster.

8_Hs9Bh5tgFdc_1ycxHChg.review_text: What can you do on a random first Wednesday night of the month? If you are looking for a good time for the least amount of money, come to Madrone.  The free comedy show is actually really entertaining and I laughed out loud for a lot of the performers (I am a tough crowd). There is limited seating so if you get there early you can get a drink for happy hour and sit down.  ...If you dont get there early, be prepared to be mocked by the comedians because the entrance is right next to the stage. You will walk in to the bar in the direction everyone is facing, which seems a little intimidating (as well as the bathrooms).  The decor on the walls are really cool. A burberry looking rifle over the bar and a dear with guns for antlers. Interesting. The menu is written with chalk on a blackboard. I thought that was cool.  Funny people, cheap drinks, cool ambiance. I would go to the comedy show again next month.

Akv9Tj5uQWZEuy4ymbe9gw.review_text: Great place to hang out. The staff was super friendly the day I went there and the music was banging. I went there for the party TROPICANA, one of the best parties in the bay area hands down.

Gq5D1V5jwrYPpOxfwM5lag.review_text: Sad. When i used to live in San Francisco this spot was always packed and dependable for a good time.  One year later.. we paid a $5 cover for a half empty, awkward crowd standing around while awful reggae music  played from the stubborn dj. They still have the video screen but even the movie wasn't enough of a distraction. We were just plain bored here. My friend says the week nights are fun...just don't come here on a Friday or a Saturday. What a waste.

9tShZmVcow-Q1Tjw9zl1Iw.review_text: I spent New Years here and what a crowd! It was jam packed but everyone was smiling, moving (as best they could) to the fantastic music and having a good time. There is usually a modest cover after 9:PM. This keeps the crowd down to a manageable size (usually). But it also means that locals can slip in for a quiet drink before then and chat with whoever. I met the owner on New Years. Michael, you are a great person! But I also often go for an early nightcap with my buddy who also lives nearby because they have my favorite tequila, El Tesoro's repasado (the silver is good, too). Check out their Web site before you go: madronelounge.com. Thursdays have been Salsa Night, Tuesdays have been Boogaloo Jazz, Fridays have been Motown, so be sure you  go on a night where you can get your groove on.

mO5VWLI4iVf5o7ghJqGtUQ.review_text: I've been to this bar twice. The first time there was way too many people who looked the same. It was definitely very yuppified that night. The second time was a much better scene. It's becoming a good intimate local watering hole.

whfjd0gIdtPXLTZKmNYqZQ.review_text: really interesting local bar, delicious infused vodkas and cute people :)

yQTLwYbZTtX7Drcn67TEMQ.review_text: Went here last Friday with a good group of friends.   $5 cover (worth it)  PROS - Deer head on wall with AK-47's attached to antlers. Awesome. - DJ was bumpin hella 90's hits - No "strict" dress code - Good sized dance floor (especially at the end of the night when it clears up) - Bartenders were very attentive - 1930's-ish Porn playing on the rear projector. Keepin it classy.  CONS - Bathrooms connected to the dance floor. No deuces people! - Around 1am, I set my beer down to dance for a bit and I'm pretty sure that some dude cleaning the place up mistook my beer for an empty one. Twice. I was kinda drunk but that was annoying. Note: Put a napkin on top next time.

GhQcDDY4e6b0FpfwJdx3IA.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and this is one of my favorite bars. It looks cool, has a good beer and cocktail selection, and a weekly program including live music. Not much space to sit but a great place to hang out.

xtHQTJIlUqGa_jCMXLTEiw.review_text: As the sober friend of the group, I am always on the hunt for great bars that won't annoy me come midnight.  I love the couches, the mellow vibe, and the selection of non-alcoholic drinks.  I have heard from my lush friends that the infused vodkas are the cat's meow, but cannot vouch for this personally. Avoid this joint on the weekends after 11:00.  Not fun.  As others have mentioned, it gets mighty sweaty.  Mighty sweaty=gross=not fun. Weeknights are great, and happy hour is even better.

qD1G80F6gqCdazvf38AkmQ.review_text: Came here on a 90s night- the music was good, the DJ did not disappoint, the acoustics were great and the music videos projected on all walls were a bonus. The bar is not well ventilated though, so it smelled like sweat and was really hot. The service at the bar was fast, but as with many SF bars in this part of town, it was all cash - which can be annoying. Overall a good time, but not worth the line outside and the surprising cover of $5.

tHgPhoPRaSyGV7GWfB2osA.review_text: Thankfully I haven't experienced the crowded throngs on the weekend.  For Sunday night happy hour it was cheap (but decent) beer, free pizza, comfy couches, and a DJ spinning some great soul. And it was just down the street from me. I'll have to check it out again.

UZ6YOaTiZ1lTZWKASIkVuA.review_text: I really like this spot, but I can see how it's teetering on the edge of becoming too much of a scene. A little crowded but still managed to get a seat. Otherwise, love the music (especially on Friday nights which definitely merits the $3 cover) and the pineapple infused vodka. The happy hour's not bad, either.

lcgsrE4JO6UfcsKzX13H5A.review_text: I will fuck up Madrone any day of the week.  As all my friends have said, it's wack attack after 9:30 PM or so.  ALTHOUGH one time I was there when this 6-piece band was playing soundtracks LIVE to old communist animated films while the films were projected in the background.  Not exactly my thing, but that was totally unbelievable in that "the one time I actually had fun at an event with my hippie friend Steve" kinda way.  I'm guessing for most people that's an Os Mutantes show.  Here's my only addition - what rules about madrone is that not only can you get drinks for like 2 bucks cuz there's always something on special, but even when you do fork over 6 or 7 bucks for a nice drink, they hook it up.  I'd rather have a 5 ounce shot on the rocks for 7 bucks than a 2 ounce one for 5, right?   Madrone basically wants to hook me up, whether it's with free pizza, myriad drink specials, or just bartenders who are not interested in being a cockface for some reason.  Manhattan on the rocks: 4 stars.

W35eV_BkLI4qC0mmwJ6QWw.review_text: If you order an Ike Turner, the bartender really does slap you.  It's my new favorite drink.

0_ZaxkbEaehSla52KYiz1A.review_text: Definitely a legit bar. $5 cover, decent selection of beer, not too pricey, and a very cool artsy atmosphere.  Coming from Wisconsin I always hope that bars here in SF will have a good selection of beer. The selection was pretty decent and they did have the Lunatic Lager which I found to be pretty delicious.   As far as atmosphere goes I'd say this is where they really excelled. I came on an 80s night so they had old school 80s videoson big projectors with awesome dance/techno remixes of classic 80s songs. The music was pretty loud which made talking slightly difficult but definitely possible. Most people were standing closer to the bar and there was a DJ with a small dance floor going on towards the front of the bar. Also, the art all around the bar set a really cool artsy mood and also provided topics for conversation.  Overall definitely a very cool bar, not somewhere I would go casually or very often because of the cover and music volume..but if I'm planning on a long night of debauchery...this is definitely an awesome place to stay.

ivEai27DRDFUoTqRhEGvnQ.review_text: This place BLOWS. The drinks sucks (screw the fancy flavored vodkas, try mastering a simple drink first!), the bartenders are inattentive and poorly trained and the crowd is bizarre, creating a bad vibe.  It could be so great. Once in a while I give it another try, but then I remember again and again how bad it sucks, so I eventually leave and walk down to the Page, which always delivers.

JjXoayGvODG9xJYXCeuelQ.review_text: Pisco Llama, Afrolicious:  great space, awesome cocktails, low cover, fun DJs. A sense of foreboding from the Burberry machine gun; Morton girl with her tiny black and white TV.  Although it's a great space, this place can get *way* too packed on the weekends. The effect of a DJ is limited if there is no room to dance and there are drinks spilled all over the floor. It'd be more fun with a limit on crowd size.

SsXhZwicVuRrotTwPQhhHA.review_text: The furniture is so cool!  So, I like coming here on weekdays when you can actually find a seat. You'll find me here on Wednesdays, when my roommate is running the sound.

-eRfdiI6gmGyKYvckXxvhA.review_text: Madrone's is either empty or too packed to move, let alone dance.  A lot of pushing goes on, but I still like the place.  No pool or anything, just couches, music, dancefloor & drinks.

uGrP-EpdTjn_-3bWG172Rw.review_text: Love, love, love Madrone!! Small bar/lounge, but what I love the most is the vibe and free atmosphere. Dance floor is NEVER empty (although it is small), and no one gives a f*ck about how they look. It's just good, fun-lovin vibes all around.   Minus one star just because it gets sooo packed sometimes and really hot. But I still love it!   Drinks are also really tasty. Love the "Lola" just because it's name after my Lola :) And it's delicious!  Will definitely continue coming back here for good dance nights in the city.

dJAoG82CBmiKc3Nb2YfQdw.review_text: I'm torn about this place ... I love it on weekdays. The bartenders pour generously, you can get a seat, and there's no cover. Also, they are one of the few bars on Divis that actually serve hard alcohol ... yes, they have drinks besides those BS Soju and Sake cocktails.  The weekends tell another story ... $5 cover? 20 minutes to get a drink? Line for the bathroom? ... I'll pass

c9MOCO73ZRrFClBLzRf0Jw.review_text: I was there meeting up w/ a good of gfs last Thursday.  I liked the ambience (e.g. bar & gallery) although the bartender lady was terribly rude and abrasive!  The place was dead when we 1st got there (around 7:30pm) so she really has no excuse to be in a bad mood already!   me: "i think i'm going to order some food" bitchy bartender: "well, a lot of stuff are out" me: "oh. then can you tell me which one you have?" bitchy bartender: "no, why don't you tell me what you want" me: "what about the guacamole & chips?" bitchy bartender: "that's out" me: "so what do you have?" bitchy bartender: "what do you want?"   .... obviously this goes on for awhile. but you get the point.  The 2 stars are the cushy/homy seating and the ambience.

iF-Nz3c7ickNeCBx0Ha8mA.review_text: "So, *sorry!*, it's..... CAN YOU HEAR ME? *SORRY!*, I CAN BARELY MOVE AROUND IN HERE, *SORRY!* WHERE DID WHATS HIS NAME GO?... LETS JUST TALK OUTSIDE!..................................jesus it's crowded in there, I wish we could get one of those seats. You wanna leave soon? Aight."  *Note if you don't wanna pay cover, the side emergency door can be shimmied open easily.

TN-SMdPNdWv2gHSzGqGHzQ.review_text: Live band. Cheap. Nice Crowd of different backgrounds and ages. It was nice to get away from the Polk Gulch which I have become too familiar with.   Bottom Line: Come with some friends and expect to have a great night  full of great music and fun.

nABNMFzBQYavnu4zxY_5Kg.review_text: I don't know if this place works or not, but we had a lot of fun. "Laugh In"-style phrases painted on the wall, giant TV screen in the back that was playing Saturday Night Fever when we came in.  At some point, they switched to a custom mashup of 90s hip-hop videos, which transfixed pretty much everyone in the bar, including me.  Good selection of liquors, and they make a decent Manhattan. (Iowans: This is where they've been hiding all the Templeton Rye you can't find at home.)  Ordered my friend a El Tesoro, and they poured out about 3 oz for the price of 1. I'll remember that for next time!

yN3cBeSdhtFRcFPdLgDlbw.review_text: I liked the ambiance of the place, and the comfy couches and chairs as well as the strong drink I received.   OH WAIT.  Thaaaaat's right.
