It took me about 20 minutes to get a drink (thanks to the cutie bartender who was polite) between 3 bartenders, at a  bar that wasn't really all that packed. Hmmm.......I have this feeling that service isn't the highlight of this bar. Although I did get the eyeball from the female bartender (who it seems like on the reviews isn't particularly friendly) when she noticed I carried a certain purse, and then promptly walked a few feet away and helped some other girl waiting after me. NICE.  I liked the music the dj was spinning and the general crowd, as it didn't seem too Marina-esque (a nice change from my neighborhood) nor did it seem to be the equally pretentious hipster scene.  I am also amused by the nomenclature of " WC" for the bathrooms. All night long  I heard, "what is WC?". Any place that can allow people to pause at 2 letters on a door gets a star in my book. (WC by the way stands for "water closet").

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: one of my favorite bar/lounge/clubs in all of san francisco.  motown night is the spot to be on mondays. (un)fortunately, it's exploded in popularity recently, so you really need to get there before 9/9:15 to avoid waiting in a huge line (yes you read that right, on a monday). everybody's getting down to awesome motown jams, and it's just an all-around good time (and unlike most other clubs on most nights, it picks up really early, so you can still get your groove on for a couple of hours and be in bed at a reasonable hour.  yes, the wait in the line can be long, but that's because they're one of the few clubs that isn't super greedy and doesn't try to pack in as many people as possible (and violate fire codes too) - it's certainly crowded on mondays, but not uncomfortably so, and there's always a little area in back that's more lounge-y.  but aside from that, they also have really excellent drinks (very smartly written on a huge chalkboard), and always a great selection of art.   true neighborhood gem.

1E-qee5VF4vRkZTeeFYurw.review_text: There are not a lot of dance options in the area but Madrone makes it worth the trip elsewhere.  It draws a crowd of neighborhood locals making due with this second rate dance venue that does not seem to know that it is sub-par.  The cover charge at the door is unnecessary as there is never a line and nothing special inside.  Then you will notice the lighting is obscenely BRIGHT, maybe the dimmer switch broke off but it is a real mood killer - feels like they are closing the bar down at all times.  Expect to pay more than you would think for drinks in this type of place as well - beers are around $5, mixed drinks are around $8.    The few good points - it is large enough so that if you want to talk you can go in the rear and it is not too loud.  The music is pretty good as well - lots of 80's and hip-hop.

M8m7xcwGHueY86bA0GVhJQ.review_text: First bar I went to since I moved here from Santa Cruz ( so that could explain a lot), but i thoroughly enjoyed Madrone.  Great live jazz.........

ehy7SI1jcZAeZUo8wdSADg.review_text: I went on a Thursday night and by 9:30 the line for the bar was almost to the front door--probably because they only had one bartender working. The drink list was impossible to parse; something is $4 except on Mondays and if you're local it's cheaper except if it's not and it's Wednesday in which case you take a dollar off something else but then you remember it's Thursday and you just throw the menu across the bar and order what you secretly came in there to order anyway--way too many PBRs. Oh, and even though tea and coffee are listed with prices on the menu, the bartender will tell you that "there's a coffeeshop over there *waves in the direction of N Divisadero* if you want that kind of thing" when you ask for coffee in order to sober up after your 11ty-th beer.   At least the DJ was hot.

lOMM7HTHhabi1qofd-w7zw.review_text: "Everyone in the car in on parking spot patrol! You understand this, I'm not f'in kidding now!" The words escape my lips everytime I'm in that neighborhood, as I don't have a Smart car, it's a little trickier to get my four door sedan into a spot without the front of my hood peeking precariously into the red zones.   Madrone is on the corner of Divis and Fell (Divisadero for those new to the area or not loca (thats insane local people FYI)) in an area that has been up and coming for years now. Spotted with late night bars and great food, the thing most difficult about coming here is, as I've already duly noted, the parking.   You won't find me at Madrone often, due to the inability to breathe or move really through the tiny establishment, unless it's a night like tonight, the third Saturday of the month, for PVM. For those unaccustomed to the acronym, thats Prince Versus Michael. The all important evening for us 80's whores still holding on to our leg warmers and arm cozies from 1986. A battle occurs at midnight, after rockin' out to nothing but the king of pop and my petite latin friend for hours, allowing the crowd to somewhat dance battle (or at least we do) who takes the crown for the evening. The cover is cheap, about 5 bucks, so it's affordable for those looking for a low maintenance night without all the drama.  It's a pain in the ass for me to get to the bar, and I don't usually have the patience to wait and get their attention anyway. So these nights tend to be sober ones, and we still have a bangin' time. My girl Meredith posts in her usual location, the unofficial queen of PVM, by the large fan (also the only space that has available oxygen) in the front of the room right next to the D.J. You can feel the bass go through your heels and into your fly ass booty, helping you move it and shake as we reminisce of the days when rent was paid for you and cigarettes still only cost $2.15.   The bathroom always has a line for it, which for I have no patience to wait. Usually cruising across the street to the local gas station, we climb the stairs and open doors and turn on sinks, lift toilet seats with our feet and "float" above them with the only goal of completing "Operation Clean Hands" with absolute perfection and not accumulating bacteria and some nasty disease along the way.   If you feel like breakin' it out, and sweating to the oldies (yeah, I know, the musics "old" now but it wasn't really THAT long ago), come to Madrone tonight. You'll find me at the front with Mer, shakin' my ass like it's goin' outta style. You'll find me, I'm easy to spot. Remember, my hair's not red, it's magenta.

jlOyhWnhQoXZfJVweYWkOg.review_text: Madrone had a funky vibe, and I loved the comfy couches and armchairs which gave it a unique look and also made it very cozy.  Wasn't thrilled about paying cover ($5), but I did like that the bouncer wasn't a jerk about it, and explained that it was because of the live music that night.  For whatever reason (popular performer?) it was VERY crowded when I went, so everyone was smooshed up against each other and it was difficult to get to the bar, but once I did, service was very fast, which was a pleasant surprise. Also, some  girl bumped into my friend just as she was handed her drink, spilling the entire contents. The bartender gave her a new one right away, which was nice. Maybe because it was so crowded, the bathrooms were pretty disgusting, but what can you do?  Happy hour deals are supposed to be good here. Best of all, looking around Madrone, almost everyone looked like they were enjoying themselves...and what's more important than that?

qCrAu3LAbj4zkDYVST2efQ.review_text: This is one of my neighborhood spots. It can get pretty crowded on the weekends and on DJ nights so a local like me only goes on sleepy Motown Mondays when I can bring my Little Chihuahua in here.  I love the couches, the big dance floor and the great cocktail menu. Of course I usually get the mojitos but have sampled many of their martinis and have never been disappointed. I have never paid a cover since I go during off peak hours, but I am pretty sure they charge one when there are performers.   You should definitely put this on your list.

d5J5E3GhDX-o534NP9Jo3w.review_text: I like tall and this place has great TALL cocktails. Watermelon infused vodka with watermelon and lime. Excellent way to start the evening , catch up w/ friends or wait for your table at one of the Nopa establishments. They also have Prince vs Michael nights apparently, something to check out.  Though no contest for me, Michael all the way -blame it on the boogie!

gymRq5MxXBLb5p3-Dk17KA.review_text: I was recently attending a show at the Independent a block away and stumbled upon this hidden gem. This bar was so rad. I walked in and was on sensory overload immediately.  There was so much to look at and so little time. Super artsy and such fun things to look at while you sip on your drink. I had a "Dirty Sanchez"....I just had to. It was a bit pricey but why not. They have a huge drink list written on a chalk board with many types of drinks to choose from. There was a dog in there just laying around so its animal friendly and the guy said you can bring any food in with us which was cool. We didnt but still good to know. Imagine if a bar was in an art studio/TGI Fridays....Ya, Its kinda like that.

n_-wbei9Xz2D3jNJyzxkAg.review_text: DANCE motha#$*W( DANCE! Fringe was one HOT sizzling mess! Will defs be back ya'll. Losts of mustaches and boo ha ha's. The music even got my head bobbin' and that's always a F#*(R&#$ good sign!

CPX8GF3B1d-rzsG9eI2Z4Q.review_text: There's great dj's that play here.  there's a small dance floor surrounded by people chatting and looking tre cool.  The setting is very hip, and the bar tender will serve you the drink of the momment.  try pineapple vodka on the rocks...it's delicious.

keDrbt3kDKaDCANO86nyug.review_text: Nice bar, small and crowded but always nice to be early and get a table.  Finding parking can be a pain, plan that.

_s5vNn3T6GrrDVpqwBwMOg.review_text: One of my favorite bars I've been to in quite a while. I really enjoy laid back dive bars that have a lot going on. This place has a great laid back feel with amazing cocktails and an all around good vibe. I went on Tuesday night and an amazing blues brass band was playing. I was taken with the whole place.. Fast service, can't ask for much more if you like dive bars.

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: i had a good time at madrone although it was extremely crowded due to the michael jackson vs prince smackdown that was going on... (MJ in my opinion if you must know although i do love a little purple rain).  i would definitely give this place a try on another night to see if it was just as fun and hopefully a little less packed.  fun drink menu too which is always a plus for me.

RIRL9Cd8inPW_DUGDtFmuQ.review_text: Always seem to find myself here.  Love-Hate, Hate-Love, it's just how it goes.  Motown Mondays (MoM) is probably my favorite here.  It gets packed quick.  Who knew this little ol' bar could have a huge line out the door on a Monday?!  Oh right, it's free, it's Monday and they got the bangin funk beats to push out of their decent sound system.  Drinks are kinda amazing.  I've gone here a few times before dinner (NOPA, anyone?!) and had a few of their awesome elixirs.  Hell, i don't like Gin, but they got this Gin drink... oooh.  Ginger beer with god knows what, and I call for the bartender to make me another while I gulp that sweet nectar down.  $3 Tecate and PBR.    As for the crowd-  The crowd is a mixture of regulars from Divis-Hipstero, Burners, College kids, bad dancers, cute couples, and god knows what else.  Culturally wise, they are accepting.  It's just I don't know if you'll accept them.  I would if I were you.   They're a fun group of kids.  Don't expect any awesome dance moves either.. the crowd needs a little practice on that if they want to strut that stuff, but again... who gives a flying f****.  Fun times?  People Watching?  Sure, why the hell not.  Plus the bouncer is a nice guy.  (Wait, what?!  A nice-guy bouncer?!?!?!)  Ca$h Only.  They have an ATM, or just crawl ya ass up to BofA to save the surcharge.  Love-Hate, Love- Hate... awww fffff it.  I love it :)

jQB-yh5WoOPMrfqwZEBfSg.review_text: Very cool place with themed dance nights. The drink list is pretty long, so that's definitely a plus, but other than that I was pretty unimpressed. I'd pop in again if I was in the area.

dNG8cMX2XkXe9GeeMdhxWQ.review_text: Great bartending.  This was a fun venue for our party of 6. The eclectic video/audio mixes were a lot of fun.  And of particular fun for people who aren't too afraid to dance and sing along with it.  I wish the VJ would have finished Electric Avenue (Eddie Grant), but he cut it short by mixing in another song.

en7bEkzUtMBcZBGrADW3Xg.review_text: SUCH a great time every time I come here.  There is always amazing artwork and photography which I extremely appreciate. The drink menu is great! Happy Hour Specials...(4-8pm every day) $1 off Drafts, $2 PBRs, $4 well drinks, $5 Mojitos... Yes please!  On the 8th for Fo Sho Friday DJ Lebowitz was rocking some mean beats and I was all about the reggae that was playing later on that night. What I love is every night of the week is something new and I've always had a great time here. Def. check this place out!

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: Very arty indeed. Went a few different nights and the crowd and vibe were markedly different. Definitely quieter and more civilized during the week with live jazz bands and on weekends this place becomes packed with people dancing to the latest Yeah Yeah Yeah's remix track and Peaches. There is such an odd mix of people here- everything from hipster to ultranerds. Yet no one seems like the odd guy out, I love that. Interesting cocktails. I ordered the Lola one time and was given the Steve McQueen, which is like orangey bouron in a martini glass and if you're not careful it's kind of like roofying yourself. Fun times.

PRf0WHLd3FwdtZ3TJnOjjA.review_text: Great music, but much less crazy on weeknights.  The marina crowd piles in on the weekends, plus there is a cover charge.   They have some interesting drinks, plus the staples.  They also have 22's of Bud. It's within walking distnace to my house so that makes it great also!

KTYb_VWsc61HpvHRQSsHsw.review_text: Not my favorite..but often end up here since its very close to home.  PROS: awesome & always-changing art on the walls               they carry St. Germaine, my favorite and rarely-found liquor               can usually find a seat-lots of cozy chairs / couches               can usually do some dancing to some sort of live music / DJ  CONS: always trying to charge a cover! $10 on a wed?? Not so much..               arbitrary cc rules-min is $10 one night, $20 another               can have a strange crowd-and not the fun kind  OVERALL: not a staple in my life, but can rely on it for a decent time with good friends.  ***UPDATE***  Owner messaged me that the CC min. amt. was recently changed so is now steady. Also, cover charge varies due to which live act is performing that night, but is flexible for neighborhood-ites. Thanks for the response Mike! SO, yea 4 stars.

lkyKJY0UWh88GoCnZ2EnOg.review_text: do you pretend to like hip hop but feel uncomfortable around large (i.e. over 3) numbers of minorities?  would you rather stay in your best friend's living room and listen to swiss renditions of tribe called quest songs?  welcome to san francisco.  and welcome to madrone.

c--TE-tUiQomDvHKyGHFTQ.review_text: Went on a Weds.  The live, electronic, hip-hop band "Space Heater" (which I never heard of before) was performing.  They were pretty good, but out of the handful of folks in the spot, only a few were actually feeling the music.  The small crowd seemed to be a mix of young, random locals.  No one was dancing except one free-spirit, hippie chick.  I did notice one girl, who smelled really good, was average looking, and was alone.   She seemed a little uncomfortable so I couldn't figure out why she was there, but after reading Michael P.'s review, my guess is that she was looking for the "high, hard one".  FYI, I wasn't there for that, plus she wasn't my type.  My guess is that this place is kind of an artsy bar (at least on Weds).    2 Stars for the place itself and 1 Star for the band/music (assuming they regularly book cool bands/DJs).

7Ek4da_Btvznc4Q4S0_Bag.review_text: It might be easy to start some kind of riot in here. I can't imagine the crowd level is even legal. And while we're at it (yak yak...) why do they call it a lounge when people are packed shoulder to shoulder with pounding music, shrieking to eachother to be heard, and in order to get a drink you have to lunge through a 15 person parameter at the bar then wait an eon for a drink. Does that scenario evoke the word lounge? Please.   In some ways this is a cool place because of the diversity of folks there. The dance floor has a mellow vibe despite the stifling crowd, and the people are there to have fun.  Otherwise, an incredibly annoying part is the length of time it takes to get a drink. We're talking 30 or 40 minutes. Five dollar cover, no big deal. But having to wait that long for a drink - suckola. I just don't think I'd go back because it's too packed and undrinkable and conversing isn't really an option. They have some clever drink names, and me and my friend stood there hollering, "what's a dirty sanchez, again?"  So basically you just wait to get a drink,  look and dance. And god, the dancing. This place has some good dancers and some epic bad dancers. Epic bad. And the dance floor and the standing places don't really have distinct beginnings or ends, so you might be standing next to a fool and their fool dust could rub off on you. :-)   I have the impulse to give this place less stars because it's so so hot in there, and the whole drink issue, but their watermelon infused vodka was really excellent, and the movie playing on the screen was a potential conversation starter, and there were a lot of fun-to-look-at people and sometimes, really, that's all you need.   At 12:34 we went out side for a "smoke break" and left before it got sad. So I have no bad memories.

P0kW4jdYxi70sWpPeyj2Zw.review_text: I really like Madrone, but I would make sure to check out their calendar before coming. Sometimes you can catch them on an off night and not be that impressed. Other nights it's freakin' amazing. They have been having a Prince vs Michael night lately which i heard was awesome. It gets pretty loud inside so i wouldn't recommend bringing anyone you would want to actively talk to. :P    All true about cheap beer and tall boy heavies.

DyiSA0yxVGN8zSRaYHoyMA.review_text: It's Friday night, and a few of us popped into here because it was recommended to us by a friend, and we needed to cool our heels before going to a house party up the road.  Well, this place sucks. They were playing reggae at 9pm, the beers took forever to arrive, and there was nothing to look at.  The only redeeming quality was the beer selection, microbrews for $5 is pretty awesome. Sorry, but otherwise its just not my scene.

D_XyDs6d4DXgIdObhHeZDQ.review_text: ***Good*** Fun to dance. Good music. Good crowd, minimal creepers.  ***Bad*** Crowded. Loud. Bar is average.  ***Recommendation*** Check this place out on one of there "Michael Jackson vs. Prince" nights..

QNLE57pKUGMLpbEDh8_dRg.review_text: I love this bar!  Tuesdays are the best!  Your gonna have a funcky good time!

BP-PhtILS68hOkjQGcUKqg.review_text: Madrone is a quality shack. Bartenders are cool, especially John. Drinks are loaded... and on Fri nite the DJ spins international mixes.. including reggae, bhangra and salsa. The ambience is great, but keep in mind 2 things - a. The place is small and it gets really (I mean REALLY) packed and b. Everyone come in groups, so being by yourself can kinda suck.

wVfVgyqlLWFQSaGu0z4fig.review_text: As most have already said, this bar does not fit the neighborhood.  From the outside it looks as if it is a decent dance bar.  Once you get past the 3 bouncers and $5 cover charge you immediately want to leave.  The bartenders are too busy texting to serve drinks and the crowd consists of every type of person imaginable.  The only reason this gets an extra star is because of the $2 tall cans of Bud and the $3 Rum & Coke.  If you're looking for a bar around this area go to Fly bar or Haight St. instead.

r89AjC0FYSepgMbvCQe0Kg.review_text: I've only been here a few times and I'm really only rating their house infused vodkas.  Damn good.   Oh yeah and I stumbled in here once pretty drunk for a Lola and they played Umbrella and people didn't dance and I was confused.  Guess it hadn't infected the straights yet?

R9FsuO_Np2nChWAdyNEaEA.review_text: Glad I finally checked this place out.  I can see how some people wouldn't like it but i loved it.  It's all about the most adorable bartender, Mike D who made me a fantastic ginger cosmo.  If I hadn't been on a blind date....

eyjhVMPb-jzshQVJ5YB-6g.review_text: After all the great reviews, I have to say - disappointed! Great atmosphere, cool movies on the back screen, and great music. However, I think we came in at the wrong time. The staff seemed offended when we came in... and the service wasn't so good. The drink (peach martini) wasn't worth my $4 (maybe better to go w/ one of the drink suggestions on other reviews).

Jy1vIkFIMDzpYNDttfJLVQ.review_text: WORST cocktail of my life!!!! Really it was. My husband insisted on purchasing me a cocktail at this bar and he ordered one of their "specialty" drinks. It was literally the worst drink I have ever had and it cost $11. When I said something to the bar tender he just huffed and walked away. I tried my darnedest to finish the drink, even my husband tried some and said it was the worst drink he had ever had as well. I ended up leaving most of the drink on the table since it was simply impossible to drink.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: It's novocaine for the soul, it gives me something to fill the hole

ZqEW0hByiV8PtMvHS00OIw.review_text: Motown Monday's use to be cool. You came to rub elbows with folk who could jive. Now you cannot even lift your elbows. It's become a haven for licentious bros and alt bros to circle a gaggle of meritorious entry level scenster ladies grinding on their girlfriends cuz it's fuuuunnnnn. Immediate thought upon entering: damn this city needs more black people, African Americans, and/or post Black people.   Highlight of the evening was an interaction with the bartender. Pleasant bartenders are a rarity in the scene.   Me: Can I get a Bounty Hunter? (shot of jack and tall boy of bud for $10) Bartender: Here ya are. Sorry, we're outta paper bags.  Me (laughing): Yea, I call them disposable koozies.  Collective laughter.

ApVHbSAnTHvyaqIlvjLreQ.review_text: Since the very first time I went to Madrone, not long after its opening, I decided one thing. I hate this place. The furniture is not inviting, the bathroom situation is just disastrous, and - the bartenders are totally rude. Unless of course, you're a drunken hipster who looks like he's about the throw down a bunch of cash. If you're a cute little girl with glasses who isn't content with a tall boy of Bud, then you're getting no love. I avoid going to Madrone at all costs but last night a friend reeeeeeally wanted me to join him for hip hop night. We hadn't hung out in a while so I reluctantly agreed to meet him after work. When I got there I was told it was a $2 cover. Not bad. Except for the fact that I didn't have $2 on me. The door guy was sweet (what?!?!) and let me with a smile. Maybe this place is turning around, I thought. That was, until I made my way inside. I'm sorry, did I come for hip-hop night or I-wish-I-was-hip night? Confusing. To everyone's credit, they were ALL trying their best to be super hip. Sleepy eyed and drunk, messy hair, expensive hoodies. . . It was if they had all just come from How to BE Hip-Hop 101  "Hay guys, once class is out let's head over to Madrone and try out our mad skills."  "For real, dog." I made my way to the bar and was ignored. And ignored some more. Finally I got the bartender to hand me a drink list. My friend promised to buy me a drink but I couldn't find him through the crowd so I thought I'd just put my drink on my card. Just as I was about to start waving my hands and jumping up and down in order to get the bartenders attention, I hear her tell a guy behind me that there was a $20 minimum on the tabs. Ugh. There was no way I was going to spend $20 in this place. I was ready to leave but the drunk guy to my left offered to buy me a beer so I accepted. He didn't even mind that I was married and in no way interested in him! Is that rude? Am I taking advantage of drunk guys just looking for love? Maybe -but I can live with that. I even talked to the guy until I found my friend. Drunk as he was, we discovered that we both work in restaurants so we had something in common. I even gave him my business card so in a way - he scored a number. Anyway - I find my friend and we spent the next hour enjoying the music (I have to dedicate a star to the dj's last night. They were actually really incredible) and giggling at all the silly people around us. So, in a way, I ended up having a good time. Surprising. I still hate Madrone and will not begin frequenting the establishment, but I laughed, I danced, heard good music, and drank so it wasn't a horrible night. Lucky for them. If I had yelped Madrone after any one of the other times I've been there, I would have been a lot meaner.

_zkty5EuqtAEe5n1O8CHCQ.review_text: cool tunes, cool drinks, great art. crowd can be a bit douchey, i once got hit in the head by two tools high fiving each other.  but all in all this place is comfy and a great place to get yo drink on.

R4Ti8bqbQ459-5fxiIZm-w.review_text: Puppppppppies! And good cocktails. Did I mention... PUPPIES?!

60iCXLkb9xqhe5cvEun0kg.review_text: Madrone is such a beautifully decorated space that, upon first setting foot in here, I instantly wanted to run home, throw all my furniture into the street, and set it on fire.  Madrone's art house setting is delightful on a Sunday night when you can relax with some good friends.  The atmosphere is delightful with the mismatched collection of antique couches and chairs.  I didn't try spilling a drink on anything, but I suspect a case of ScotchGuard was involved in the decoration plans.  I'm also delighted by the work of the curator.  I'd like to hug the person responsible for collecting all the paintings, drawings, and photographs.  I may return to purchase something for myself.  And in the same artistic theme, I'm so very impressed that these folks print full color cards for all their special events.  These cards are expertly designed and, like the walls, feature top-shelf artwork.  Once you throw in some happy hour specials, you've got all the mixing for an excellent bar.  I'll make a point of coming back here soon.

1xZflgh5eGuKGtg7PlhNRg.review_text: Spunky. The personality of Madrone is reflective of its new owner. And so are the house cocktails! They are super eclectic. In addition, with so many choices, there is bound to be something for your wavering moods.  I had The Movie Star. After a couple of those you might be so bold to break out into a Judy Garland monologue. "There's no place like home!" Or Madrone for that matter.  I am especially a fan of the beat music from the featured DJs and the projected films looping on the wall. It's a great venue for liquored up artsy fartsy San Franciscans to get down to what we do best...drink.

OdqMxoHTBBdAAeYeqdoNjw.review_text: Great happy hour, the hours are 4pm to 8pm. No food, though. Art is pretty f-ing awesome. Good free parking a few blocks away. Definitely coming back another day.

6x3qPM172G0_Ba5jFlTwLA.review_text: Go during the week.  You won't have to pay a lame cover or wait long for a drink in this always-crowded-on-weekends bar.

vgb8lROpT9hbdJ23_xyByQ.review_text: Great tunes whether it is a dj or a band and can't beat the drinks. I'm consistently impressed with the quality of both.

sGIbFcbbDNWIWSTT5E-DLQ.review_text: It's OK, it's the fashion hipster thing, ya know, the ones who look the part, but know nothing about anything. I hate DJ's and that shitty music, but that's their thing and I know that when I go, which is maybe once a month, usually with one specific girl after we eat at Nopa, and I must admit on a Sunday night, it's a cool spot to prop your feet up on a chest, sink into a couch and sip well made drinks in the neighborhood. I avoid it on busy nights and feel better at the Paige or Waezima, but if bad DJ music, fashion hipsters and well made drinks are your thing, it's like the best of the worst at the Madrone!!

SyF3myFzNHoSTn6y-HqXbQ.review_text: I went to Madrone Lounge after the ownership change. It is less loungey and feels more like a bar. I ordered three rum drinks from and most were good. Bartender was happy to change out what I didn't like without any fuss. I've been there before for shows and I've had a good time. I only worry the Marina crowd will dull down this place, but I hope it stays a neighborhood bar with unobnoxious people.

JibN6XRd2LCQeTg-JgkjGw.review_text: I like the vibe of this place. It's pretty packed on a weekend night, but the crowd is pretty cool. Cash only though ($5 cover) but the drinks are yummy!

U6KBNi5oTnOetfiFsKi2RA.review_text: Chill place- came here on a Thursday night, it was pretty slow, but I suppose that's not so bad. The music was pretty loud, so a conversation isn't easy to carry on, but at least the beat was decent.  I like the couches :)  and the best part:   Dried Apricot infused vodka...w/mango juice. SUPERRRR! (that's what got it the 4th star)

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: I love Madrone for date nights, 80s night, 90s night, and general nights with my friends. The constantly changing art on the walls make Madrone like a box of chocolates... you never know what you're going to get.

BB1pO1aL7VWPOmRQvNM7Lg.review_text: To say that their 90's night DJ is totally off base would be an understatement.  At first when he played a handful of songs from the 2000's, I couldn't tell if he wasn't aware that it was 90's night or if he just didn't realize these songs came out almost a decade after the 90's ended.  When he started playing songs from the 70's, it became evident that no one told him it was 90's night.  And when he started repeating songs at only 12:30, it started to seem like maybe he didn't actually live through the 90's because there are so so many great songs from the 90's that he didn't get through before he started on repeats.   Nice bar, less than mediocre 90's night.  Hot tip for the DJ, use Google to find more 90's artists if you are feeling hard up for songs to play.

AVFdBitoJIv9cqk_7hjw5Q.review_text: This place has dancing and really good music.  The problem is that it  is just way too crowded.  I have no problem with the $5 cover charge or the fact that they are a cash only bar, but when you combine that with poor air ventilation and being overcrowded by about 150 people, I'd pretty much rather be anywhere else.  I might have hit this place on an off night, but I'll never know because I don't plan on going back...

cvkLinqobaKn4jAh-SHS6w.review_text: +5 stars for the Fernet and Boont Saturday night $5 special -2 stars for the complete ignorance in regulating #s  The drink special is pure gold.  But if you continue to let 250 people in a space that really only uncomfortably holds 75 (barring everyone from realistically getting drinks from your 2 SLOW bartenders), I am going to have to strike you from the list.

kS1MQHYwIfD0462PE61IBw.review_text: the place hosted a holiday event.  live band, small space, slippery fake snow--not the best setup.

leFdvS5nTItq4OqLRUb8Xg.review_text: It's a cool little spot.  I like to come here after the Independent show is over.   They have a bunch of infused vodkas and good drink specials.  The couches always get taken up though and after that happens everyone crowds around the bar and a few people pretend that they like to dance or something.  Which means it takes longer for me to get a beer, which is kinda infuriating.    I went here on a Tues. after a show at the Independent and there was a good crowd.  However, they had a $2 cover charge which to me was almost a deal breaker.  Especially when my two clueless friends insisted that we go in although they didn't have cash.  So I pony up six to get in, and have a pretty good time.  It had a good vibe, but nothing memorable.  Better than most, but not phenomenal.

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: Oh ma gah. What is happening in Madrone Art Bar? I can't begin to say I have any idea whatsoever. But, I love it! It's art, it's a club, it's packed with dancers moving to the sweet sounds of the DJs, it's cash only, but you can get bottle service of Freixenet champagne. There's a photobooth, there's naked people art on the walls, there's a lot of fun to be had.  It's hot as hell once the crowd gets going. Is there really only one bathroom for each sex?   Whatever, the party is here and I'm just glad I stumbled into it. And that I can stumble home at the end of the night. Even when I don't want the night to end.

VOp7cbe-7hbsm0kEISjsDQ.review_text: Okay, I may kick myself later for writing this.  You know, after my review of a quiet place draws serious crowds and ruins it for me.  I beg you, please don't flood Madrone on Sunday or Monday nights.  Those are my nights, okay!    Alright, enough with the pleading and more with the reviewing.  As most folks have stated, Madrone can be damn near impossible to navigate on a weekend night (or Tuesday, but we'll cover that in a bit).  HOWEVER, there is another side to this all around awesome bar/art gallery.    I'm talking about Sunday and Monday nights.    They really do love us.  They love us so much that every monday they set out a ton of board games.  All the classics, Connect Four, Battleship, Mousetrap and even Candyland are there for the playing.  There's a Twister set, but I'm still waiting for the day when someone shouts "NAKED TWISTER!!!!!" and we all go for it.  But the reason I say they love us is that if you have local ID (94115/7) you are entitled to $2 wells from the moment you walk in the door until the moment the lights come on and they ask you to leave.  Sweet.  The selection of board games needs a little tweaking (more two player classics ie: backgammon and the like) But you're always welcome to bring your own.  We had a fifteen person game of Apples to Apples there, and it was a riot (but... my friends had brought their own set.  Join us next time if you see us)  The ambiance is really nice.  Sofas, love seats and comfy chairs make it a really chill spot when it's quiet.  Hell 2-6 every day they have $2 drinks and free Internet.  Perfect for studying or meetings.  Perhaps a nice place to go when your blind lunch date works out well and you don't want to part ways???    Anyway, the moody lighting and dark wood features lend themselves perfectly to be a quiet place to grab a drink solo or with a friend.  WHich is EXACTLY what it is on Sunday nights.  I really enjoy my Sundays at Madrone.  I work in a cafe, and Sundays at Madrone is industry night.  All drinks are half off.  I get happier when I see that sign tham MJ when he sees the "all boys pants half off" sign at Sears.  Yep... All. Drinks. Half. Off.  That means a Basil Hayden's on the rocks is $4.  Infused vodka martini?  $4.  Draft beer?  $2.  Hell yeah.  AND it's nice and quiet.  There is actually a schedule of their daily specials and such on the website at the top of this page, check it out.  Something new every day with a drink special to match.  But as a person who avoids crowded scenes, I like my Sunday and Monday nights there (that's the third or fourth time I've reiterated that, so it must be true).  Weekends there is a small door charge after 9 or so.  Oh, and for some reason, Tuesday nights start out totally quiet and sometime around 11 or 11:30, you look up and FOOMP!  You're three people deep at the bar.  Go figure.  Who knows why.  Perhaps Tuesday is the new Friday.  Anyway, please stay away from Madrone on Sunday nights.  I like my quiet little cheap drink time.    Thank you.

lSXMZ49--MAt8NcshdX6uw.review_text: cool and convenient.    always playing the best tunes with a good vibe! can't go wrong with the pbr (in the can of course) or infused vodka- so refreshing

q_W7S5apZiNzefYSyW-pNw.review_text: This is what adulthood should be like. All the time.   I have been wasting away my sexy twenties in bad bars, with lame-o frat types, listening to the same goddamned Kesha mix for the past three years. After being at Madrone Art Bar for Fringe, I have been thrown into an existential crisis about the years of dancing time I have wasted.  Since Passion Pit released their record I have been dying to hear Sleepyhead played full blast in a club. Finally hearing it, surrounded by stylish, interesting people, so packed in that all I can do is raise my arm and bump a bit, surrounded by the smell of dancing, partying, happy people was just about enough to make me explode with happiness.  Now, understand- I am a hipster-phile, so this was my jam. Stag on wall with gold antlers attached to gold machine guns? Yes please. Vampire Weekend songs causing a minor riot of scenester disgust? Uh huh. Plaid, fedoras, Ray Bans, Converse sneakers? HELLS yeah. I loved everything about this place.  PLUS- FIVE DOLLARS FOR COVER. Are you freaking kidding me??   Best. Night. Ever.

vqwz4AgDEkHAEvpGIkxl7Q.review_text: Beautiful Art Bar, creative cocktails, great staff and crowd.  A wonderful place for the neighborhood!

b7s_gfkMlQ5d31UyQnHSEQ.review_text: Went here on a Tuesday night expecting board games (there's nothing better than a little drunken shoots and ladders).  There were like 8 people in the bar, but I was told that the board games are only available on Mondays because it gets "pretty crazy" on Tuesdays (which made me look around at the empty room with a "who just farted" look on my face).  Minus one star.  Plus two stars for giving me the biggest vodka shot I've ever seen AND the happy hour special (the $4 mojito) 5 minutes past happy hour.  Its uber-uncool to get shafted by the clock.  Plus two stars for the decor and dj, who was good.  It would have been nice if there were some people in there to enjoy the music, but I guess I can't complain about that since I'm the person that decided to get a drink on a Tuesday in the first place.

OW0GodpFj0zAbuS8VXHUtw.review_text: These were my first thoughts about Madrone:  Dude, this place is too well lit.  I'm worried that people can see how ugly I am.  I'd like more candlelight and less artificial light.    Madrone is curious to me, because I remember when it was a falafel place.  I got Shawerma there.  It is cool to see Divisadero diversifying and sprouting little pockets of nightlife.   Still, Madrone leaves me confused.  It could be better and it could be worse.  It was sort of at 25% capacity on the Friday night that I visited (around 8pm).  I got a Spaten for 4$.  Some reggae played in the background.  There were some interesting people milling about, and some chilling on the sofas.  The decor was loungy.  There was some indy artwork on the wall... nothing that I haven't seen before.  But I'm easy.  I find a nice corner couch and sprawled out with my beer.    THE BOTTOM LINE?  I  think that corner (Divisader @ Fell) will remain famous for the worlds biggest price disparity between neighboring gas stations  (The Arco and the 76 are like .40 apart) - not for the fledgling bar known as Madrone.  Perhaps in time Madrone will age nicely and you will sense the character of the place when you walk in, but for now I think it still has a bit of maturing to do.      Still I'd be interested to go back later at night to see if there is any debauchery going on.    I'll give it three stars because I love that they're giving it a shot on Divis.

S_GMOPwx_QzO6MQVh_UQWw.review_text: Maybe I came here on an off night, but I did not think Madrone warranted a $5 cover. The place was not terribly full, the music was somewhat electronic, and there was a skateboard video projected on the wall. The video was probably the strangest part. Though I was not overly impressed, I would go back to try their house-infused vodkas and give the music another chance.

3MNRbvX3Ic1L5I4Knus5Pg.review_text: Went on a random Tuesday night after getting back to the states from Bali. We decided to check out "bluegrass and boogaloo". That place was dance party USA...so fun! Had delicious cocktails, loved the vibe and details of the design...and especially loved the bartenders. Super nice folks who bought us shots of Jameson to congratulate us on our wedding. Had to sneak in the photo booth - which is also amazing because it's digital. Post the prints on the wall and keep the file as a keepsake!

Ha4mOL_9JtmYgn7NvrAu6A.review_text: I still feel the same about having events here but the mixed drinks are solid. If we didn't have to deal with the entitled assholes that seem to frequent this place, I'd like it even more.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: motown monday is pretty cool and though I won't say I get it, the art on the walls is pretty cool too.  i forget the name of the drink but it was basically a vodka gimlet  but i really enjoyed it. Nice and refreshing cucumber and mint with a clean finish.  cash only!

nOTDEZUWv4fmDqd1pRSk_A.review_text: Madrone has a great vibe between the funky art on the walls and the DJ mashups. (The last time I was there, they had a great 80s mix going. Woot!) And their menu of specialty drinks is impressive - all kinds of random concoctions are at your fingertips when you're at Madrone, including the Ike Turner: a shot of Henny and a slap in the face. Yes, word on the street is that the bartender will really slap you. So wrong, but so funny!  It gets pretty crowded on Saturday nights, and places to sit are very much at a premium. But, you can still at least move around and won't have to wait a good 20 minutes to get a drink. Madrone is definitely a keeper when it comes to bars to regularly stop by.

Llp2hBsQhNj0V_Y_Jwmm4w.review_text: Hate it.  Hate the noise, hate the crowd of smokers on the sidewalk, hate the stains on the sidewalk, hate the smell, hate it.  And I'm not normally much of a hater- this is my first no star review.  But living within a block of this beautiful building for years, always hoping someone would resurrect it and do it justice... then, oh my!, it looked like it was happening!  New paint job, new windows, beautiful old pharmacy restored!!  And promptly turned into a dark, windowless pit.  Damn.  It could have been so much more.  Maybe it will in the future, in a better world.

H0JgcJQeOxAJISaB9atMaw.review_text: I dragged my crew here in the rainy weather for the indie music night. Waiting in line for ~20 minutes in the rain wasn't exactly a great start, but I was happy to pay a $5 cover for the tunes. And then dance dance dance! Loved the weird decor (disco bomb, I want you for my apartment), loved the bumpin jams, loved the super strong cranberry vodka (was there ANY cranberry in that? not complaining!).  Even though it was super crowded, we found that the very back of the bar usually had more room to breathe and was a few degrees cooler. The crowd was pretty diverse, it seemed like there was a good variety of unique drinks, and it's always a plus to be able to throw your coat onto the huge coat pile on top of the piano and it's still there at the end of the night!  I want to/must/will come back!

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: After a few years living in the neighborhood, I recently checked out Madrone. From the outside, it's hard to tell how big it actually is. Once you're inside, there's a decent amount of seating and a hell of a lot of cool stuff to look at while you're sipping your pint.  And as for the beverages, you won't be disappointed. There are plenty of interesting beers to choose from (certainly more than your average bar offerings), on top of a huge wine list and many spirits.   You can tell that this is very much a neighborhood bar, which can be a good or bad thing. When I got there, the bartender chatted it up with a regular/friend for about 10 minutes while I stood there waiting patiently. It wasn't a big deal, but I could see how someone new to the bar might take offense to it. I definitely would like to check out Madrone more frequently, and maybe then I'll be one of the regulars.

wVpwTZ0ynSgHWn_tgzx2vg.review_text: I dig Madrone, but I didn't know I was signing up for Bikram yoga when I forked over the $5 cover charge.  Mother of mercy this place is SWEATY!  Madrone trees are supposed to be drought resistent, but let's not test that theory by blasting us little seedlings with 107 degree furnace temperatures.    $1 happy hour beers is something I love about this 'hood and I think some other neighborhoods need to get on the bandwagon.  Cheap beers = happy customers = good Yelp reviews.  Madone has some delicious cocktail options and a variety of infused vodkas.  The watermelon gimlet helped distract me from the beads of sweat forming on my brow and the moshpit of people sloshing their drinks all over me.  Despite the crowd I found the bartenders to be attentive, quick and heavy pourers.  The Turner Classic movie playing on the screen was a a chic touch, as well as the living room furniture seating and funky wall art.    The crowd is not cookie cutter and I like that.  Very urban, good mix of scenesters...I definitely am not cool enough to hang out with any of them.

eCcjxh8zjAqn-kZVWZ_HJQ.review_text: If you can get past the undeniable stench of disinfectant, Madrone is actually a nice place to hang out with a group of friends.  The drinks are yummy--they have some unique infused vodkas and interesting specialty drinks.  The vibe seems to change daily so check out their calendar to make sure the dj/theme/etc is your thing.

itULUvoeTUxhgSoI5vagYA.review_text: plain and simple, this place would be a great spot to chill at if!!!!  A - they let less people in b/c when you can't breath in a place it means you HAVE TOOOOOOO MANY PEOPLE IN THERE!!!  &   B - They got new bartenders. I have been there on a few occassions b/c of friend gatherings, and each time, the bartenders SUCK!!!! They are the rudest bartenders I have ever seen. But then again, they probably think that they are "Too Cool"..if they were smart, they could have more than just a little stack $1 dollar bills for tips. Maybe they have never seen anything other than a $1 for a tip. I know I would never tip someone like that....Let's see, someone should let them know that they are actually in the "SERVICE" industry.  What a waste of a great music sound!!!

Wb5Gs_FpWDYjrhn0luPd3A.review_text: Came here about 2 years ago (I just started Yelping) and had a great time. I loved everything about this place, the artsy decor and people who came in, the couches, the drinks, the animae movie that was on the wall (I even think they played the G.I. Joe movie!) It's a different type of scene and I love different!

CKE7bImVY81KJD8PiiuDPQ.review_text: Freaking awesome! Can't say enough of how much fun that night was.

DsUvSXtPUcdW6FsW5ZqTJA.review_text: An ode to the bar that I now live above:  Madrone madrone, home away from home I may be moving in just above the dance floor but to me youre not just a basement bar, but so much more $4 Jamesons to provide me much glee New friends, wild paintings, films featuring Jimmy Stewart on the TV Live music for all to explore/dance and wail to/move and groooove Tuesdays got bongos, DJ's on the weekends and a little open mike action which can surprise and soothe This weekend (and the next and the next) I will be at your venue Heres to some loud nights and spending my extra coinage on your adult beverage menu

PpZBaL8u8z7YaL17IXlnUQ.review_text: The bar tender ripped me off. I payed for a five dollar beer with a fifty (cash only, and it's what I had on me). I neglected to count the change until I went to the next bar and was paying for drinks. The bar tender had given me back $17, two fives and seven ones, and himself a $28 tip.  Was I a sucker to pay with a large bill and not count the change? For sure. Still, this place is hella skeezy.

WaVpGC24zs6mYZQKjcMjHw.review_text: Not a horrible bar, but I see everyone's point in their reviews.  The space is really small.  It's a sausage fest most of the time.  The bathrooms are not strategically located... if you are waiting to use it, you are standing in the pathway of patrons trying to get to the bar.  They have several couches and chairs, which are first come first serve.  The main reason I had fun was because a friend's friend was spinning and he was doing a kick ass job!  So having fun depends on who you're with and the music!   Drinks are cheap, and they have specials at certain times.  Parking can be tricky in this area, but I guess it depends on your luck for the night.

fzwx-6P-uGbowzFWycjPbw.review_text: 3 stars to begin with since I only had a beer, and at that a sam adams in a bottle.  I can't really rate this place up or down because it was live music night, and that's always so variable.  The live music last night (and I guess the second friday of every month) was world music.  The set we walked into was relatively traditional karnatic indian music with a vocalist and a tabla player.  It was really cool.  I remember being so pissed off when my parents dragged me to this stuff when I was 7, and now I actually kinda like it.  Fuck.  I'm old.  It wasn't really what I was expecting from a place that mostly lists more mainstream stuff on the weekend nights, but it was a neat change of pace.  Is it me, or do the jars on the bar look like preserved organs from the robot chicken scientist's lab?  So what if they claim it's infused vodka.  They're not serving you from those jars, so really it could be anything in there...

jvPKzJ5bqA6QzB3p9PPzPQ.review_text: Cash only, decent place, good music, super busy even on a Monday, but be prepared to hang out in a sauna all night. It was miserably hot but the music was good. Drinks overpriced but hey, it happens.

Nc4uWHBuFF407t3MzX0tOg.review_text: My kind of place includes Prince cut out face masks and Michael Jackson videos all night long in a setting that is equivalent to a saloon meets burning man. Cheap drink specials every night, the unbeatable $2 well on Saturday from 6-9 can equate to a sloppy beginning. The mismatched western furniture, the vintage bar housing what looks like a laboratory of infused vodkas, and the eccentric crowd make Madrone an awesome spot to start the night.

f6iRA1UBcdPv1x3mDhvdyQ.review_text: very much like this place. cool atmosphere. very my neighborhood. great beers on tap at the usual price. and they have something going on most nights of the week.  you'll like it too.

VW22zRpkRXZd_5g_bo7Fnw.review_text: Trendy bar on fell and divis that is best before 8pm after which it gets a little too big for it's britches and starts charging a cover.  They flavor their own vodka;s . . . the bloody mary with cucumber flavor vodka is pretty damned yummy.

aikP02DBxGBjr0i883eQYw.review_text: Friday nights. $5 cover wasn't bad even for the scrubs in my entourage. The dj played a lot of 2Pac and security was cool so I'm sold. I hate pissy bouncers. Oh. And no dress code. It gets crowded and there are two toilets and they're both pretty nasty.  A little on the hipster side... But we had a blast so I won't hold it against them.

HZJA620xWYxaJI_PKbK0FA.review_text: Came here last night which turned out to be a "Prince vs. Michael" night. Music was totally fun and the place had a good mix of people, not pretentious just fun. That said it was way to crowded - this place would get 4 stars if it hadn't been body to body with the occasional elbow to the head. Drinks not too expensive and attentive bar service for being so packed. The downside was I really wanted to dance to the good tunes - but alas, no space for that.

GndQjqxIq7F-9qY1uv86yw.review_text: Great DJs last night, cool people and the drinks were not too pricey. Nice and strong too just the way I like em.  My only problem is with the 650 510 bridge and tunnel bouncer who bumped into me twice when I was dancing with a girl. He was cleaning up the glasses near the dj booth and dance floor and just plowed thru us bumping me into the girl I was dancing with.  This fat bastard actually asked me to step outside so could kick my ass.  HAHA Sorry but I am not going to tango with 500 pounds of bridge and tunnel. We were having a good time till this looser wanted to fight with me. So we took our 10 friends and the girls we met and headed away from this place.   If you own this bar and are reading this I'd recommend you fire this guy before he causes a law suit and your bar gets shut down. He was wearing a red sports jersey and sunglasses backwards on his head.

zx_TYCE7YvhHpkQMhvtTgw.review_text: i'd wanted to check this place out for some time, since the crowd outside always looked pretty cool and i had heard there was decent music. when i found out my roommates were on their way there, i was super excited to go check the bar out.    on the good side, no one made fun of me for drinking budweiser, although on the bad side,  lots of people seem to think it's cool to drink the Tall Boys which just adds up to a strange tailgating-party feeling.    also on the bad side, the bartender made fun of me! okay this is embarassing, but i don't really do shots (gag reflex) and my roommates thought a great idea would be to have me learn to do it by splitting my shot into two glasses. we explained this to the bartender, and he rolled his eyes but agreed, and then when he came back, he set out the drinks and then laughed RIGHT AT ME when he put my two glasses down. i mean, i guess that's kinda funny, but he wasn't even being cute about it. was just being like the mean kid at school. argh.  the music wasn't good (two of the djs were bored and just putting in cds) and they projected Buena Vista Social Club on the screen, which was random and not really a good choice, and i wasn't impressed by the crowd, who seemed to be there to try to impress. so overall, not a great first impression. i could probably be talked into giving it another shot, i suppose.

gBCKyJl4lEQZJc6WWEFvNw.review_text: I have a clue for Madrone that will make things better for the next Prince vs Michael party.  It starts with a C and ends with a Y and has APACIT in the middle.  Enforce it!  BTW - Prince.

rK8kLDiaKoIexHy3JzcVCA.review_text: I always really mean to make it over here because they have $3 Jameson shots like.....frequently.  And I love Jameson.  Love Love Love It.  The decor in here was really nice and the music was some downtempo hip-hop ambient type shit that made me happy.  The crowd is really ugly and unstylish people, though.  This confuses me, because that area has it's share of nice looking people, and I know they're not going to The Page or Fly Bar.  What is UP with that?  I don't know.  I just dislike ugly people in nice bars.  Also, this place holds a special place in my heart because it's where my best friend commenced her relapse from AA.  ;)  Yeah, I smileyed.  What now, bitch?

1w3brs6DYDuWbvSYFkzvPg.review_text: A friend of mine and I convinced the bouncer to let us in 2 for 1! Haha, ask sweetly and with batting eyelashes of course--giggling never hurts either. This bar was so fun! I can't believe I've lived within walking distance for the past three months and had never been. The DJ even let me dance with him on the stage. Woot--think I'm going to Fringe tonight--should be good!

XFkM7gH46acw3OWUxduTAA.review_text: Motown on Mondays is boss! It's a super fun party with great music and a fun (respectful) crowd. The party starts at 6pm, gets hoppin by 7:30p and goes until 2am. If you like soul, disco and classic hits, don't miss this party.   Tonight I heard Stevie Wonder, Michael Jackson, Isley Brothers, Marvin Gaye, Aretha Franklin, Steely Dan, Average White Band, and many more great artists.   *This venue is cash only.

oXZGLL5ePZkSZGd4tbsuog.review_text: I headed to Madrone for a friend's birthday.  It was third place on our list of choices.  It was really crowded with a ridiculous cover charge (which they waived for my firend's b-day=1 extra star).  It was almost impossible to get a drink and then they told me after I got my credit card out that it was a 20.00 min.  The bathrooms were TP and seat cover free and the floors were sticky.  The music was decent which was another saving element.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 03.24.10  I finally saw it.  The Burberry machine gun.  The Mickey Mouse Jesus.  Whoohoo!  $5 cover, which I guess I can understand to help defray the cost of their live band?  But I was only stopping by for one after dinner drink...  My drink cost less than cover.  Booyah.  $4 wells on Wednesdays until 11.  Holler.

fT5FCPk8MWxsm-Ir-_4doA.review_text: I have very mixed feelings about this place.  It is a cute space with good seating, and cool artwork on the walls.  I went here on Friday night and they had a DJ, but the music wasn't too loud.  The infused vodkas were really good and a lot of fun.  My roommate and I were able to sit down, have some drinks and really talk in a fun environment.  I even got to play wing-man while she chatted up some Swiss guys.  However, the quality of service really depends on who you get as a bartender.  One of them was polite and poured a full drink.  The other had major attitude (she got pissy about accepting credit cards even though the other bartender was totally cool with it) and would only pour half full martinis?!?!?!?  Hello?  The glasses are small to begin with.  At that price, please pour a full glass.  It's obvious and disrespectful.  Don't expect a good tip of you act like that.

sj88HBD9awesKZ6NWi3O9g.review_text: i really want to like madrone, as i used to be a neighbor.  but something is just off for me.  the music is never quite right, the industrial fans are never on when you need them and then threaten to blow you right out the door when they are on, the bar service is fine but not great.   it's nice to have a destination outside of the usual mission-haight-marina haunts, but madrone hasn't quite won me over.

lVrNac8ldvymVo6K8yHeWA.review_text: Went to Madrone Art Bar on new years eve, and I was impressed by the vibrant and fun energy that was radiating from this place. Although the wait was long, once inside the bartenders were on top of it. Within a couple of minutes waiting at the bar, I was immediatly served. Also, props to the DJ. There was a good variety of old school hip hop, skillfully mixed with reggae as well as a lot of classic 90s jams.   Bottom line: Fun. Bring Cash. Crowded.

1XANyLruTMqMCYelC8qBig.review_text: Madrone, you could become my favorite neighborhood bar...IF YOU WEREN'T CASH ONLY! I need my 1s for Muni...but I guess come May I'll have my bus pass so I can come visit again.  My roommate and I came in for happy last Friday and were automatically in love with the feel of Madrone. It reminded us of Seattle and since it's not in a touristy location, there were just a bunch of locals hanging out, getting a drink.   The list of signature cocktails is very creative, and they have nightly specials that are great. We left just before the DJ started but I would totally come back again and again.

7vzN2RzuwvJzfxQuPh6OGw.review_text: This bar can get unbearably crowded on the weekend, but during the week it is tolerable and a nice place to hang out. They have a large selection of cocktails which often slows the bartender down, and on the weekend I'm not sure whey they don't get more bartenders to attend to the masses. On a weeknight it's a great place to hang and chat with the bartender who is super friendly and attentive. Good beers on tap and wide selection of liquor. DJs and live piano add a nice ambiance. Photo booth in the front is a nice plus.

C7Ur3omiL5mE04iyZNnSvw.review_text: A lot of great Tuesday night memories at Madrone. Only downside is the bartenders. They're usually working with only 2 bartenders and 1 bar back and everytime I go they seem to be in a dead mood or work at their leisurely pace no matter how crazy packed it is. It gets annoying.   Random nights there is cover when there's a special guest or performer in the house. Big plus....they carry STRONGBOW !  Oh and another thing, if you decide to order food through them, just a heads up...it takes..F O R E V E R...& not totally worth it.

A3Ra1zq46baasuuQtV1DLw.review_text: Sticky floors. $5 cover after 10pm. Mixed drinks are creative, listed on the wall, and all about $9 or $10. Cash only bar. Leave your credit card home. This past Saturday, the music was okay.

sPgnRCUT08wKG1xVGrIRnQ.review_text: I heart this original bar. Where else can you listen to a DJ playing soul music while watching a clip of The Dirty Dozen and drinking a glass of Johnny Walker Green? Love it.

MQGFnEs13egrNSF4QKLa6Q.review_text: A bit too stanky on weekends.

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: Spike just bought this place and turned it into a much, much better spot! There are still the requisite hipsters, but the music is awesome (at least on Weds) and the drinks are more reasonably priced. Bonus for the amazing Pikesville bourbon, I could drink the shit out of that!!

ET8n-r7glWYqZhuR6GcdNw.review_text: After meeting some fun new friends while dining (but mostly drinking) at Süppenkuche, our cohorts guided us through the hilly streets of San Francisco. Through the park near the old Full House set, we we snapped pics like the tourists we were before soldiering onward and upward to Madrone Art Bar.  On first glance, I wasn't sure if Madrone was the type of place I'd like to hang. But then I started noticing the political artwork. A Burberry-patterned rifle above the bar. A deer head with antlers that winded into guns. Well played, Madrone. You got me thinking deep thoughts when I was already deep into my buzz. And props for the 90s hip hop.  The cocktail list was also worthy of a look. I ordered a cucumber concoction that blew me away. It was so refreshing and the sweetness was just right, not overpowering at all. So I had three!  Our new friends gathered us up and brought us to the photobooth, where we somehow squeezed six people into a frame built for something around two. "Everybody pose like meerkats!" Those photos now hang on my fridge. Good times!

MgAgvJwlt8ujtE4Pr0r9uQ.review_text: We went for the Fringe indie dance party, and got there before the $5 cover kicked in at 10 pm. Parking isn't easy, but then again, where in San Francisco is it? It's not a seedy area or anything, so we didn't mind walking a few blocks.   This was much much tinier than I expected! The music was great, with a good sound system and it was nice that they projected the videos. It was awkward that the dance area was in front of the bathrooms and beside the front door, so there was always someone pushing past you.   The drinks aren't terribly expensive, but I was annoyed that it was cash only. The bartenders were nice and gave us lots of water though, and the door guys didn't mind that we kept going in and out so much. If you do go outside, you can skip the line and go through the back door with your stamp.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: A happy hour that's 4 hours long!    Shocking.   These are the specials during 4pm-8pm happy hour: - $2 PBR's - $4 well drinks - $5 mojitos and infused vodkas  It was a happy birthday celebration indeed for a certain babelicious Yelpette (you know who you are darling!)  Casual atmosphere, efficient barteners, great space with the middle bar area open for mingling (or dancing)   Large cushy sofas at the far end of the bar with a big screen TV on the wall.   There's also chairs pushed against the wall and tables to hold your drinks and eats scattered throughout.  What so cool about Madrone, besides the interesting art pieces that decorate the space, is they allow outside food to be brought in.  Since Little Star Pizza is only few blocks away, we ordered 2 pizzas to share among the group.  That made this yelpy-yelper chick even more happy!  Needless to say, the birthday girl had a fantabulous time and so did I.

ksLpkgP2xprUAhk4KfecEg.review_text: Came here last night for the first time for the Prince vs. Michael Jackson dance-off. Nothing gets my blood pumping then a bit of "Billie Jean" mixed in with "When Doves Cry." I knew it was going to be the cake topper to my b-day celebration.  Unfortunately was not an enjoyable time. Maybe the organizers didn't anticipate the large turnout, but the place was packed to the brim and was hot as balls in there. It was like a freakin' sauna. Couldn't even edge past the bar to go towards the dance floor. My friend and I had to stand by the entrance to get some air, but fortunately we snagged seats later. What'd ya expect, when you put two of the all-time best artists in the same room for a measly $5 cover? The quality of the projector set up in the back showing '80s-style imagery was really bad. And the selection of songs and the mixing weren't as good as the last P vs MJ dance-off I went to at Cafe du Nord. And I also didn't get either a P or MJ head cut-out on a stick. Didn't get any drinks since it was impossible to go to the bar. And don't get me started on the art; it was crap. But one star for the roomy bathroom.  So who ruled supreme-the King of Pop or Your Purple Highness? It was a tough call; probably those who were smart enough to come early to shake their booties before the place turned into a bathhouse.

ZZJ-NpEeAw-01OLF_WCfWg.review_text: Ohhhhhhhhhh, Madrone. Much love here.  Always an interesting crowd, shall I say eclectic?   Good beers and good music. It is weird to have to pay a cover anywhere west of Fillmore, but you aren't getting taken for a fool like they try to do over at Poleng.   Oh, but the art is ridiculous. I once saw a 4x8 woodcut for $2500... yeah right.

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I used to come here quite often when my boyfriend lived 2 blocks away.  We usually went during the week with usually out of town guests for their board games and tall boys.  I really don't think you can get much better than that.  The bartender who was there everytime I went was super friendly.  They always have some unusual music or obscure movie playing in the background.  It just has a lot of character and makes me glad I live in San Francisco.

_8RdsTenycwauWFXIxpEaw.review_text: Madrone.  Monday nights.  Ashley behind the bar.  What more could a girl ask for?    My new favorite Monday night spot.

upDDTKY4LgrowjeWkcy7sA.review_text: I think this place is super cool. It's not super big, but is big enough for a small group of friends to gather for some drinks and / or a lil bit of dancing. It's an art bar so there's always interesting art displayed. There's often good live music and/or dj's spinning. The crowd is young, hip, and upbeat. There's lots of good infused vodkas and specialty cocktails to choose from, also. One of my favorites.

u6YjZ9G5IE_E-AR5QjRC_Q.review_text: Hands down best happy hour in the city (in my opinion)! Great drink deals, unusual cocktail concoctions and the most knowledgeable and friendly bartenders around. Seriously... they know their alcohol. Top that with rock n' roll piano on Friday nights and it's my favorite spot by far.  I don't always stay for the evening crowd, but it does happen. When the music is just right, vintage soul train is rolling on the screen at back and the scene is a lively mix of hipsters, art aficionados and folks generally out for a good time, it's hard to leave. Very mellow atmosphere, unique artwork and decor and a staff (and owner) that really care about their clientele. They treat it like a small family business where we're all a part of the family.  I've really never had a bad experience here and my only complaint would be the specially infused vodka's being pulled from the bar... Though I believe that's a city wide issue and not specific to Madrone. Regardless, an easy 5 stars. Extra shout out to Ed and Jarvez... Best bartenders around.

tAKp1IUtzHi0whxbSuXYZA.review_text: one of my favorite places in san francisco

Y3ijkk7bAjvBhvf6CmfrMw.review_text: Warning: This is only for Prince vs. MJ  I came here expecting the amazing.  What I got was LAME.  L-A-M-E.  Do you like fat chicks?  Do you think ugly chicks?  Do you like east bay chicks?  Well, then come to Madrone for P vs MJ!  So awful.  Had to leave before midnight.  Not worth it.  Never come.  NEVER!...unless you fancy ugly, fat chicks from the east bay....or peninsula. Btw: I'm gay.  Not worth $5, not worth a free cover, not worth it period.  Go somewhere else.  For the love of God.

OtajNsBfaqjUBIUDJqf3ug.review_text: This was the first spot in SF that I really got down at.  Gone are the days of bringing a box of records down unannounced and put some beats down for friends.  I had some great times there (Thanksgiving 2007 was epic).  I actually wrote this place off awhile ago due to bitchy bartenders and poor management.  They have a new owner down.  It has a way different vibe.  But good for them to actually have a vision and do what it takes to express it.  I will swing by from time to time.  Teusday nights are a no-no for me these days (god I hate being responsible), but if you have a free night Dj Centipede (spelling?) and others lay down the beats.

4R0iLjo1WK5Qd65lQBQ8PQ.review_text: Such fun!  no one walks away disappointed!

QLE8lXpeuAu6r8j2_d7Ohw.review_text: "Wow! I didn't know people raged so hard on a Monday night! What have I been doing with my life?!"  - Words of a wise friend after a night at Motown Mondays  Great time, good vibe, fresh drinks. I got the Lola which was yummy with good cucumber flavor but not too strong. Hilariously, my guy friend ordered the Asian Pearsuasion and the Steve McQueen and they both came out a girly pink color in a cute little martini glass...but holy smokes, they packed a punch! Be warned! The music was awesome too! Definitely miss that era, when the dancing can be so sexy WITHOUT being trashy! People need to take note!  Oh, also we first came in at 8 cuz we heard it was popping, but apparently not popping that early. No bouncer or anything, pretty empty, and plenty of room to dance. When we went out for a smoke a little later the bouncers jumped out and the line began to form around the corner. We tried to get back in but since the bouncers just came, we hadn't gotten a stamp for in/outs. When we tried to tell him, he asked us to describe the bartender (uh....sorry but there was nothing stand out about them). Luckily I had snapped a picture inside to "prove" we had been in, so we got a stamp and got back in instead of waiting. Just be warned though if you're going out for air because if all of a sudden the bouncer comes, its gonna be a long wait!  And remember, CA$$$H only!

RfGqrCMew0kVzCMe_f2d-Q.review_text: There's something going on at Madrone's almost every night.  The night I go to most is Motown monday.  Very good music, pretty diverse crowd and easy to meet people.  I highly recommend this place for the music/dancing and they've got a pretty diverse menu of crafted cocktails.  Come early though otherwise you'll be in a line for awhile.  The security guys are the nicest ones I've met in the city.

QgPGXQqSwxhEAY5zUq3aCg.review_text: I don't really know what to make of madrone.  Its nice, but not too nice, somehow avoiding the designations divey and swank.  The staff is nice and they have decent liquor selection.  And yet, I just didn't really like the place.  I mean, it was fine, until they started charging a cover on a "sliding scale" for no good reason.  I mean, I couldn't even see a DJ, although there apparently was one.  The happy hour is decent, and runs late.  I would show up for that, and stick around if I was digging it.

x1HWaAfTLuCqvkYuvZi3wQ.review_text: Been here many times since...Motown Monday's, free Jazz nights, lots of times on the weekends and even the new Disco night on Thursday's.  Staff is rad, photobooth makes dreams come true, and their art exhibits are always worth checking out!

HdW_VZSVFiZTt7VcGIu52w.review_text: madrone was my favorite bar/lounge when i lived in the panhandle. it's hip and sexy yet maintains substance. i still go there whenever i'm in the area. leila, the owner and an artist, has exceptional taste and it shows. this is kind of a place where i can say i'm here for the art without feeling any guilt. the exhibits are thoughtful, provoking, inspiring, edgy... it's no wonder this place has become quite popular. translation: weekends are crowded. ergo, i prefer to stop by on a weeknight and enjoy the art with one of their excellent yet reasonably priced drinks.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: I came here for a Giant Robot magazine event.  Everybody was rubbing against my balls because it was so cramped.  The bar is the size of Gravity in the Marina minus the dance floor in the back.  The infused vodkas are pretty good.  I remember liking the lychee vodka.  At the time I came here I was trying to harpoon a manatee.  She use to be good looking, thin and mysterious.  Now she is fatter because I feed her too much and not so much on the good looking side anymore.  Mystery?  HA!  That one was out the door quick.  The chase is the best part of the relationship people.  Confucius says after the chase everything goes down the crapper.

6cX1ihxFpkxFJ3nI8Pp0xQ.review_text: I absolutely love this bar. The drinks are amazing, the ambiance is great and the bartenders are super cool.  I highly suggest the Lola and going on nights when they have a live band or 80s music.

2l9kaRFEX2w9MBL_lGzC5A.review_text: I love this place. Great drinks, especially the infusion ones...They have djs at night which are pretty good.  Although recently I have not liked their music. The people who visit the bar are pretty cool and I love the artwork.

LNz5NSoV8XVZhxIp5wYh3Q.review_text: This is the place to go to  when you want to see what happens when cucumbers have sex with vodka;  infuse themselves together in a bottle, begin pouring their sexual juices over some ice, and fall into your glass for some sexy tongue action  .  Wow is this stuff not the most interesting mixture? It's like drinking cucumber water but instead you get faded and if you don't watch yourself, you might go a little too far with it. Thats some dangerous stuff!  They also server 21st Amendment Watermelon Wheat which is another funky combo that packs a strong taste bud punch. Beer with watermelon?   Sure why not, I'm black and I love watermelon; CHECK Sure why not, I'm black and I love beer; CHECK  Its a great beer! You gotta try it.  Decor: Nice dim lit lounge with enough room for a few couch sessions with some random drunk or just enough room to grind up on someone's girlfriend on the dance floor as the DJ kicks out some tunes.   Overall, I am happy with Madrone and NOT just because they have a huge cock and balls painted on the wall that can be used as a pick up line..  "Hey baby, you think that is huge? Well check this out!"  *And I end this yelp review in jail for indecent exposure*

gosNE62t1GQnbdITjC2bBg.review_text: Love Love LOVE Madrone. Ever since I found out about the self-proclaimed "art bar" I had been dying to go.   And I finally went for a Drink Good Do Good event. Their theme for the evening was Mexico, complete with stick-on mustaches, tequila flowing, and a taco truck parked right outside.  I typically don't enjoy most bars. Too crowded, too expensive, shitty music, and even shittier restrooms (lolz).  But once in awhile, I go to a bar that understands where I'm coming from. I loved the artistic atmosphere, the selection of unusual cocktails, and the fact that they have a Prince VS Michael Jackson night.   Amazing.

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: $5 cover? not impressed.  it was crowded inside when i came here on a saturday night, but it was towards the end, so i was far from sober.    didn't end up buying drinks, and just kind of stood around with the 10 people we came in with.    the decorations were interesting, but not really my style.  this place just isn't my scene.  don't think i'll ever come here again.  san francisco would have a place like this.  exactly as i envisioned.

D8JswSWcY-fznIm05Y3WZA.review_text: This place has a diverse crowd depending on the night. On Monday nights they have a guy selling CHICKEN&WAFFLE sandwiches. I'm never sure when there is a cover so be prepared to pay a cover.

xf_vN-BJHNccH8iUhPu4yg.review_text: Madrone is...  - filled with people trying not to try too hard - saturated with way more guys than dolls - a bar that will severely mess you up on a Thursday night, while you try to meet the $20 debit card minimum.

emF8KqAfI2VL6Sfaek9gFg.review_text: I jump for joy when I find a nightlife spot where the cover is next to nothing, the drinks are cheap, the music is tight, the dance floor is poppin', and I'm not constantly groped by shady, sweaty men.  If you think along the same lines as I do, then you'll LOVE Madrone, a gem of a hangout that I'm lucky enough to live right around the corner from in NOPA.  This place is inviting, mellow, and happening all at the same time. Drink specials all night, every night, and it never costs more than 5 bucks to get in. AND there's dancing, which is always a plus for me, but if you wanna just sit and enjoy the music it's completely accessible/acceptable to chill on one of many plush, velvety upholstered couches. The beats here are a mix--on a typical night the DJ satisfies all my drop-it-like-it's-hot cravings by tastefully switching it up between old school, funk, hip hop, dancehall and salsa. They also spin a range of world music. Also, the crowd I feel accurately reflects the diverse population of San Francisco, which I appreciate--any all-Yuppie, all-Asian, or all-Hipster (etc etc) club is minus points for me. Embrace diversity!  The only drawback I can think of is that the dance floor area tends to get a little steamy since the place is pretty small... but then again, who wants to go to some converted warehouse in SOMA, overcrowded by sleazy single men trying to feel you up to Top 40 crap over and over? Plus there's a big fan in the corner that you can move so it points at you... me and my friend kept cool that way last Friday!  I swear by Madrone--I've gone 5 or 6 times and have never once been disappointed. Poleng ain't got NOTHIN on Madrone!

ku0zyCbMrx7fCqm1iWIL6w.review_text: Maybe I am biased because I love a lot of places in my hood, but I just love this bar...everytime I go there I can count on a good atmosphere.  I stumbled my tired ass in there last night due to much persuasion from a girlfriend and ended up having a great time.  This place always has great music and a local mix of people.  I can't forget to mention the $2 taps on Thursdays after 9pm...I feel lucky whenever I find a special like that.

S62YEa0KUoxw86fYa3brnw.review_text: Came here for a chill night a couple months back.  Just hanging out with a few friends.  Got a mojito, but the bartender didn't like what he made, so I got it for free, woo!  I heard the cucumber drinks were good here, but another dude made it, and it was kind of sour.  My friend said they're not suppose to taste like that...but at least I have an excuse to go back!
