I don't live nearby so I can't take advantage of their offer to chill and use their wifi, so hopefully someone near Divis is taking advantage.  Unique bar, good dj, good drink specials, can't go wrong.

CZOlPo0RSxJ8lCg11CUnCw.review_text: This place is a hipster nest. Everything about assaults you with it's hipster decor; such as the bust of a Buck with AK-47's about to shoot your face off. Is this ironic? The music is sometimes good, but mostly mediocre. It also gets so crowded that you can't do anything but hope that when you take a drink someone isn't going to knock a tooth out with your beer bottle. I don't know, maybe the "Hangover" has toothless is the next trend? There is only ONE bathroom for the ladies which DRIVES ME CRAZY! Luckily it's next to the dance floor so that most people don't realized that's just your "Pee-Pee" dance.

veoCLwTLB9pOrFnxNNRwlw.review_text: cool neighborhood bar... infused ginger vodka was fabulous!

cufhYFdyrUAt4SWe-m0grQ.review_text: After a week of grimy dive bars, music that opened the portal to the netherworld and angry people of questionable bathing practices, I was ready for Madrone. This place is grown & sexy -- and that's just how I like it. I like it a lot.  Madrone has just the right combo of elements to make me a fan and to compel me to come again and again. Latin rhythms. Booty. World beats. Booty. Dark hair. Booty. Skin tones from pale to dark. Booty. Dark hair. Booty. Ruby red lips. Booty. Strong drinks. Booty. Tight pants. Booty. Lounge furniture. Booty. Art. Booty.  I wish I could figure out just what makes this place so fantastic.

7WssA6jbxkr1Yk6slHOyDw.review_text: Madrone gets me funked up!  Ge the Lola; ginger beer, cucumber infused vodka, and good times.  So good that I can't ever have any commitments the next day if I'm going here.  I just heart this place.

K1rJjAFm-FnRLqTmsHcing.review_text: One of my fave places, b/c of drinks, dancing, and ambiance. Got higher marks in my book when they moved the dance floor to the entry of the bar.

ZwroOO8OgLRTrnw57dewpA.review_text: love this place for drinks and just chillin. make sure you have cash (no credit cards).

NbKm_pU3qcI-imHfSYVB6Q.review_text: Who ever heard of $5 cover charge to a bar? Lame. Never going there again.

ZR23y3w8J8kBiLMEv8dv_w.review_text: great music on monday's!! they have a dj playing motown. i dont know about the other nights but i m now a regular on monday's. they have great drink specials and the bar's ambiance is creative and fun.

vs9v7KrfcfVJ16OIWDApjA.review_text: I live in the Haight so when I'm looking for a place to dance in, Madrone is the place to go. Spent Halloween night here, and some random Tuesday nights dancing to 90s hip hop. Hell Yeah! They've got $2 PBT's on some nights, and as ghetto as that is, who cares?  The crowd here is a mixture of hipster and asian. The guys aren't that good looking (except for when my neighborhood boys go the bar - then it's on, the other guys can kiss my tush), but who cares if all you want to do is boogie on the floor and enjoy the music.   Definitely a great neighborhood bar, but if I lived in another neighborhood like, North Beach, I probably wouldn't make the effort to come here, unless I wanted to dance to some good music :)

2Sf58ceaNru-RFabRtUvvA.review_text: So uh, during happy hour, this place is fantastic. You can talk to people, and get some good deals on drinks. Once the dj starts, it's kind of like being in a sardine can. I am not a fishy!  Oh yeah, they have neat artwork too. I'd come back for happy hour, for sure.

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: This a really cool place. I love the infused Vodkas they have and the music schedule is pretty cool as well. I think I had this cucumber volka drink that was amazing. its my new summer drink of choice now and I can only get it there so they now have my repeat business because of one drink amazing! Be sure to try the coffee tini

wh3H2u0u8SHH3To4mbdpAg.review_text: This place was a lot of fun! Young people fill the bar and the drinks are reasonably priced. Have some exotic drinks and had a 90's night  where only 90's music was played, which was an awesome throwback.   I would say my only complaint is that it got way too hot and gets very crowded, but then again, doesn't every bar have that dilemma? It's a good one to have.

2UUxukGtqHz4-811Nst35Q.review_text: Great vibe, great music, great drinks.....and always incredible artwork and decor.  This bar is what SF is all about, and especially the ever-changing NOPA district.  Artists combined with off-work bartenders, combined with hipsters, combined with funky theme nights and great music, and everybody having a blast....that's a party in SF!

Fz3y-d7Ru7wMRnPuwG-OLA.review_text: Seems like a decent enough place to see a smaller lo-fi type of band. Atmosphere is decorated nicely, with very cool artwork on the wall and the hipster/mod crowd was definitely much cooler than me.  Barstaff seemed apprehensive to take drink orders, but the prices seemed to be about average for SF.

Q8TGsARjdIfWsnXqgQYHhw.review_text: Not a bad bar.  The art cycles around so it's interesting to see what changes month to month.  They also hold special shows for artists and have h'ordeuvres sitting out sometimes.  I came here when it wasn't super busy so the atmosphere was pretty relaxing.  Drinks aren't too pricey (because it's cash only) but to me that's also a negative as if you don't want to deal with third party ATMs, you're pretty constrained.  The place is super dog friendly and just lounging around I counted at one time 4 dogs on site.    There is also a photo booth at the front which is a pretty nice touch and of special note is the live music which is PHENOMENAL.  I'd give this place a solid 3.5 but rounded down to 3 simply because I'm not super partial to cash-only bars.  If you're in the neighborhood though, you might as well stop by Madrone for a drink.

vVda7c6O4AFKaOQo7h7exw.review_text: Good atmosphere, interesting drinks, fun art openings.

S73jfHf9mz-kBrWX99u-Zg.review_text: I feel like this is a place that takes lots of risks, and that some of those go really well, and some sort of stink.  For instance, we went here to see Ellul, Carta and The Caseworker and were impressed by the loungey atmosphere and bangin' dj.  However, when it was time for Ellul to sing his lovely songs, they put Cheech and Chong on right behind him!  It was unsettling, to say the least.  I have nothing against C&C, but not when the music is giving me a spiritual experience.  Good drinks and food though, and nice bartenders (a rarity!).

c8RF5DgEzea1l-6rZHFaxg.review_text: Cool spot for a beer or 2.

rWOOlun7ZvWTUXfuUTIYfA.review_text: I've been going to this bar for several years. It's a local fave of mine because I heart art. But recently, the new manager has done some really rad stuff. They opened the windows for one, so happy hour is conversation inspiring oddball film projection (muted) coupled with eclectic and not too loud dj. they mix good drinks and finally sunlight. the bathrooms are good (important to some). if you're going to the indie for a show, this place is perfect for pre-drinking and chattin with the supercool bartenders. douchebags need not mosey in (skull_and_bones_with_polo_shirt_from_marina_who_­works_at_best_buy_and_has_a_cellphone_belt_clip.­gif)

Ml9EY3cA-8np9D9h5v9sqA.review_text: This is my local happy hour watering hole. Perhaps that's because I have a total weakness for their totally to die for berry infused Cosmopolitan cum Venus Envy. Other than that, probably not worth the cover charge they levy later on in the evenings, but a still a pretty great place to chill that's just stumbling distance from mi casa. Love the rotating art exhibit and the Dj's.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: After countless times driving down Fell and seeing this bar I finally stopped in Friday night to give it a go.   Its quite dark inside and much larger than I expected. The bar is sorta small but I LOVE the gun above it. They have tons of drinks and specials listed on the walls so just take your pick! I went with my usual (patron on ice) and some of my compadres had beer. The scene was lively but we were there before prime time. Seems like a good neighborhood bar.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: maybe i went on a bad night. the dj and the crowd sucked. what's up with the weird second hand furniture. not much room to dance at. the "lounge" was pretty much the size of my apartment. it was hard to walk in, bypass the ID security guy when there were tons of people standing around talking. if i wanted to stand around and talk, i would've gone to an art gallery. what a waste of $10 cover. these places should be FREE!!

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: Great place to go on a week night.  The bartenders do good work, the drinks are decently priced, and the interior is gorgeous and unique.  The DJs are diverse and fun, but the biggest selling point for me is the vast array of house-infused vodkas to base your cocktail on.  I would suggest avoiding Madrone on the weekends, as they tend to draw a too hip crowd of scenesters and I hate paying covers unless I am going specifically for the entertainment.  I would label Madrone a great spot for conversation and cocktails with a small intimate group of friends.

e4basUm00KXEG6m-9VVweg.review_text: True Story:  I got a job at e*trade from a friend's friend. He ended up firing me 3 weeks after I started. Complete with pointing in my face, looking me in the eye, saying "You're fired" & making me feel inferior.   I was on my way to getting my shit back in order. I was set to look at an apartment that night in the Haight. I did out of obligation, then met up with someone I casually knew. He too had a shitty day.   We decided to go to Madrone since it was down the street from him house. We bribed the doorman with a $4 bottle of wine to avert the need for a $4 cover charge EACH.   When we were in, I pretended to be a gay porn director by the name of Fredericka & he was my assistant Helmut.   We ended up meeting people under this lie. Towards the end of the night, we met an incredible tall, big man who was a television executive whom we continued to lie to about making movies.   I ended up interning at Al Gore's TV station for a bit of time. The guy I met, now lives in New York buying out parts of the media.   In conclusion, I've never had a drink there & I've only been there once, but the experience was, to say the least, memorable.

o7MQeI-3kM_5QXHFSm7R0Q.review_text: Great little artsy lounge, but a little out of the way for those who don't live in the neighbhorhood.  Definately step in here for a drink before and after a show at The Independant.  I didn't so much like the Oatmeal Cookie drink...but that's b/c i found out what was in it before I drank it...hint: stop reading if you want to try it....honestly it's not that bad, but both of the secret ingrediants never treat me well the next day....goldschalager and jager.

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: me" "Uh, some guy just touched my butt."  friend: "Uh like five guys just touched my butt, I mean look at this place!"  Eugh, Madrone is a bump fest.  Though a cute, and well decorated space, it is not equipped for as many people as they cram into it.  And there is nothing worse than staring around you, moving side to side, or rather pushed side to side, so drunk pushy girls, and their bewildered boyfriends, can make their way to a non-existent dance-floor to do their wasted flailing - ie: dancing.  It's at moments like these, that I yearn to catch a bus to the Upper Haight. I crave a different bar, where I can hear myself talk, and don't have to contribute to the faint wrinkle lines emerging on my forehead, as a result of way too much eyebrow raising.  And I'm sure some of the DJs must be good, but the last time I went, they didn't even get a booty wiggle from me. They skipped from song to song, without smooth transitions. It was painful.  Three stars, because the art on the walls is pretty cool, and on a slow night - Madrone is actually a decent spot, but save yourself a trip here on the weekends. Madrone isn't worth those extra cologne and perfume sprays - unless you enjoy awkward sweaty crowds.

YAAGYmlWagR5KH0RBTQYSw.review_text: Went here on a Sunday and really enjoyed it.  good drinks though i didn't get to try any of the infused stuff.  Had to work the next day and didn't want to not make it, though i still ended up not making it but that is for the review of place that went after here.    Music was pretty cool, had some weird movies playing on the screen that got more interesting the more I drank.  Art was nice and the bartender was cool.  The best part though is that I got to play connect four for part of the night.  what more can you ask for, adult drink and kid game.  There are a lot more board games as well and they even have twister.  Was trying to get a group to play this game but they wanted me to play too and i was like naw i am not looking to break my neck.  Drinking and twister i don't think mix.    I would go back to this place for sure.  Wish i lived closer to them. Great place to just hang out and have a drink.  People are nice.  Wasn't there to meet anyone but did have a few conversations.  Definitely go back the next time that i just want a relaxing night and a good drink.

ljN6jyPQc132ccQz5hSRQQ.review_text: Tall boys for me and infused vodka for her. I wouldnt want to make an evening of this place though.

AJmUkS2J_HVr-HTUoFTxrw.review_text: Er-um-eeyeh-right, did NOT like this place...the 2-star rating reflects the ever-enticing company of Nish & Kristen, my dear friend Suhani, and of course, the always colorful people that the Nadarajas attract.  The place?  There was a "benefit" for some guy named Mark Horowitz, who supposedly was an "artist" who is dining around the U.S. for his "National Dinner Tour..."  I did not mind paying the cover and getting raffle tickets ($10 entrance plus one ticket), but to win what?  It was very cheesy.  I do realize that this benefit was very tongue-in-cheek, but the quality of drinks were atrocious.  I had a glass of red wine which was warm and corked, so I tried to replace it with another, which was also very corked--so much so that my eyes watered before the glass even touched my lips.  The music was totally random, which to some, might add some charm, but in the end I felt very confused about what this place was all about.  It is dark, loungey, almost sultry, but the music clashed with the surroundings.  There are soooo many other bars like this one, but have decent wine and represent more altruistic causes.  Hey, I dine around---let's all meet and you can all give me money to do it!  I would not go back--unless, of course, the Nadarajas twist my arm...

FVbtQgcCmWmQ-D6IR5BfZg.review_text: I like the redo of this bar a lot. My complaint is that its not even near fun until after 11pm. I'd like the party to get started here a bit earlier.   The dance floor is bigger - the moved the  couches all to be by the door. smart. And yes, the bathroom doors now open inward - duh.  Prince vs Michael is by far the best night and yes cover is $5 - if you are too cheap come before 9.   Still "eclectic cool" people-wise.  They have lots of great cocktails - specialties with infused vodkas. And a drink special every night - Saturdays is $3 21st Amendment Watermelon Wheat Ale.YUM!

IprYNdYn2at2EM1s_a4DVg.review_text: Cash only, great cocktails, seriously well-appointed bottle selection for what looks, on the surface, to be a hip dive. This is one of the last vestiges of Old San Francisco-That-Was, and you can tell: it's artsy, weird, collage-like, conceptual-without-being-pretentious. The drinks are stiff, the music is great (and loud) and the staff are no-nonsense.  If this bar were a person, it'd be that guy pairing a really progressive band tee with army surplus gear, who's so cool and so terse that you start to think he doesn't like you, but then just when you're sure he hates you someone asks him if you're cool enough to invite to some party and he gives them the nod, and after that he'll sometimes buy you a drink or just randomly give you a hug when he sees you, but still never really says that much. The kind of guy who isn't really a friend, but who you're always really glad or relieved to see when you walk into a joint alone.  Pick up a fortune cookie on your way out.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Madrone is yet another reason why I'm proud to be a resident of NOPA. This place kills it.   Every night, they have something fun going on. Whether it's salsa night, '80s night, their weekly offering of soul, jazz and boogaloo, VJs mixing music videos and a whole host of other creative rotating nights of entertainment. Seriously, name a bar with more cool shit going on in this city, and I'll name 50 ways that you're a complete wanker.   Their drinks are pretty good, and their happy hour never disappoints. It changes each day, but you can always expect to save a few duckets while sippin' on something ghetto fab. PBR, Budweiser tall cans, et al. They also have chalk board that's littered with tasty cocktails ranging from the usual suspects of mojitos and martinis, to the greatest drink in the entire city, the Ike Turner. It's literally a shot of Hennessey Cognac and a slap in the face. They don't fuck around either; if you order one, at some point in the evening, you're getting five fingers to the side of your cheek. It's a fantastic drink to order for an unsuspecting friend, just make sure if he tries to wallop the bartender afterward getting an open handed punch, you intervene accordingly.  It's one of those bars that I always have a fantastic time at, but you have to be in the right mood for it. Though their line-up is always spot on, it's only as good as the crowd that turns out for the evening. Make sure you take a look at their calendar of events to ensure you jive with what's going down that particular evening.

LuO3Bn4f3rlhyHIaNfTlnA.review_text: My good friend Faffy describes this place best when she writes, "...it's a place void of any pretension."  98% of the people I met here were for lack of a better word, "real."  But of course an interesting story has to focus on what we termed in college, the two percenters.    Let's begin.  I walk in and mosey to the bar on a Friday night.  I order a Strongbow and turn around to see two attractive women talking to each other.  To get by them, I have to either push one of them aside or walk right through their conversation.  I discard both options and decided  to introduce myself.  The encounter went something like this...  Fly A.:  Hi, my name is ... Girl 1:  My name is Jasmine. Fly A.:  (Turning to the right).  Hi my name is...  What's your name?   Girl 2:  I'm Jennifer.   Girl 1 & 2:  (Together and in unison, they look at me from head to toe in one glance, smirk, and turn 90 degrees away from me.) Girl 1:  Anyway..... Fly A.: Biyotches.   *** After downing more of my Strongbow, I meandered around the space, enjoying the collection of art in different mediums.  This makes great conversation with new people.  I like that.    The Happy Hour runs until 9pm on Fridays and there is enough of a variety to please everyone.  The music this evening was upbeat with a high tempo.  It made everyone, almost, cheerful and energetic.    This is a great addition to this neighborhood and would make a great spot for a future DYL.

ZLO1MBwmh6HQmTpTDbcQcQ.user_location: Lake Terrace & Oaks, New Orleans, LA
ZLO1MBwmh6HQmTpTDbcQcQ.review_text: Fun little bar on a Sunday afternoon.  Definitely try the "Lola".  Yum!

Er0hnraJKQ8qpWOHg_iYVA.review_text: An interesting place...they have some great drink specials and the infused Vodkas, particularly the cucumber, are tasty...  All-in-all a very cool place with a very cool atmosphere.  Scrabble and several Bambootinis +4 Stars Atari 2600 projected on a big screen +1 Star

nSkC0g6ZgymTmqTpn79vLQ.review_text: i have never gone to this place and not had an altercation with someone. One time it was with my ex-boyfriend when i got realy drunk on their disgusting lola (vodka and PICKLES) and told him to be more affectionate. Another time  we showed up there with all his friends and he ignored me and i drank my pain away in the corner. BUT THAT IS NOT IMPORTANT. I AM NOT BITTER! I can't get over the video screen and the music that does not match it at all. Walk in on any given saturday or sunday and you will see about 25 single girls at the bar waiting to be picked up while another 10-15 "guys" stand in front of the video screen, chugging infused vodkas and looking like they just came in to see the extreme skateboard videos and not to pick up on upper middle-class scenester honeys. Come on guys, the drinks are expensive, but skateboarding is boring. grow a pair.

O2qAlgUHKft3Lm-hPqO7rA.review_text: Madrone pulled an Ambassador on me when I came here! My friends and I met here for a few drinks before seeing Cat Empire at the Independent. The bar was uncrowded so we lounged on sofas and chatted while sipping on some great infused vodkas.  Fast forward a few hours later. The concert finished and we decided to head back to Madrone since we had a great time earlier. Walking up to the entrance, we were told there was a cover since a band was playing. Grumbling, we paid and walked inside to a crowded, completely different bar. The band ended up being terrible and entailed a girl crawling on the floor making a scary noise that hardly resembled singing. Without a word to each other we turned around and walked out.  Needless to say, if I ever come back here it will be early in the evening.

XzuGe_Q2b955aZQRHpSjRQ.review_text: 3.5  Cool artsy lounge with a chalk-scrawled drink list that takes up on entire wall.  Infused vodka drinks was something new for me that night - I had the cucumber infused and a friend had the watermelon.  The refreshing aftertaste of cucumber reminded me of drinking Burke William's spa water - dangerously spiked.  One Grandma's Pie Martini (with rhubarb pie and berry vodka) and a carelessly made chocolate cake shot later, it was dance time!  Not much of a dance floor as most folks were just standing around admiring the wall artwork, posing for pictures in front of it (okay, that was our group), or chatting/making out on the comfy couches.  Our party of 5 made up 50% of the dancing crowd, which was fine by us since the DJ spun some good old school hip hop.  For $5, it's a cool spot to relax without breaking the bank.

L_fvMyt4Q8cWBaOF5bWVHg.review_text: Great beer special ($3 pints of Prohibition) Nice art, and nice ambiance.  Their logo is really pretty (who doesn't like a madrone tree?)  But Prince Versus Michael is a lame and disappointing waste of time:  Boring crowd that didn't dance, lame track selection, and piss-poor sound system. I've heard that if you go after 11pm it really picks up. I left at 11:15, which I admit might sound lame, but even by that time nothing was doing. Turns out you really gotta stay until the end to have the fun.  Sorry Michael. Sorry Prince.

W_Rslro-7kRSGTcofKcwog.review_text: I've been nagged to come here a zillion times by my pal Johnny, who is the leader of our Trivia Team that also competes weekly at the 540 Club.  So, I finally decided to take him up on his offer, especially since he said the magic words: CHEAP DRINKS and CUTE GIRLS.  Besides, I like doing the Trivia Nite at 540, so what the heck.  So, I got there a bit late, since it's a pain to get there from RCHQ in the Inner Richmond. It takes 2 buses to get to the joint, always tricky in the early evening in SF. I missed a couple questions that might have made a difference. We were tied for second, or whatever, at the end -plus I knew Dennis Kucinich was previously Mayor of frickin' CLEVELAND, not Cincinati (that was Jerry Springer)- so that one cost us.  We did win a free pitcher of Stella for having Best Team Name, which was cool.  I liked the cheap drink factor, and there were indeed a few cute girls there, some of whom are regulars at 540, and some not. Might have to investigate that further...  I liked the artwork too.

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: Came here for Prince and Michael Jackson night.   Crowd was okay, cheap drinks, cheap cover.  Would definitely give this  place  another try.  Line gets pretty long and place is crowded so get there early if you can.

L1b2idyI4YD1gRd7gZtmrA.review_text: Any chance I get to shake my booty (accompanied by great music), I'll have a great time---and Madrones has yet to fail me and my booty. vibe: + dark (and some respectable mood lighting, mainly from the stage/faintly lit neons). + every night is theme night, which is pretty fucking fun b/c the mood is contagious. visit their calendar here: madroneartbar.com/calend… + went here on a Saturday and it was open mic jazz night; local couple started (professionally?) swing dancing so DJ and Kat decided to one up them by showing them their moves (we, not so professional, but still fun).   drinks: + two old fashions. old fashions are my drank of choice and i give this place a 3.7/5 (i'm an asshole, ok, we can round up). - it is a bitch trying to get a drink, especially when you're gifted w/ 5'0 height like myself. So i advise that you put your elbows up, push, don't make eye contact, apologize to any snickering, and refrain from slipping the words "uhmm, errr, or well, shit" at the time of your order..you will miss your opportunity and the bartender will walk away after 5 seconds (as they should). *have yet to but must try...the Ike Turner - - shot of Hennessy and a slap on the face. It's like the perfect pick me up during that time of the night to help jump start you with more dancin', without the crazy shit you may get from guzzling some Red Bull... Motown Mondays is their specialty so go do a lil' dance, make a lil' love and get down tonight (on the dance floor).

CaYEWtCDjgFRH3ZinJmFMw.review_text: Sort of like an art lounge, they have a fun happy hour. The place knows how to pack them in! Really great artwork from some hot young artists in and around SF.

t5AFrfee1pFSgVQ8Bb05Ug.review_text: Excellent MJ vs Prince night. My drink was tasty but too strong to finish- and it was really packed and too hot in there...waaaaay too hot in there. I mean, they could possibly control the crowd with a line (though who would want to wait, but whatever)- you have to expect the night would have a nice draw...  Fans would be helpful.

npZu3OtrDH4wmdTU2JNNcw.review_text: I now spend more time at Madrone living a $10 cab ride away then when I lived a 10 minute walk away. I came here last Friday when "Plan A"  failed.  Madrone never disappoints especially when live jazz/ world music are infused with a soulful d.j. The drinks are inventive (cucumber vodka + gin beer + cranberry juice + etc.) and the crowd is unpretentious. You never have to dress up here or worry about getting your jacket stolen when you leave it on a chair to dance.

CfQIoIaW2X4ScswNHn3RXw.review_text: You gotta love the sick design and live jazz bands.  Not crowded at all during happy hour (you understand why when you see what the happy hour consists of...), and gets super crowded at night.  Great choice of original cocktails and beers on tap!

YeNxJyvBdD5OIFC-rcSFXw.review_text: The Good : Rarely crowded, nice atmosphere, eclectic crowd (not many suck hipsters), the awesome photo of the older dude w the beard in the field.  The Bad : Bartenders do a lot of socializing instead of pouring drinks, the talent can be subpar.

fbU5hr0TG0qb6oVcEc9JDw.review_text: This is a decent bar. I usually have a good time here and I like that they have something different going on every night. Definitely prefer going earlier, so I can have a bit more elbow room. Bartenders make solid drinks and the rockin' piano dude on Fridays is one of the coolest cats around. I dig the revolving art displays and the photo booth has provided for some seriously funny day-after laughing fits.

0sPPamYvk77rDOYECr_85A.review_text: One of my neighborhood watering holes, this place can be cool or meat headish.  Usually good tunes and great drinks.  Dark and cozy for sure.  Wearing black here gets you some street cred.

GcJgeZYHetMVeSYAKAAe9g.review_text: This place could be sooo much better! It is just a shame. We (15 of us) met on a Monday night for a girlfriend's birthday party to dance to the DJ spinning Motown. Absolutely fabulous DJ who was so into his job, he alone was entertainment. The space is small but it works, and is so funky one could simply sit and stare at the walls...oh so interesting. However, here is the problem: the security guards, two at one time, are BEHIND the bar drinking shots, and huddled together with two other bartenders, chatting it up while people stand there and wait for drinks. All of them can see us leaning on the bar with money in our hands. Then one of the security guards goes and locks himself outside, is banging on the door, we opened it for him. This much I can live with, even laugh at. But my big issue here was the fact that my guy friend was being charged $13 for two stoli sodas by the female bartender, and given seven one dollar bills in change (how presumptuous). When it was my turn, I (a lady) was charged $17 for the two same drinks! I asked what they cost and was told they were $8.50 each. Then my guy went back to buy the third round, again $13 for the two. When I brought this to this gal's attention (as I went with him to order), she didn't say anything (I definitely got her off guard), and just walked away. We told our friends to be careful, and the birthday girl, a regular said this is not uncommon for this place. So my advice, have the best looking guy in the group buy, and get there early to get a spot to sit. Fabulous theme music!

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: This is a cool, funky type of bar.  The interior is artsy and they usually have some film projecting on the wall.  The crowd is diverse and unpretentious.  I drinks are reasonably priced.  It's not my favorite bar, but I'd definitely return if in the neighborhood!

e331pQV1I-SSnWw_w0PfMA.review_text: You risk getting elbowed by rude drunkards doing some dorky dance while reunioning with their college buddies if you come here. I was just here on a Friday night trying to get a drink from the bar.  Anyway, at least that brings out the thing I like about Madrone, it's a place void of any pretension. Reggae would be on and any dude and duddette would just be throwin' their hands up like it was their dorm room.  But don't be stupid like me and think that "infused vodka" is like a mixed drink. Get that on the rocks and it'll be like sipping 4 shots of vodka. BEWARE!  p.s. This is a good place to chillax, chit chat with old friends and play board games, if you can find them...

JCbPgWsAU5eHwZKAYK4xUg.review_text: I finally got to check this place out on Wednesday...great jazzy, cuban hip hop music from a couple local SF bands.  Too bad I was the only one dancing.  Lighten up people!!!

wo38nW_JbXC4m_zlaN86wQ.review_text: went here last night for the prince vs. michael jackson.  i've been here several times and it's always a lot of fun.  lots of great energy and great music.

KA0Qo8CmJ5MaUU-RQgMqtQ.review_text: I've been to Madrone a  dozen times and on different nights. It has always been pretty consistent. Good drinks Good Jams. The crowd is made up by the neighborhood homies, scencesters, hipsters ,b-boys,whatever!!! The only kinda bammer thing  about the joint is the cover charge. Different depending on which night but not always mo' holla fo' yo dolla! Now when I say the music is good, it means to me, the DJ at least had skills before SERATO and has good track selection(Let's skip naming DJ's and Genres). They usually have that here. Usually. Drinks are a decent pour and not that expensive. Beers 5 bucks. They have some snacks for that late night attack too. NICE!

A_NDwVOCaN65u1_BacfTsA.review_text: I do not recommend this bar.  It is way too packed, drinks are too expensive, and the owner Mike is really rude.  Go down the block to the Page instead!  Free entry, cheaper drinks.

nG5AXAdj0L6lzMzNVoT3vw.review_text: Updated review- love this place! Yes,  weekends are indeed bridge and tunnel people but the vibe here is still cool. Great cocktails and fun music. Bartenders are Awesome and prices are fair. MJ vs Prince night is the best night to go!

sR0I3N5q58Ne5EysyvZkPw.review_text: Madrone Lounge is small, so all of you agoraphobic people who plan to come here on the weekend better take your Valium.  This place is cool on weekday nights when you want to chill in a cool ambiance.  It has infused vodkas if your date is a republican OR cheap domestic beer.    FYI, if you are like me and assume that PBR is the cheapest option beware because I ended up paying more for a PBR than a tall boy of BUD.  INCONCEIVABLE!  LOL......  Best possible scenario:  1.  Go around 8:30 2.  Get drunk on cheap domestic beers 3.  Let the music (typically hip hop or world) get you in the mood. 4.  Dance a little with the diverse crowd 5.  Bounce when it gets too damn crowded.  PERFECT PREFUNK PLACE!

haykw4LOmw1l-ivYvtdIyA.review_text: Some of the best small bar dancing anywhere, ever.  Great music and great crowd. Be selective about which night you go.  I go for the party nights more than happy hour week nights, when it can be kind of quiet and lonely and brooding.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: I'm super excited to say that Madrone is now my neighborhood bar, since it's about 2 blocks from my new place.  They always have some form of music and/or entertainment going on (but it's too bad they charge a cover almost every night), and their infused vodkas are alcoholic nirvana. Plus, they have Bud Tall Boys. I like the casual sofas and chairs, but they also have a good bar to crowd around. Looking forward to more good times in the very near future.

9myAXqIdHyrIxX_ESbuD2Q.review_text: This is my kinda bar. GREAT music. They were definitely rockin' the samba and Manu Chau. First Thursday Divis art walk is a must. Check out the local artists who come and display, then grab yourself a Pisco Llama cocktail and get your groove on.

NN5jldDW0Puf8E3ZZjKqsg.review_text: Possibly one of the most beautiful bars, from a decorative-arts perspective. The owner values artistic merit above all, and that makes me happy. She's also extremely hottt in real life.   Beautiful (imported) woodwork and fabrics abound. As do good-looking people (like me.)  The Monday "94117"  night is a fantastic concept, and after the protracted struggle to get this bar open, I think it's blowing the roof off this neighborhood in a most rocktagious way.

KB-NAWUoDUwl4C8_qnpkbg.review_text: Coming off at the corner edge of Divisadero is Madrone Art Bar. This bar is cool. The 30x10 ft wall of alcohol (appox) would make you wanna have one of your own. The bartenders are great, fast, and, I think, poursa bit more than what is usual ;). Walls of art work and vintage/retro furniture just make the whole place so interesting. It definitely was the space to hold the night with THE POLISH AMBASSADOR. His elctro-hiphop-house-funk beats got everyone moving and definitely elevated the night. A night in Oakland is definitely warranted from this beatmaker. Oakland would definitely groove with you!

yMmWN4BNNCKPvOi7PMKHvg.review_text: Madrone is one of those places that you are so grateful to have stumbled upon.  I was lucky enough to have wandered in on a Monday night, which is Motown on Mondays. I had so much fun dancing and listening to incredible music all night. It's a small place, so it get's kind of crowded and very hot. I must admit thought, with the sweaty dance floor and Motown jams, it was very Dirty Dancing.   They have a fabulous bar and great cocktail menu, which is plastered all over the walls and categorized by the poison of your choice. Everyone was cool, the service was quick and the patrons were having fun. They also have a woman there giving massages - $1 a minute, which is kind of awkward, especially if you have to stand next to them.   Bust most importantly, the art is pretty awesome. There are some pretty fantastic pieces displayed throughout the bar.   What a great place.

d_Bg88z72HQXt89MnSQ33g.review_text: I like Madrone for the infused vodkas, nice space, cool logo and convenience to my home.  But I love, love, love Madrone for their ridiculously great happy hour.  although it is a shock if you pre party at Madrone and then roll up to the independent.  "You want $10 for the drink I was enjoying a block away for $3"?...okay here's my credit card"

F7ph8JGYv4rtstCYGRLgmQ.review_text: Eh... two stars for being an okay bar that thinks it's about 1000xs cooler, better and trendier than it is. Another star would be waiting if Madrone just decided to chill a bit and be a regular neighborhood bar with an occasional DJ and art show, instead of a pseudo-posh neighborhood bar with an occasional DJ and art show.  Plus one star for being the closest bar to my house.  Update: eh, I've softened on Madrone some. It still thinks it's way cooler than it is. That's just not bothering me as much anymore. Maybe I'm just in a better mood lately...

Tdsd6ojiId3tgJsBBQz4NA.review_text: Thank you, Madrone, for another fun night.  Thank you for playing music that inspired my two foolish friends to bust out the Kid 'n Play moves that attracted some fugly chicks.  Priceless.  My issue with this place is that it is filled with people that are too laid back/too cool/too hipster that they won't dance to the hip hop that's making me shake my ass.  I just don't understand that, but maybe it's my leftover East coast style that still doesn't fully get the SF nightlife scene.

9r-Z59v4Hj5InNu01kSdtQ.review_text: The amount I love Madrone is sad.    I love both the 80's and 90's night.  I always have a ton of fun when I go here, although the dance floor is small, the scene is cool and I always walk away having such a good time.  The atmosphere is intresting, the bar is cool and all the drinks are posh.  The only thing I have a problem with is getting a drink when it's packed.  Hard to catch the bartenders attention.  My other complaint was made by another yelper, that the 90's night is NOT pure 90's.  Also, I have yet to hear WHAM! on an 80's night.  Either, way, nice chill place to go have fun, dance and not deal with pretentious people.  YAY MADRONE

zAFS5GwqdQH9ZlwgL5ywAQ.review_text: What a fun-ass place!  Maybe it's the unassuming exterior or the lack of neighborhood foot traffic that made me surprised when I walked into Madrone.  I was totally diggin the laid back crowd in this place.  The music was bumpin and people were happy!  Low and behold, those couches were just made for loungin, so I got to chill with my friends for a minute before hittin the dance floor and trippin out on whatever was playing on that projector screen ;)

Sf2QFWdLRcXNqO46fnD2XA.review_text: This is one of my main bars/clubs I go to in the city for several reasons.  Not only are the drinks hella good but the music they play is always entertaining.  If it's not 90s night then it's Michael vs Prince or some other cool collection of music.  The bartenders and security are all friendly and the owner seems to really care about his patrons having a good time.  It's safe and the cover is usually a lot lower than the other places in SF. The only thing I will say is if you're going to buy one drink you should just grab two because the line at the bar can get very long!  If you're into dancing, good infused drinks, and looking at random but cool exhibits on the wall and projectors I'd definitely check the place out.

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Madrone is the perfect place for a DYL because it's just a black box with liquor and during happy hour the music isn't too loud so you can conversate. I had a great time, thanks DYL organizers!  I wouldn't go any other time but that doesn't matter, they don't need the likes of me. Pretty hard to park in these parts, at least on a Friday night. I had to resort to super secret elite strategery parking methodology.  To the guy who asked "how do you feel about lurkers? because I'm not a Yelper, but I'm lurking about all the time...."  If you're a good lurker, we don't know you're here. So, I suppose, we feel nothing. It would help us keep our little playground if you click on every possible ad and buy Toyotas and whatever Health Insurance plan is being advertised and watch Current TV. Thank you.

dR-nXFsZESpQMsieXvHcWw.review_text: So I went on Saturday for a couple of friends, if the obligation did not exist I would not have even stepped inside.  They should've stopped letting people in... about 30 heads before me...   -You could barely dance, barely move, good luck getting to the bar, good luck trying to breathe. GOOD LUCK IF YOU'RE CLAUSTROPHOBIC!!! -About three stink bombs went off during the duration of my stay. -It could've been pure madness if there was a stampede or a real emergency occured.  On a plus side, the drinks are good and moderately priced.   I "might" return if they did not dangerously pack the place.

aIZJN3cjn1DbePEp6nR-Bg.review_text: Can I give it a zero stars? I hate this place. Hate it. HATE IT!   1) Slow crappy service- I don't expect immediate service at the bar but c'mon. Complicated drinks + minimal staff=long waits  2) Tiny- Do you like to stand up and feel like you are in the way no matter where you are? Are you a sardine that was recently released from your tin and are missing that jam packed feeling? This is the place for you. 3) The crowd- I cannot stand the people at this place.  a) Bros and Banshees.  b) Too much cologne people c) Mr. Trying too hard to look cool d) Screaming drunk chick who spills her drink on everyone, and Misters b and c keep giving her more to drink/spill.  I have to stay away from this place.

wIToYOaSGbG0-c7VCsdJTw.review_text: It was ok... until I went to use the restroom.  Seriously people? Just because it's a unisex bathroom does not give you full rights to pee on the seat, on the floor, and on the walls. You disgust me.

UCj9t_J6cU10SRCu7wjK2Q.review_text: This review is for DJ Sonny Phono. I'd post elsewhere but he keeps deleting our comments and changing his number If anyone has another way to contact him, please let me know!:  WARNING - DO NOT BOOK SONNY AS YOUR DJ. Sonny Phono was booked with over a month's notice for our company party. We put him in touch with the venue's owner and were assured that all would be well. He agreed to reach out to the owner of the venue to see which equipment was needed -- he had a month to do so. He was then paid in full (per his request, in hindsight we should have never paid until after the event, lesson learned). On the night of the party he shows up, realizes he doesn't have ANY DJ EQUIPMENT (really? a DJ without DJ equipment?). Then he says "ok, I'll be right back" and then NEVER came back and NEVER called.  We have reached out via Facebook and he has deleted our comments, we have called and his phone is now disconnected. Avoid this DJ at all costs. He took our money and ran.

qXycxN-AFVnr5GkSzgXpzQ.review_text: One of the coolest bars I've seen in a while.  An extremely hip feel, friendly and ultrafast bartenders who have a wide variety of cool drinks available.  I stuck with "The Dirty Sanchez" most of the night - tequila, ginger beer and agave puree - it packs a sweet, potent punch, not unlike the rejection you'll get from the hipsters who frequent this place.  The unique "art" includes a moose-head with AK-47s for antlers, an AK-47 customized in Burberry nova check wool, and other works featuring popular Russian automatic weapons.  Supposedly there is a cover after 9pm, so just come earlier or stop whining.  In conclusion, this is a very unique bar with amazing drinks, attractive crowd and disturbing decor.  Check it out!  -1* for having no coat check and only accepting cash.

h1sR0s2NL4N9Rmk1jGT3tA.review_text: Solid bar in a great neighborhood.  The bartenders are pleasant and the crowd is a nice mix.  My only complaint is that there is never enough seating.  This could be due to the space they use for the "dance floor", but on weeknights ain't nobody dancing before 10pm-ish.

Qrza-_Tu6MCBYZ4B1M06pQ.review_text: Yo, here's the story.  I went here once with a young man I was dating who was, ahhh, ummmm, well, just a touch younger than me and I sat with him and his hot young friends and, THEY SIPPED BEER FROM BAGS THEY SMUGGLED INTO THE BAR.  I guess they just wanted to enjoy the ambiance not the bar prices.  Needless to say, my aspirations of shacking up with a gorgeous, 20 something waiter with touseled blond hair began to slowly retreat.    However, my last venture was with a girlfriend on Wednesday night.  Yes, I am capable of leaving my house during the airing of new Lost episodes, and no I do not have tivo, but I digress.  We had a lovely time chillin with the bartender, discussing politics, discovering that I BLOW at crossword puzzles (and it was only Wednesday's puzzle, imagine the shame and humilitation I would have suffered attempting Saturday's!), and snacking on pizza. Yes, I shelped to a local joint to order a large cheese pizza for the bar patrons and the lovely and enchanting bartender.    This place is awesome people.  I mean, at the very least, super awesome on a Wednesday.  Check it out, next time I might shoot you a slice down the bar...

Tlh0k7Br73mAhC0fOdZinQ.review_text: " A man's character is his guardian divinity" ..Heraclitus,pre-Socratic philosopher.    We often form opinions about the character of a person or an establishment on the basis of our first impressions. These opinions get crystallized in our mind often leading to errors of judgement. For instance, you visit a person when he is at home with his wife and children, you might label him as a devoted husband. If  you run into the same person at a Bar hitting on women during a business trip, would'nt you change your opinion about the person's character?  I have been to Madrone a couple of times on Friday's when it is totally packed with hotties shaking their booties to the massive dj action. The drinks are good, the Bartenders friendly. Sure deserve a 5 star on the spot, I would have thought.  However,nowadays, before rating an establishment, I try to go back at least one more time and experience the place from a different perspective. So I walk into Madrone on a Tuesday evening to verify whether it really deserves the 5 star which my previous Friday night impressions had let me to believe.  There were a fair amount of regulars at the Bar. Service was reasonable and there was a dj on. Among Madrone's allure, it has supposedly a great Happy Hour. But after having to cough up $ 10 for a cocktail at 7 pm on a Tuesday, I feel Madrone has a minor character flaw and hence, misses the cut of a 5 star rating, and, for now, has to be contented with 4 stars from me.

i7kEmwperz9uhs38RfguWg.review_text: Infused vodka drinks? If the sound of that makes you cringe you probably won't like this place. Maybe it's just not my crowd, and maybe it's having to pay cover sometimes for what seems to me a neighborhood bar (oh, I'm sorry, is Madrone in NoPa now?), and maybe its the overall vibe. The people working there seem nice enough but to me there's just something "off" about this place. It's only a few blocks from me so I wanted to like it, but just could not get into it. I think if I remember right I was bummed with the lack of beers on tap and the poor selection of good whiskies.

OS3CJztGFHUvySVWJQbArg.review_text: Let's get things straight- I like to dance.   I like to dance a lot. If you look at my reviews... many of them talk about shaking my booty on the butt line. This is no exception. The last time I went to Madrone- the DJ was playing some straight up JAMS. granted I was pretty toasted- but I was movin' and groovn' till last call... then I kept shakn' it... until my friends demanded that I go close my tab... in fact, I think I even did a little shimmy as I signed the receipt.  BUT PHEW... that club was crowded. It didn't really get crowded until about 11... and I was there from about 8pm on (which explains my toasted-ness) I got in without a charge- so get there early... my late bird friends were treated with a five dollar cover. The bartenders were nice...the booze wasn't pricey and mixed nicely... and there is art on the walls- just in case you want to take a break from dancing your butt cheeks off.

jyHW1rFxcoJ8gYBmcyk-FA.review_text: Great spot to meet friends - I was there on a Friday night and it was crowded, but not impossibly so.  Lounge-y so you can actually talk to the people you are with, if you are so inclined.  Lots to see in terms of people and the decor -- clearly need to get back to this place for happy hours since they have phenomenal drink specials.

8V8ApGDTzAgwyJRAPdWC-g.review_text: So I stumbled upon this bar after a leisurely Tuesday date. My date had heard good things about this bar so we curiously went in. I really liked all the random art pieces and was immediately taken by the live band who were working the crowd. We ordered some drinks off their wall menu, which were delicious. The crowd there was very lively and were having a really good time just dancing away.   Having the dance floor set up in the front near the entrance was a bit odd for me though, especially since the bathrooms were right next to there as well. But I'd have to come back on a busy weekend night to see what it's like. Great place for a casual night out and good vibes though! I'd definitely come back here again.

-qDiotF8Qd0ThdLNEpg9Aw.review_text: Aye yi yi, this place gets so crowded it gives me flashbacks of riding the Muni to work on Monday morning. Not the best of mindsets for a weekend.   But on the flip side, if you chill here early on (like before midnight), you'll probably have a great time. Madrone is suhhhwanky, in that it's got suhhhwanky art, plays suhhhwanky videos on the back wall, serves suhhhwanky drinks (makes its own infused vodkas), and the like. Plus, how often do you hang out in the Western Addition? Shouldn't we all try new things?

q91tQNboB-0HWtM8cXRjdg.review_text: So many Tecate's.  We popped in here after a friend's party, and it was busy and fun. Lots of dancing late at night.  It's also weird to me that the bars close at 2am in San Francisco, but that's not their fault.

GVeOyQJ1uTKvxNF-9d6eFQ.review_text: I like this place, cool kind of art lounge vibe. Friday nights are usually the night i end up there. On fridays it's a kickass reggae dj early, followed by salsa night. They always have some sort of drink special and their infused vodkas look cool back lit behind the bar. The drink menu is huge and the ones i've tried are pretty good.

B7A8EhUulVRTzr83dtvV7g.review_text: Madrone is always interesting!  They regularly change the decor, keeping it fresh  Good happy hour prices, interesting entertainment from DJ's to Piano to Comedy  If your really brave there are some interesting drink specials like the   Ike Turner Shot Of Hennessey and a Slap In The Face  Overall recommended

7LxY5qFm8xYAq91LoSmq-Q.review_text: I only recently started going to this place, primarily because I discovered they have cucumber vodka. Cucumbers and vodka are my two favorite things. Madrone rolls them up into one thing.   The first time I went and got the cukevodka it was DELISH!!! It was dangerously delish, to be honest. After 4 I was far more into the DJ than I would have ever been in a sober state. Nonetheless, worth it.  The second time I went to Madrone I again ordered the cukevodka. Not as good this time. Tasted a bit, well, rotten. Maybe an old batch, maybe somebody started off with bad cukes. I drank it (and a few more of them) anyway.  The third time I went to Madrone I ordered the cukevodka. This time it was straight gross. Acsh, it tasted like some idiot used zucchini instead of cucumbers. It tasted EXACTLY like zucchini vodka would taste if you were dumb enough to make it.  I stopped ordering the cuke vodka. But their happy hour drink specials are pretty damn chill so I still go. I wouldn't go late night, though. It opens at 6 pm. One time I was there at 5:50. Got the best seats in the house, plus good deals. Go then. Get wasted. Go somewhere else at 10.

lLfcbYGTeVxQN5Ig0ompJg.review_text: This was my second stop after work last Friday.  When we got there it was really early, so there was plenty of room at the bar.  The place is very chill and the DJ was spinning old school hip hop music.  My fav!  My girl friends and I just sat at the bar and drank Coronas all night long.  It started getting crowded around our 4th round, so we decided to get up and dance.  The bartenders here are really nice.  I drink a lot of water with my alcohol, so it was nice that they kept on refilling my water glass and didn't give me any attitude.  This is a fun place to go if you're in a chill mood.  And the Coronas were only $4 a pop!

x7rkkPtrmfwXQC6TtT2vpQ.review_text: Who wants to stand in line for forty-five minutes on a Monday night?  ME!  Oh, God PICK ME!  As we finished our leisurely dinner I was somewhat perplexed by my friend's increasing anxiety about getting to Madrone's.  After all, we were exactly one block away and it was Monday.  How bad could it be?  Unbeknownst to me, Madrone's is apparently where ALL of San Francisco's coolness descends on Mondays because in this city it is REALLY awesome to stay up until 2am then wake up at 6am for work the next morning.  In fact, someone I met invited me to a before-work party the next day, which boggled my mind and filled me with simultaneous feelings of envy for a city with all the party one can take, and confusion as to why anyone would have to party so much.  Perhaps to keep warm.  But I digress.  The positive of freezing in a line that creeps forward roughly every eight minutes is that you become better acquainted with your acquaintances AND make friends with the people behind you.  Not the people in front of you as they are facing the wrong way.  Though I suppose we were the people in front BUT we invested the action of turning an entire 180 degrees around and therefore were able to make friends.  I'm pretty sure I have dissolved my point.  If there was one.  Once inside it was, wait for it... WORTH IT.  Worth it in a really really really crowded but fabulous way.  I also found a hook for my coat.  Finding a hook for my gigantic coat (Without out which this Hawaii girl would surely perish) made me extremely happy.  As happy as if you handed me cake for no reason at all.   People were friendly, drinks were obtainable, and I discovered if you dance vigorously enough people will make space for you.  I made an awesome new friend who dances with possibly even more gusto then I do and it was an amazing meeting of kindred spirits, two people harnessing their highest energies into skillful, jaw-dropping, performance-ready dance moves.  At least that's how it felt.  It may have looked a little bit like "Two crazy ladies on the floor! Clear the way before their flailing takes your eye out!", but I'm mostly sure we were glorious.  There was also a bevy of hot dudes.  But I didn't notice because I am married.  My radar completely missed all of the dimpled smiles, the chiseled jaw lines, the thin t-shirts stretched over rock hard pecs...  What.  SO.  Great Monday night, worth the wait, super fun, good good good.  One word of caution, do NOT dance near the toilets.  The toilets are one-person and absolutely disgusting.  If you accidentally venture too close you will suddenly find yourself jamming in an atmosphere of eau de fecal matter and essence of pee.  The opposite of sexy.  If you're particularly weak you may even throw up.  Yes.  Good times.

TmYTLrC3ArD7HFwe8Khw8A.review_text: Great bar - live music, great drinks, photobooth, good weird conversation starters on the walls...

9tYha5_vrZne-hHC9Mj3cQ.review_text: I dug the bar but what was memorable about this place was the art. The first thing I noticed was the Burberry gun above the bar. Then the bartender pointed out the gold deer head behind me that had guns in place of antlers. The cross with Mickey Mouse on it was interesting also. It's just a cool, eclectic place with Motown videos up on the screen at the far end of the bar. Since one of my friends is originally from Texas, she and her fiance took advantage of the fact that they serve Lone Stars here. I did not realize you can get those outside the state of Texas. After leaving this bar and hitting up another, I found that in this neighborhood, Lone Stars are not that novel. Anyway, just a good bar with cool art. It's a chill place to hang with a friend or two and have a beer.

49JhAJh8vSQ-vM4Aourl0g.review_text: The venue of this bar is very cute, but a little small :( I think I was there on a Wednesday night and it was completely packed! But the music they played that night was really fitting for the setting of the bar. It was a little bit of house, electric, and alternative as well. The drinks were reasonably priced and they have specials for every night of the week. I had this pomegranate vodka drink ( I forget the actual name!) and that was delicious.   I would come back here if I was ever in the area, but seeing as I live in  East Bay, I don't think I would seek out Madrone as my go-to spot in the city.   But check this place out if you're ever around!

f7VDm9POSbaG651MI3I4Aw.review_text: This bar is okay.  They claimed to be playing Funk, Soul and Hip-Hop music but I think the DJ didn't get that message.  So I was disappointed to have to pay $5 cover for that...  The bar is cash only which is annoying and the gun decorations kinda weirded me out.  I think I would give it another chance though because the atmosphere was divey and quirky and the drinks were good.

8ghF5mKZvakxAlXEbLgzNQ.review_text: Not much art and way crowded, but at least I could get a drink and the music wasnt bad.

X68ZVYForqAFTfe5H3d-tw.review_text: Oh bologne, I wish to give 3 1/2 stars for Madroney....  I like this little bar. It's fun, and my man and I had our second date here ever...We made out on the couches and totally mushed-out, paying no attention to anyone else the whole time...soooo it's quite special to me. The drinks are reasonably priced and I've never had any issues with the staff. My problem with it is that it's sooooo crowded in there, hardly any room to dance. One time a couple of friends and I were there and some girl threw her drink on my frined and was trying to start shit too, so I worry that the crowd can be a little dramatic at times. Still I love the location (so close to home) and the place is super cute...  I agree with Charlie B. Tuesday's are the best...

1jb940KpnO_nZ228XwXoKA.review_text: sure, i love  $2 jameson and red strip tuesdays as much as anyone else, but this is a neighborhood bar that i will never go to. the bouncers at the door always start charging the cover early. djs confirm that the bouncers withhold money from them, which sucks. madrone has a lot of potential and i've enjoyed myself in times past, but i'm not going to voluntarily put my money in someone's wallet just cause they tell me to. if i wanted that, i'd go to church --OH SNAP

wh4_AwDV2NSsZ-LEmNWffg.review_text: We like this art bar.  This is why:  -Delicious reasonably-priced drinks with memorable names and all sorts of flavors.  We had the Lola and the Allan Parsons Project.  Next time I'll try their Dirty Sanchez (surprisingly no chocolate smears)  -Plenty of space for sitting or standing  -Good music that doesn't interfere with conversations (i can't even recall what they play).  The DJ comes on after 9pm    -Interesting art (see pics)  -It has everything that I want in a bar.  4 stars.  Why not.

AWFoz2p-j4up6psFAxYHsA.review_text: One of my new favorite places that I meet friends now. The owners are really giving this place some awesome character - big improvement over the old decor. I know one of the bartenders so I'm usually in when he's working but the entire staff is pretty awesome. The atmosphere changes from night to night which is cool; a mix of a regulars plus new faces for different themes.  I couldn't give 5 stars because I'm usually starving by the time I get there and since they don't have food, I can't give them a perfect score!  Vodka Gimlet + the right bartender = awesomeness!

Fow8xKETwmcWt4R1WTpnjA.review_text: Oh, how I want to love Madrone, and, had this review been written five months ago, it probably would have gotten four or five stars.  The $5 Boont/Fernet special alone is worth a star.  However, this bar looks to be following a Jessica Simpson trajectory for the following reasons:  First, at some point, you've got to stop letting people in.  (Tip:  When people cant move, they cant make it to the bar.  Bad news bears.)  Second, if you do decide to cram 250+ people in a space designed for 125 max, you're gonna need to get some air flowing.  You dont want to be the Western Addition version of Kell's; there's nothing pretty about that.  Third, reel in your bouncers.  Maybe it's just a case of too many Rockstar Energy Beverages, but those guys just dont seem very balanced and/or safe to be around.  Fourth, the barstaff could stand to be slightly less disaffected.  I realize you have to deal with more than your fair share of hipsters (OMG, that fanny pack is so ironcially hilarious!), and that's never good for anyone, but unfortunately that's a part of your job.  You're probably going to have to learn to accept it.  Otherwise, Madrone has some great things going for it: good art, interesting/changing space, good DJs, great drink specials, and a laid-back feel.  I would still recommend it, albeit with an asterisk.

_SyQ98fDnDIzb7fls58ycg.review_text: Great happy hour or night starter kind of place.  Actually good drink deals for each day: the night I was there, whiskey was way cheap; tall boy buds are always a steal.  People are friendly, and not entirely cordoned and segregated.  A movie plays on the projection screen in the background.  The place is classy but edges towards kitsch.  Low lighting, and if you go early enough you can skip the cover.  If you find yourself in lower haight, definitely worth checking out.

_Hum_JURLFwrAtAnzO2n-A.review_text: Almost two years later, I came back.  I still give it two stars, but would actually bring it down to 1.5.  It was a Monday night.  Music was really odd, but it took them a while to serve us our drinks.  Again, nothing special, but the birthday boy wanted to have one more drink and this is where we ended the night.  It was kind of a downer, but what do you do?

G42xhGptP7jIofchHUmWDQ.review_text: This place is soooo AWESOME!!!!!!!!  Went there on Saturday..  The drinks are really cheap ($3/per beer), they sell PABST in a can (perfect for double fisting), great ratio, everyone is friendly, decent sized dance floor, neighborhood is pretty chill and there are other really good bars near by (Fishbowl and Harry's), no line to get in, art work is good.    Full disclaimer, its small (I mean very small), there's a $5 dollar cover, it gets super packed, and freaking hot (it actually felt like I was in Miami in August, just a tad humid).   Make sure to wear very light clothes, the less the better; trust me, you'll be sweating all night, especially if your dancing.  Not sure if they always play Michael Jackson and Prince, but when we went there, it was back to back MJ and Prince all night.  I heard it was a tribute or something, but I definitely want to try it on another night.  Also, the scene is kind of mission-like, although you get the perfect  mixture of hipsters, gangstas (lol), and preppies...  Best time to get there is at 11pm.

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: I don't know of too many places that sell budweiser Tall Boys. Props for that.   This is a great bar with tons of drink choices. All are clearly listed on the wall rather than having to guess what's available.   I love that they have imperial, a Costa Rican beer I enjoy.   On the weekends they have good music and it gets very crowded. Who knew there was a spot all the way out on Divisadero!

1OocYCAZixwbAXueW75FMw.review_text: This is a place that Yogi Berra would say, "Nobody goes there anymore, it's too crowded!"     Been here twice... the first time for a Prince vs. Michael party... and yes The Purple One won that night.  Tonight I came here for a post-virtual-visual-coitus-with-Brian-White dancing.  Some couches for sitting, but this place gets packed and it could get difficult to bust out some dance moves.  However, once people stop getting in line for the two water closets... the space outside the restrooms usually are not crowded with people dancing.  (TIP: do not wear full on thermals when planning to go here.  I almost passed out and could not complete my harlem shake).  This is the prime spot to get hyphy, do my EMP dance, and start booty dancing people who are just entering the club.  Make sure you maintain eye contact... be steadfast... give them a proper welcome them to Madrone.

tG8Cm5_hguLKxxgSP47NwA.review_text: I was so glad to see this victorian store front open as a lounge after sitting empty for so long and I think this is a great addition to the neighborhood.  The infused vodkas are great, especially the cucumber, so refreshing.    I'm not a club person so I tend to visit early in the evening and enjoy conversations with friends on one of the comfy sofas.  The later crowd is a bit young for me and I wouldn't pay cover for a dj and video bar in any event so it probably works for me.

3aFFrTY1ozlT0sbnhMm5dA.review_text: This is specifically for the fringe music night... I was so excited.. Until I got there. Long ass line, $5 cover, completely PACKED!!! Couldn't even move!! Might be back on a non- fringe night since I was unable to view the place properly nor try the drinks

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: Sweet bar, cool vibe, and awesome drinks. But wow, it was crowded on a Monday night - there was a line out the door and it was too packed to dance or even walk inside.  Good for drinks, not for dancing, try to time your visit during non-peak hours (whenever that is...)

CBFodAAmqqnCLseYyjxnfg.review_text: Uh, *three dollar shots of JAMESON.    Yes, please.  *tuesday nights only.

qp6fUfb0EBRzraaBuoJAFg.review_text: I used to come here on the reg when I lived nearby & now I always seem to end up here if I'm in the neighborhood. The atmosphere is cool & they cycle some great art in and out of the place regularly. Great drink selection and they often have live music. The best part about this place is the late night dance parties that happen from time to time!

Of3Nacec3IT-jY1Z81-1Kg.review_text: Most shakin' Tuesday night party around. Monday is a bit more mellow but still cool. Love the house infused vodka.

WGa-x9Bq4FkjSuGSy0WTng.review_text: Pretty solid place grab a beer or a mixed drink.  If you feel like getting rowdy on a Monday because Sunday fun day wasn't too much for ya, this is the place.  The bouncers make sure there's a line out the door, so it even feels like a club.  I love that it has live music on Tuesdays though.  The tunes are great and it's not as packed.  The walls have great art and they make for great conversation between dance sessions.  Check it out.

Qz7Y8dWLnOJGRkgWRVsjAg.review_text: i love this bar.  not sure exactly why, i just do.

wnyjsQhQjkBy7LhvCRO8aw.review_text: Oh Madrone, how I art thee... Aside from the nasty bathrooms...  Other than that, I do love me some funky tunes, a quality selection of beverages (cocktails, drafts and a sour beer or two in bottles) and people watching. Yes. I think so.  Ps. I am determined to steal the Burberry AK.

McPU8udr9OLqYKh8wFQpGw.review_text: While Madrone has a nice interior, the service was slow as hell. On their busy club night last night there were only 2 bartenders and one bar back trying to service a 25 ft bar. More than enough times there only seemed to be one bartender working the back while the other and the bar back were Lord know's where. And on top of that if you were at the wrong end of the bar, i.e. at the beginning of it  near the sinks, getting a drink was next to impossible at one point.   I liked the place, the management just seemed like it needs some work to be in a better position to handle the night life.   Plus, a $5 cover? I don't think the place was really that poppin to have a cover, but whatever.

qF5BaqUhCHXGKGU-44Nwow.review_text: This bar is pretty freakin sweeet! I love the decor and the great house made drink concoctions, Steve McQueen is my Fav! The only problem I have with this place is the price for drinks is pretty high and you still have to pay a cover, they should just have a drink minimum. The other problem is the space is a little small, and can get quite HOT. Nonetheless I really do enjoy this place just for the ambiance and to consume a couple uniquely delicious cocktails. A MUST TRY

wsp4Ez4zcWEpbcrsZF4gQQ.review_text: I always try to come here for Motown Monday whenever I have a Tuesday off. I love the decor and it's so fun to be somewhere where everyone is dancing like they're on fire.  The drinks are generally amazing here but none of the other bartenders make them quite like Jorge does.  I try to only order from him. He makes the BEST Sopa Honey, he is the only one who puts enough honey in it--delicious! I had one made by the female bartender that was working first and it was too sour to really drink. you couldn't taste the gin or lavender because of the pucker. i also really like the Lola, which again, does not taste the same when any of the bartenders make it. The Herbie Hancock is delicious, because they use really good quality ingredients at this bar and you can't go wrong with watermelon. But if you are getting anything makes SURE to order from Jorge! He's an average height Latino bartender, probably in his early thirties.

iDwZQQhnlg13CAVwXq9bEA.review_text: Been here just once and it happen to be on Salsa night .. great time, short lived, but the vibe was fun drinks were fine and its a cool atmosphere .. random art on the wall, fun to look at ... live dj and big screen in the back with seating ...  I hope to be back soon

oI1KW51gh9RfS8U5Qe9UIw.review_text: The bar itself is amazing, as in the BAR that you actually sit at, it's an amazing piece of wood...which sounds wierd but if you go there you will see. The bartender we had was delightful and she managed to get me plastered (Thanks M. you rock!). The specialty drinks were super tasty "Alan Parsons Project"= Apricot infused Vodka, Mango juice, Lychee and Lemon was excellent. Happy hour well drinks were $3 which is pretty great. We did get there early and as the night went on and the bar filled up I could tell that it wasnt quite my crowd if you know what I mean...but if you get there early it's pretty nice and cute with cozy seats and tasty drinks.

rdMHlN-ASXL6fv_45awarg.review_text: Art fair today! We went to support a friends art, so we were during the day. It seems like a cool spot to chill at, everyone was friendly and just relaxed. I really like the local art decor.   It's a bar so you can't expect it to be super clean or fancy.  I didn't get any drinks, so I can't really comment. I just read they hold comedy nights so I might go check that out one day!

MBSP-PnBehX-BlLFKEZ78A.review_text: I had my first good time at Madrone last night!!! It's not that I ever had a bad time before, just eewww...  there's usually way too many douche bags for me.  The staff is always awesome, and pour excellent cocktails!!!  I like how it's dark and cozy.  The bathroom situation is...  well, limited.  There is always a line to pee, no me gusta!  But, last night kicked ass!  It helped that my friends were DJing and they rule!  My faith has been renewed!  I will stay away on weekends, just like most places...  greasy button-up shirt dudes that are still using lines their older brothers taught them in high school, and go figure...  they still don't work and now I'm a "bitch" cause of it.  See you there on an off night when the weekend warriors are re-grouping!

AtoDIsk5vEcIIXJqPp-PLQ.review_text: Great place on Monday's for relaxing and playing some board games.  Great venue, with a DJ, nice art, and friendly bartenders.

1YV2LYOfM8OFnNjg2CjJKQ.review_text: Love the music and DJs on Fridays!  A definite recommendation if you're in the neighborhood or you're close by.  On Saturdays, I can care less about the crowd or the music.   Unfortunately the place is tiny, but its well worth it if u dig the music, and if you're a dancer and you're usually the one who starts up the dance floor (which is also tiny) I don't think the space will matter much to you after you get ur groove on.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: If you can hit this place up on a Monday or Tuesday, you'll probably love it. It's not too crowded, there's no cover, & the music is usually spot-on (Tuesday is Soul Night, & they've always got great drink specials that night).   But Thursday thru Saturday? That's another story. Those nights are usually packed to the gills with hipsters & kids trying to make the scene, & it's gonna cost you $5 to get in. It'll be too crowded, the music will be too loud, & it'll take too long to get a drink or get into the bathroom.  The interior of Madrone is not unlike like the lobby of a regal old hotel from a forgotten age in some third world capitol city. You know, back when people used to put stickers from every place they've been on their luggage. When Madrone is so crowded that you can't sit down on their old furniture & enjoy a nice, quiet conversation with some friends, the charm of the place is lost on me.

qv0ZDaITzz9WL5tno_RJKw.review_text: Showed up at Madrone on a Saturday night around 10:30 and was greeted by the bouncer who made fun of my license picture.  He was right, it's a bad photo so we both laughed and then I needed a stong drink.  The bar was perfectly lit and the bartenders were perfectly hot.  Not only were they good looking, but quite efficient and generous. DJ was awesome which made me keep drinking their strong cocktails along with bustin' moves on the dance floor.  Good crowd , good music and even better dance partner.  Thanks crumpty.  :)

hkOiI-ctPYFuurzJZF6H9Q.review_text: I should really like madrone - cute space, non-pretentious location, comfortable chairs (both at the bar and in the room), great art on the wall - but i don't.  And this is why:  I went there, asked the bartender (on my 2nd or 3rd drink) for something "interesting and unique" actually using the famous last words "surprise me..." and he made me: A MARGARITA!! They have vats of infused vodka and this unoriginal, unfriendly and completely unimaginative bartender made me a marg... if i wanted that I would go elsewhere (see Tommy's)... done and done.

l0rgSl1kKnQf6e2HRUbpgg.review_text: Minus one star for charging a cover (even if it's only a couple nights out of the week) in the Western Addition.  Four stars for delish infused vodkas, fun DJ's and cool artwork.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: 3.5  LOVE LOVE LOVE the music on Fringe nights, where they play indie music videos all damn night.  Great crowd, great music, great bartenders, great (cheap) photo booth.  I really enjoyed it and want to come back OWWWWWWWW!

OFNFtTc48LmXNk_NeZe9dw.review_text: I am a fan of Madrone.  I have gone to several of their different nights... salsa, 80's, Prince vs. Michael.  I have had a great time at all of them.  The place can get packed, but there is always a good time to be had.  The staff is friendly and the drinks are good too.  Parking can be a pain at times, but if you MUNI it, you should be fine.  I am still waiting to see the famous... or infamous Ike Turner drink ordered... it brings a surprise!   PS - This place is cash only!

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: This is a place that gets it.  The decor is artsy funky like an upscale coffee shop or casual lounge.  A place that understands that some people like to socialize over drinks instead of coffee and don't need to get drunk and crazy to have a good time.  Music is pitched just loud enough to be enjoyable without having to shout at your friends right next to you.  Drinks are cheap - $2 red stripes on happy hour Tuesdays with all kinds of all deals during the week.  I think it gets crowded and turns into a dance club later on.  But earlier in the evening it's just perfect.

RUMwNN5U7RRPsEOmeAdBDQ.review_text: A friend ask me to meet them at a place called Madrone. Having a sense his artistic background I figure it was going to be a cozy spot to meet up.  When I spot it from across the street, it looked like a small quiet bar. When I walked in a live band was playing on the small stage on my right. The bar was located in front of me.  The walls were filled with artwork and paintings. The art displays composed from people's creative minds and even rolls over to the deep and dark meaning behind each work. Very interesting.  The bar is a bit dark, but it creates a relaxing ambiance vibe. If they had low volume music I say it would feel like a speak easy feel. On a Tuesday evening however, they have a band call Steppin' which plays quite lively. It's been awhile since I heard funk and forgot how funky it sounds. After the first song, I found myself bobbing my head to the sound.  The crowd filled with people with politeness, different, diverse people. It was pleasant.  If you love art and paintings and live bands, this is definitely a spot for you to have to check out.

VmloJ_YR6WMPOrX1Lp8wtw.review_text: hmmm only one bartender for a pretty crowded bar..I like the pineapple infused vodka...where was the tarot card reader that shows on the sites calender, the mango martini was not bad, kinda mixed crowd, and one extra star for carding me to make us feel good.

GzPk6UK01I-u1JNAYkAetA.review_text: A new favorite place to hang out.  Asked the totally cool laid back bartender to surprise me with something after he suggested one of their infused vodkas.  Came up with apricot infused vodka mixed with lychee juice and a touch of soda water.  The lychee fruit garnish was bracingly sweet.  If a bearded tattooed bartender waits on you, ask for the Alan Parsons Project, that's the name he came up with for it.  See if he remembers.

rE6ILt6TLU3pqlzrgB9Ntw.review_text: I dare you to order the "Ike Turner"!    The crowd is friendly, bartenders are nice, and depending on the theme for the night, the music is reasonably good.  Almost ended up being kidnapped by an attractive young lady on my way to the bathroom (surely, my girlfriend would not have been happy).  However, I resisted temptation.  After she made a second attempt while I was on my way to the bar, I thought it best to follow the advice I give to my niece and "walk away".  After ordering my drink, I downed it and reluctantly left.  We shall meet again Madrone.....  Like Nike, "just do it!"  Check their website ahead of time to see if the theme is to your liking though.  The place is small and gets crazy, stupid packed.  There is often a line and cover, so I'd recommend some pre-gaming prior to arrival since standing in the cold while sober is never fun (for me at least).

IfZu2lSjy2wbova4NVDtxA.review_text: Although Madrone is a little hit or miss with clientele, I more often than not have a good time there. I still think most of its DJ nights are a far cry from cover-worthy, but after breaking it down at their "Grow-Up" gig last night, I thought it time to give the dance spot a shout out.
