The drinks are cheap, the art is descent, and the music is on lock, but where are the fly babes? Fly babes, where are you?

l4OBmQR8mw2ioskl50_3Hw.review_text: Fixed track madness. If you work on Haight, this is the place to go. If you're failing your classes at USF, this is the place to go. On Thursday nights, a fernet and a beer will cost you five bucks. On Tuesdays, Jameson shots are three bucks and Red Stripe is two bucks. Wear flannel and get a few tattoos. Hide your Parliament lights in your pocket or people will ask if you have a spare one. One day I hope to find a pack with twenty-one cigarettes.

nPpPW1aWYSMGC62LHI7BUw.review_text: Went for the Michael Jackson vs. Prince night and no one was dancing .How can you not dance to that shite- it's the King of Pop!    Like the bar; 2 stars for the crowd.  Awesome place if you want to stand around and listen to music.

6YNSyQgSW46ciWW3Bt4ohg.review_text: This place is straight Jekyll & Hyde.  If you get there early, its like hanging out in a real comfy, not so loud chill-out tent.  Seriously, thats what it feels like: dark, goofy (TRIPPY) decoration and the same tired break-beat shit thats been playing for like 15 years inside the skulls of alterna-stoners.  This is not necessarily unpleasant and its a pretty mellow place to hang with your friends owing to the couches and super cheap tallboys and fairly cheap drinks.  But then when it gets later (9:30 seems like the cusp) the crowd gets visibly more into DJ Shadow and pot and then its time to go mostly cause theres too many people and now its real loud.    Anyways, they have drink specials every night of the week, so you can get drunk-o for not much money.  But its kinda like an end-up for jocks that discovered weed Junior year of high school, so watch out.

epEHgtHM6lFk4tnVKOVDaQ.review_text: I have to say that I expected better from what I had seen on Yelp.  I thought the photos looked really cool and that the place was "special" in some way.  Madrone was kind of cool, but it wasn't what I thought it was.  Essentially, it reminded me of a bar like Cherry whateveritscalled on the lower east side/in the east village.    I had a red stripe and was satisfied.  The photo booth was broken, which was a total downer.  We left when the bar started to play, but they sounded good (it was a tuesday night).  Overall, I would recommend this place if you're eating around the area, like at NOPA, and you want something quick and easy but not so fancy schmancy.

PphY4YwTrW7pVvjHH4Oscg.review_text: This place is tiny, they have to be over capacity and there is no ventilation. I will never come back to this place ever again. There is no parking available as far as a lot or garage, just street parking which is a joke at this time of night. This is supposed to be MJ/Prince night and again, this is a joke. Whomp whomp, jokes on me for coming. Sad face.

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: Seems like an all right place, although infused vodka does nothing for me... The atmosphere seemed pretty cool with sort of eclectic furniture and whatnot. I did like the fact that they had unmarked taps with your choice of ale or porter.

RLKY7TB0ZRNZPWZAUkISXA.review_text: I checked out Madrone last night for Chase F.'s birthday party.  Since I'm not a frequent patron of the Divis bars, this was a slight change of pace for me.  The inside decor was cool and interesting - a Burbury AK-47 complimented the deer with machine-gun antlers.  Drinks were averagely priced - $5 for well drinks and some more expensive fancy-pants beverages.  Unfortunately, the crowd was less engaging than the atmosphere. You know how there's some bars where you feel comfortable meeting tons of new people, socializing outside your initial circle? This wasn't one of them... at least last night.  It felt like everyone just wanted to talk to their own friends and was blind to anyone else. When the crowd is cliquey like that, the feeling becomes contagious.   Well, that was my experience at least.  But apparently it wasn't universal; some cougars tried to kidnap my roommate, Agu A., using cheeseburgers and beer as bait.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: I don't find myself wandering in this neighborhood very often, but I dropped by this joint on a weeknight...and I don't know what that one guy was talking about when he said that it was less crowded....no personal space here...which might have been more enjoyable if there were less annoying girls and more JFK Jr. look alikes.  But the bar gives off a real San Francisco vibe with a lack of pretention.    Interesting beers, lots of Budweiser 24 oz cans, which is kind of weird to see in a bar.  If I wasn't dead set against being hungover the next day, I would have tried the infused vodka...

bPLL3tqfwBrRX0K5dwgONw.review_text: Let's be serious. Which is the real Madrone?           Fell          |   |          |   | + + + + +  +          |   | + HERE? +          |   | + + + + +  + _ __|   |__ __ __ __ __ __  __ _    __ __ __ __ __ __ Divisadero          |   | + + + + +  +          |   | + HERE? +          |   | + + + + +  +  The one you sit around in or the one that serves you? I believe in giving credit where credit is due. See: New Star Ell-Liquor.

B3_3WVRuHGccKEPT5fbbdg.review_text: The bands can get real, real funky depending on the night you're there.   The decor is pretty hip, the bouncers are pretty chill, drinks are fine wine.  I just don't understand the rampant tagging problem. It's as if they let some hoodlum paint their entire space with bizarre quotes and slogans. It's madness!

31d4d1tVHxT_8LfPvGlzYQ.review_text: Came here for the Absolute Open Canvas.  Madrone is a cool place. Nice ambiance, good vibes.  Decent size location.  Drinks were provided by Absolute, so I didn't venture off into some of the drinks that they make.  There is a wall, that has alot of drinks on it with some crazy names.  Would love to check it out again.  Parking is off the hook, good neighborhood.

licRtf598bJVwtCQbbZ0eQ.review_text: I only go tuesday nights for thug jazz night, or whatever they call it when the sampled funk drums are the loudest in the mix.  I went once on a weekend for 2 minutes but some girl split a drink down my loafer and some guy called me a hipster.  I always thought i was too old to be considered a hipster.  Tuesdays the girls are usually a mix of beathead/granolayoga/SFstate psychology majors which is a plus because they'll pretend to listen to me talk about obscure dubplates and synthesizer patches.    DJ Centipede if you read this tell the club to use a limiter compressor combo, shit overdrives and scratches our eardrums  Don't mess with the Samoans who work the door, it's only 2 bucks for entry and Jamaica's own redstripe lager.  If you really want to be late to work and throw up in a Fed Ex box on the way to your Wednesday 10:00, then have a few to many Jameson shots for $3.

TH7GgCr_PYdr7n2JH2a7lw.review_text: I am very wishy washy towards Madrone. Positives: great bartenders and on occasion good DJs. I love the videos that are played behind the DJ booth. It is also fun to watch people dance like fools.....then again I am sure I have been one of those people at some place in this city. I prefer the place when it isn't over  crowded and doesn't smell like a bunch of cheese balls.....or isn't filled with a bunch of cheese balls. But I love cheese, just not in ball form. Is that contradictory of me?  I stumble upon Madrone to chill with a few people and drink the well made beverages. Plus, it is close to work. Three stars.

coEX0WGa92jJZ0Wgn1WRMg.review_text: I really like this place!  Final spot for the last minute catch up and what a great way to end it... Great live jazz w/ no cover, chill vibe, mixed crowd, and great eye candy! (both bartender and art)...thank you!! =P Love the all the humorous wall sayings and drink names.  The Ike Turner, a shot of whiskey and a slap across the face, inspired a YouTube video of me (youtube.com/watch?v=jrOi…). The suggestion to utilize the photo booth had me cracking up (see incredibly dark attached photo) which naturally encouraged us to take pics...hey!! where are those pics anyway?? LOL Drinks were great and the bartender was trying to make his own concoction of a specific drink.  It was SOOO GOOD!!  =P He asked us what we thought he should name it and I think we came up with Front Porch Swing cuz it had that refreshing feel that you would want on a nice sunny SF day. I'm hearing royalties!! heehee Looking forward to returning to find out what he ended up calling his drink and indulging in many of them!!

0qaI3F0KpKt-r5YZQyI8MQ.review_text: This place is a gem. The black painted walls and mismatched wood and velvet-upholstered chairs sets the tone for excellent cocktails and live dj sets. We went on a Wednesday and the dj was playing funk and hip hop..   there was a group of people dancing who really thought they knew what they were doing (granted, they danced well) and were obviously regulars to the place.. my favorite line of the night was from the MC who said, "if you can't dance, just do the robot!"  a great thing about this place, too, is the amount of space. People rolled in as time went by but overall it seemed well laid out and accomodating to crowds..

AMOEeya9gFDwgsfTwMq1Zw.review_text: Good Music. But you need to be really careful; they just stole my friends iphone from her purse and it is not the first time I hear something got stolen from this place.  Personally, not worth going.

AOuz3QvFLMweGC7MQ_IxdQ.review_text: after reading the sincere note sent to me this afternoon from the owner of madrone, i will definitely visit this place again and make him buy me three drinks ;)  i wrote too hastily in my last review and should of been more prudent in my choice of words.  adults that act like bored, drunk teens doesn't mean that underage teens were drinking in the bar.  a 15 minute visit wasn't enough time for me to get a real sense of the space.  five stars to michael for caring about his bar and patrons.  his message to me:  Dear Noel J.  As the owner and working manager of Madrone, I would like you to know that I respond to all reviews both good and bad. I feel that is very important since this is an independently owned family business. It is also my only business and myself, my wife, and our two children are dependent upon its success. Sites like Yelp are a great source for business owners to get a feel for what does and does not work well within their business. I also feel that people who review small independent business have a duty to be fair and honest with what they write because the words they choose have a direct impact on whether or not someone might want to visit that business.   With that said, I would now like to comment on your particular review. It appears that you came once and in that short 15-minute time frame, you obviously felt very offended. For this I apologize. I would have liked to read the rant you saved the readers from.  As for the smell of the bar, perhaps you would be willing to come in the afternoon when no one is here and point it out to me. I use nothing to mask any smells, the candles are unscented, and I never light inscents. In fact my wife is a smell freak and would not allow this. We have an exterminator that comes monthly and on our last health department surprise inspection we scored a perfect score of 100.   As for the ID's: YES indeed we check Id's and vigorously. I would not and do not tolerate any underage drinking in Madrone. That would be foolish since I have invested all my family's savings into the business. Serving teenagers would shut me down, and it simply does not happen. Our customer base ranges from 21 to 88. It all depends on what time, day and event are happening. Perhaps there is another time or day that might be more your scene. My programming has everything from Live Jazz, Piano, to Hip Hop, hopefully something for everyone. If you come during the happy hour you can usually have a very chill experience.  As for the art, now here you will have to explain yourself to me in more detail. You see, I am also a fine artist, and have been for 15 plus years. I did my Undergrad at Marquette University, and spent one year in the Masters program at the San Francisco Art Institute, before I left due to the birth of my first daughter. I was also the Director of Exhibitions at Root Division in the Mission for the first five years of its existence. I have also shown in galleries locally and in New York. So my knowledge and understanding of Art is very high. I fail to believe that in your 15 minutes at Madrone you properly looked around. I feel that your comment is unfair. I also feel that had you properly looked at the entire space you could not call the "WHOLE' Kitsch. I can see from your other reviews that you like art, and since you've been to SFMOMA you might recognize the same Walker Evans Photograph that is on display at Madrone. I can see how you would call the Pete Gronquist Antlers piece Kitsch. It could be described like that. As could his Burberry AK, and crucified Micki Mouse. I also think that Jeremiah Jenkins "Disco Bomb." And even my own paintings and neon sculptures could all be described as Kitschy. So could Jeff Koons, but it's still art. And  you should look beyond the Kitsch to interpret the meaning. In Fact you should pick up the current issue of Juxtapose magazine as the Antlers piece you mentioned is featured in this months magazine on page 24.   The bar has 38 pieces of art, Museum photographs done by Dorothy Lange, John Vachon, & Patricia Templeton, Contemporary Photographs by Olivier Laude, represented Wirtz Gallery, Found Photos. Contemporary Paintings, Drawings and Prints by Gallery represented artists such as Dennis McNulty, Mic Gaspay, Timorous Beasties & Albert Reyes. Sculptural work by Dennis Otis Johnson, who Kenneth Baker of the Chronicle likened to Sol de Wit., and Larrissa Sand.  And also mural work by Henry Lewis and Victor Reyes.  With that said, I once again apologize that you had a bad time while visiting Madrone, but I would encourage you to come back another time and take a closer look. Ask for me, and I will buy you a drink and find you a seat free of any bad smelling people.  Cheers Michael Krouse

YTqvt6PKmQS-Ygk_JeyXZQ.review_text: I'm here nursing a tasty Stella off the tap, and taking advantage of the free wifi - wandered in this place right before happy hour (6-9 pm). I'm loving the super soft sofa I'm sinking into, and gazing at the great mural above the bar.   The place is a deep bluish green, with big pink polka dots, like bubbles across the walls, where a variety of art is exhibited. Current show is "Pop!", a group exhibition of "mixed media eye candy." Found out the name that one of my favorite local graffiti artists goes by (danyol). Gotta love the european WCs (that's bathrooms, for those who've never been out of the states). Old movies are projected on a back screen.   Given the low key atmosphere, I would have expected the drinks to be a bit less expensive -- but they have an impressive selection, and the infused vodkas and mojitos look good. (Maybe I'm just peeved I showed up before happy hour, just.) I bet it is a great deal different here later in the evening, when people are ready to throw off the work of the day and let loose.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: Madrone Lounge is awesome. I haven't been there in awhile and was quite surprised to find that they have awesome new drink concoctions on the menu. Infused Vodka Martini type drinks are a special weakness of mine, so here was my night's kryptonite:  (Terrible at remembering the names of these drinks!)  I think it was called The Allen Parson's Project: Mango Vodka, Mango juice, etc. Super yummy drink - I will do free research on this project anytime.  (Insert Drink Name Here): Muddled Watermelon, Watermelon Infused Vodka, Lime = Super Yummy Summer Drink.   Forget the names, but not the drinks they were super good and they let the crowd I was with bring in Pizza from Little Star.....

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text:
A pretty stylish place with edgy photography on the walls and an overall darkly urban feel.  I must admit, I probably would have given this joint four stars had I not left befuddled and irritated after asking two girls standing next to my group "what are the good bars around here within walking distance?" to the reply "is that the question you really want to ask us? Is that all you can think of?" Booo to snotty-ass college bizzels.  Anyhow, the drinks were reasonably priced, and a great technicolor effect is created by the back-lighting on the glass vodka infusion chambers behind the bar.
  Update: Went here again to meet some yelpers, which was fun.  But the bambootini was disgusting.  It consisted of cucumber and ginger infused vodka, sake and pineapple.  It tasted like a vile burp.

YlJNqoHqIssCHP25h2sUFA.review_text: Madrone on a Monday night, 5:00pm *crickets*  Madrone on a Saturday night, 10:30pm *unsk, unsk, unsk*  I like Madrone...it's one of the few neighborhood bars that actually serves hard liquor (due to the ridiculous restrictions they have in the WeAdd) and it's usually a chill crowd that hangs here.  However, come Saturday night the DJ comes out and it turns into 1015 Folsom like ridiculousness.  People are sitting at the bar which makes it difficult to squeeze in to even get a drink, even though the bartenders are doing nothing but washing glasses.  The preferable time to come here in during the happy hour on the weeknights.  It's quiet, no DJ and you're more likely to find people playing Battleship than wanna be hipsters trying to stare you down across the bar.  I like this bar...but never again on a Saturday night.

W5cwxNwGiZJd393PCDQEvA.review_text: I have a hard time with Madrone.   I mean, I think it's a "cool" place. If you like to dance it's a great place. The few times that I've stopped in they always seem to have good DJ's & fun themes (I've been here a couple times for the Prince vs Michael Jackson nights), so because of that I'm not totally against them charging a $5 cover, which is pretty much always the case as far as I know.   That being said, at the end of the day it's just not my scene. Since it's usually packed it means the bar is crowded, which means it's hard to grab a drink. Also, I'm always reminded when I come here that this place is located in a college neighborhood and therefore it appeals to a youngish crowd (hey, I was a college kid once so I'm not knocking that at all, but now that I have a 3 in front of my age I'm well aware that there are places I just can't hang anymore).    When I first moved to this neighborhood I DID come in here a couple times for happy hour in the middle of the week (we're talking 4+ years ago), and I did like the less crowded vibe better. Haven't done that in awhile though, so don't know what it's like now.   So yeah, if you're in your early 20's, like to dance, and don't mind crowds you'll probably like this place a lot (okay, even if you're a bit older you might still like it...I'm an old man). I just happen to prefer some of the more laid back, less crowded bars in this neighborhood.

tTW7ILzRPcqDvJvqddlGVw.review_text: *Total* fan of the decor!  Burberry AK-47, old to newer photos adorning the walls, chalkboard walls, a deer's head with rifles as the horns, and old school luchador movie playing on the projector.  The music was awesome!  However, because i'm a wuss I didn't so much partake in the salsa dancing, though I did enjoy the people watching.  The people dancing were super into it but not intimidating for beginners to step onto the dance floor to try out a Celia Cruz song.  The drinks are good and I look forward to returning to try more of them!  They have a ridiculous amount of mixed drinks and infused vodkas that made me second guess ordering my mojito.  I tried my friend's drink with cucumber infused vodka and it was delicious!  I don't think i've ever described vodka as delicious, but this certainly was.  All in all, good atmosphere, friendly people, bomb music, and cool drinks all on a Thursday night = )

gChJBY3dSrfDPhrmRK9mFg.review_text: i must go at the wrong times on the wrong nights..... this bar has always been so so for me i do not know why i want to love this place it has the makings of a great bar my problems 1 what the hell is the dj(s) playing half the time 2 credit card minimums i do not like 3 where are all the attractive people i mean everyone is friendly but i like hot  what i do like.... Ike turner-a shot of hennessy and a slap in the face that you can buy drinks for your friends for future visits....thats just cool  will i go there again yes after all its too close not to run in there and grab a drink

BkHhNGzXaiGi0NhAmmdIzg.review_text: I used to live at Fell and Broderick and this joint was easily my neighborhood bar for a year. I like the art installations, but I wish they were more frequent (every two months). I like the furniture, and the wood carvings, and the music - MOST of the time. I don't like it when there are ONLY two slow bartenders (due to overworking most likely) for a completely packed house. I've left this place a few times because I was waiting more than 10 minutes for a drink. That's ridiculous. Get it together. It's great though when it's not packed, and they have Wi-fi and drink specials and a happy hour that goes until 9pm.

RVcw-fRDdXZ1W0zsftkC-Q.review_text: I appreciate that this place is packed with people who are on the same vibe and looking to dance and have fun. Sad part is when I went last Saturday night the DJ was pretty wack. He was trying to do too much and accomplished nothing. If I do go back I'll have this subpar expectation.

RqUJo6tjD8m4JEuZ37VN5g.review_text: nice neighbor-hoody bar, but i have some gripes: -there is absolutely *no* parking around!!!!  for a neighborhood without all that much going on, why are the streets so friggin crowded?!?!?! -this is not a club--no one is dancing--so why is the music so loud?!  if people aren't dancing, they're probably trying to talk, but the music is so loud i couldn't even hear the voices in my head (and trust me, they're pretty loud). -the bartenders took forever to notice me...i have no problem with waiting for my drinks, but please make eye contact with me b/c i know you know i'm there....  that said, it's kind of funky inside and definitely very laid back...i just don't see myself going back any time soon.

7nzj8i-myMogZ83WYGHGSg.review_text: Madrone makes the BEST KAMIKAZE cocktails. Get the girl bartender to make it, she puts in generous splashes of fresh lime juice and for some reason it tastes the best when she makes it.   Thursday free salsa dance classes night 9pm-10pm.   4 stars is because the bathrooms are always dirty and a really huge line.

r59tvF_PP7WJgjCpA5UDYQ.review_text: I'm quite curious as to what Madrone's offical 'maximum capacity' is according to SF Fire codes.  Because I have a feeling they had 13x that many people there last night.  You literally could not move once you went inside - my friends and I stayed for one drink and then squeeeezed our way back outside.    People waiting to enter Madrone assessed us with a skeptical air as we finally emerged from the bar.    "Why are you leaving already?" asked one young woman  "You can't move in there," my group collectively replied.  One confident young gentleman seemed unimpressed with that line of thought, and proclaimed that we simply needed to "Make our own room."  Yeah.  Good luck with that.

eFmMHYI869hc80BmpdYZ1Q.review_text: Nice little spot. . . and I mean little.  Okay, so its a $5 cover charge which I really can't complain about.  You enter and there's a booth to the left, mini dance floor to the right, toilets right in front of the dance floor, then finally, the bar.  So imagine, part of the bathroom line was on the dance floor.  Hmm, interesting.  It was pretty packed, but too dark to really check out the art.  I went on a 80s night and hmm, music wasn't exactly what I was hoping for.  Out of 4 songs, I only liked one, and I grew up in that era.  Gave up and left.  People there aren't much of a mix.  They were just more Pleasantville than any thing.  The ladies on the floor just did the Robert Palmer model dance.  Think i scared some of them off, cuz I wasn't playin' with that safety dance, so make room for mama.  Ha!  Its a small space but I need to go when its another era of music.  Perhaps then, I'll have more of an appreciation for this place.  Hope to give this spot another shot one day to hopefully change my opinion.

Im-WVGnobeeN5EuLm10BpQ.review_text: I've been here a couple of times and each time I leave thinking..."eh, it's ok"  The drinks are reasonable if you get one of the specality ones, fruit infused vodka, tall boy, or $4 Jameson...other then that my jack and coke has always been on the weak side when served from here.  Local DJ's play here often and many of them are amazing. The bar gets really packed and hot later in the evening, so if you're looking for a laid back spot come early to lounge but expect to be over taken by 11.  Oh yeah and $10 min on credit cards was def resonable considering most bars in SF are cash only or have $20 mins.

-1NnB0KNSHNmru-BHPOy1Q.review_text: Going to this place on a weekend is kind of like paying $5 to have a steaming turd hurled at your face.  You're going to wonder why you agreed to it in the first place, and then want to hurry home to clean the stink off.  Did anyone mention that the bartenders are bad?  When you have to wait 15 minutes to simply get face time with the disinterested, hipster-er than thou bartenders, the novelty of a $2 Bud can wears off.    And the "art" on the walls that some people have referenced?  My underpants have skid marks more compelling than the community-college-art-elective-field-trip-­fundraiser-auction crap mashed around the room here.    The more I think about it, the more I dislike this place.

_wtXEXgvVc7ryMVrQW4EMw.review_text: Stopped by here on Saturday night before going to a late night showing of U23D at the Metreon.  It would have been nice if they could have played a few slow 80's dance songs (like True by Spandau Ballet) in the early part of the evening (like, when not a single other person was dancing) but no dice.    Overall, this seems like a decent club. One star removed for the co-ed bathrooms (I hate those types where there's no stall in the room and it's just a matter of time before the lock breaks and someone sitting on the john is suddenly saying hello to a whole room full of people). And I wish they had Newcastle here. But you can't beat the $5 cover charge for a whole night of 80's music. Even if me and my date just got to dance to a few songs. It was fun.

SxfYHAjK_gU69WP3xEhuUQ.review_text: So who doesnt love a Prince vs MJ party....  So when am I not late.....by the time I got there... it was like Green Day Packers in there. But beside the crowd the music was Great BIG up to the DJ!  Highlights.... The Music The Vibe The shot that got you a white glove ( and who doesn't love the glove)  Lowlights... Too crowded The guys in there were too forward for such a small space where you can't run from them.... And despite being on the guestlist the all female entourage and I had to pay =( yes the sad face and the Whack duck!  But overall anything can be fun with the right group of friends!

s6-4TStyffcTR7AHa552vA.review_text: I live a few blocks away from this place and it's a good Friday night spot. They don't have too many places to sit and it's kind of dingy inside, but never the less, with the right company, this place is fun!

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text:
so i had to take a fucking piss. REAL bad. 
  WC?
  uncultured ass mes all wtf is this shit. ahhhh thats right. damn i gots a badass memory. its the loo. 
  after one of them earth shaking, semi orgasmic, semi *holy shit is my penis gonna rip apart?* pisses, sat down for a couple drinks. 
  love the interior. the bars pretty cool, gots nice loungy areas, lots of open space (fyi this was early in the night). all these crazy looking infused shit was behind the bar..... and in the typical womanizer euge fashion, holy crap, the bartenders pretty frackin cute.  
  parkings a bitch, but hey, its a pretty good locale, easy access to all major roads leading in and out of sf. 
  i would def be a regular if i lived near by. must try again. gotta try them funky infusion shit.

ONVlfM_U3swIIDSBqMAqQQ.review_text: I've never been treated as badly as this bar has treated me. The bartender walked out of the bathroom and pushed me as hard as he could as if I wasn't a paying and tipping customer. I asked him why he did that and he proceeded to make sure that the over the top bouncer forcibly kicked me out. Never have I been manhandled for doing nothing. This place, as much as it would like to be tolerant and trendy, is a fucking pick and choosy elitist bar. it stifles and gouges customers like they are a sponge to squeeze money from. I left feeling worthless, they made strong leaps to remove me for doing nothing other than being not their main customer base. I went there for a friends birthday party and it was very obvious that the staff didn't want me there or my money there.

3zyBvSsgLEWYsPpnFIxV2g.review_text: Sarcasm. Being real while being funny...a joke that is not a joke..a way of speaking your mind without consequence... having a certain cleverness about you... Hit or miss, but always good drink specials! $2 PBR $3 wells $3 drafts and bottles  The chance of bailing within 10 minutes...priceless.  Leave this place with a little hint of sarcasm in your voice.

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: I dig the bar set up. The staff are pretty cool. I hear good things about Motown Mondays, can't wait to check it out.

1xvmDofA0MvWDSD2hJAvyw.review_text: Cheap tall boys.  Gotta love that!  I love their logo too.  They have live music and this one 80's cover band that plays from time to time who are amazing!  And they have a ton of infused vodkas.  It's kind of dark in there and it gets kinda crowded.  But still, great place.

RYVt_pJpPvnEZos6mHnHrw.review_text: I'm not sure if I'm too cool for Madrone, or if Madrone is too cool for me.

lU9JP5Rxu-tineBODGWX0A.review_text: Checked this place out, after suffering the line to get into Roe's on a Friday night.  Dollar for dollar, a better experience, I'm sure.  Not that I'm trying to be frugal or anything, there are just some days when I'm not into designer drinks, labels, or deco.  Madrone's offered a cool experience with a $5 cover to boot.  While it was my first PRN vs MJ nite and I thought it was awesome, I'm sure locals (like me!) might think this a bit trite two years running.  I dunno, they've got a pretty vast library b/t the two of them and it would probably take another two years of mixing to run through their prospective catalogs anyway.   Drinks may take awhile to get, but they got PBR's, man!

5N8kLJS6O_opVCEjs1k27g.review_text: I went here last night and was underwhelmed. The crowds were unbelievable. I felt unsafe and claustrophobic the entire night. They must have been violating the fire marshal's code by at least 75 people. It was shoulder to shoulder and only two bartenders. I just wanted two cans of beer and it took me about 15 minutes.   We came here for the dancing and 80% of the time the music was House/Techno. Nothing will put me in a bad mood quite like techno, it was loud and horrible. I was with a bunch of friends and couldn't find them most of the night, getting from one end to the other was impossible. I am going to do my best effort to not come back to this place.

Dbq1m-h1FMEdqN0UjFS_DA.review_text: I love Madrone's! They have two drinks that I absolutely love! The Lola & this Watermelon drink-both are super refreshing! I took two of my friends from out of town to Madrone's and let's just say DRAMA! One of my girlfriend's was tipsy and kept bitching to the DJ to put on Britney Spears...I tried to explain to her (it's not that kind of place). I felt really bad  for the DJs, but oh well. So i ordered another Lola and just danced the beat of BIGGIE woop woop! Then my other girlfriend was in the midst of breaking up with her boyfriend and trying to hook up with this other guy right in front of her ex. So i drank another Lola and just danced to Michael Jacksoon! Besides my friends, the drink Lola and I got along just fine! hehehe

fO2ZIskuakH-8leyG_St-w.review_text: hands down one of my favorite places to boogie the night away and get a drink...or two...or three. their specialty drinks are delicious and the d.j.s lay down some slammin beats! oh, and if you happen to be looking around whilst waiting for your drink, the art is pretty freakin rad too. for a good time call on the madrone.  side note: don't expect to find parking. walk, skip, jump, whatever tickles your fancy. cabs are easy to grab when you're ready to get the f*$% outta there. good food spots are just around the corner in lower haight. enjoy!

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Great happy hour.  $3 well drinks til 9pm.  Infused vodkas; cucumber vodka was quite refreshing.  Lots of seating.  Cool DJs.  Art for sale on the walls.  I'm hungovertarded right now and can't think of anything clever to write.  I blame you Madrone.

bBbdNye7PPMqjdExdA5stQ.review_text: I can only comment on PVM nights.  And, believe you me, I have to thank my girl Meredith for introducing me to the PVM momentum.  Because, seriously, most of the time I feel like I'm the only one who really knows all the words to all those 80's and 90's Michael and Janet songs (sorry Prince, I haven't memorized anything else besides - "Rasberry Beret... The kind you find in a second hand store").  Don't hate me if I totally f'ed that one up either.  I know I'm not going to ever find my own Prince Charming here at Madrone... I usually go for the guyz that know how to work it to R Kelly's "Bump and Grind" - if you know what I mean.  I had a nice conversation with a nice Jewish boy last time I was here.  I think he was some type of musician but, then again, I also remember I was the one who bought us double shots of Belvedere.  Everything after that was kind of a blur.  It's a great place to hit the 3rd Saturday of every month with your girls, as long as they're ready to shake it in front of the DJ booth.  If u don't know, now ya know...

U2fLiI5giMdiUy07yXLSCQ.review_text: Who knew that at the intersection of Fell and Divisadero you could rearrange the letters that spell Madrone and magically get Mish Mash? I certainly didn't - at least not until I repeatedly visited the establishment. As far as I can tell, the Madrone just can't decide what it wants to be so it settles for a mish mash of everything under the sun. Sometimes there's a dj (who is usually playing a mish mash of random crap), sometimes there is a band and sometimes nothing. This bar claims to feature the work of local artists and it true that there is art on the wall, but it is in no way featured prominently. To add to the mish mash there is a long (and relatively good) cocktail list and infused vodkas which seem to be on the fancy schmancy side, but also Budweiser tall boys. It should only follow that the crowd that tends to frequent this place is a mish mash of people as well. But you know what, despite my bitching about the lack of a defined scene here, when it is not too crowded it is a great place to grab a drink with a few friends. I have always found that the bartenders tend to have fairly heavy hands, so what can be bad about that?

pauOTA3dvD944S6IhDAiBQ.review_text: Came here after late dinner and this place was packed on a Thursday night. When I say packed, I mean like you literally had 3 bodies up against you at one time. This place was bumpin some serious hip hop and reggaeton jams on that night. The DJ was sick throwin it back to De La Soul and Skee-Lo. The drinks weren't watered down either, although i just had a Makers Mark on the rocks. Decor was dope...would come again.

zpnd-D0-ahcfrYYLvt04oA.review_text: The drinks are fantastically affordable (or maybe my idea of affordable is just warped), the bartenders friendly and fast and they have tall boys.  That's right, big tall cans of Budweiser so you can get in touch with your white-trash roots if need  be.  I've been here twice, most recently over the weekend for an 80s cover band concert that went from good, to better, to great (they ended with "Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey, so duh, it finishedd awesomely).  It gets HOT in this place and really CROWDED, so be prepared for that.  It's a small bar, so these things are inevitable.

zLqrtWknpVcIk4ACFouqZw.review_text: I try to make it at least once or twice a month to Motown Mondays and Madrone's. If the music doesn't already speak for itself, the drinks do, try to Lola or the Dirty Sanchez. Good people, great dancing, I meet someone interesting every time.  Oh, and late night hotdogs grilled up right outside, as well as the occasional fried chicken and waffles. They've got it all ;)

7nUIDRxi7o50agPP3Wo1FA.review_text:
Madrone bar has a lot of things going for it which I will list out only because the headache I have right now, after spending an evening drinking there does not allow (ouch ouch ouch) me to compose complete sentences (ouch ouch ouch) without my head throbbing (ouch).
  -Good location in that new area whatever you call it, close to a bunch of restaurants
 -Nice and friendly bartenders
 -Neat drink menu with infused vodka's although I stuck with plain ol' dirty vodka martini's. . .yes of course Ketel One (Dutch vodka tastes best)
 -DJ with cool music but not too loud so you can chat with your friends without having to yell
 -Cozy couches to sink into after the third martini
 -Open space/nice layout
 -Large clean nice smelling bathrooms (well until someone barfed in one of the sinks, people, if you're in a bathroom and feel like you're going to get sick, barf in the toilet!)
 -Nice crowd of cool and friendly people
  In summary, I like Madrone.  It's got a cool bohemian European vibe which I quite like.  
  Check it out.

aS8mvg6EYBQrPp7n36MUOw.review_text: Is the $5 cover really worth that super sexy/possibly gay bartender?  .....I'm not sure.  But they do sell PBR so I may return on that basis alone.

60EfgK-KSNA5muQnr1Rbyw.review_text: since my sentiments have been made (and better articulated)in previous reviews ,i'll keep this short and sweet.  Atmosphere/crowd: chill, unpretentious music: Brilliant. all that hiphop,soul, ol skool pop shit i love (kero one and giant are gonna be here on Sat 5/24. pure dopeness) drinks: cheap and strong nuff said.

UzUnpnlH1n346MDgaFMOmw.review_text: I met up with some friends here last night for the first time and it was totally and utterly dead for a Saturday night.  The crowd was super strange and all over the place.  I loved the dude in roller blades groovin to the old school hip-hop beats.  I was tempted to go join him, but was afraid he'd show me up with his twirls and superfly moves.  The space is cool, very eclectic and funky.  Bartenders were attentive and they had a great special on Prohibition Ale, score! I'll probably come back either before or after dinner at Nopa.  Other than that, not sure I'd make the trip.

zIDUDgoHsfvsi8oS8QlgIA.review_text: music = great - went to the michael jackson/prince experience last night - it was perfect!   drinks = I dont know? I only had water & a shot of patron, I couldnt tell you if their mixed drinks were good?  at first it was kind of annoying to stand outside, waiting.... they were doing 1 for 1 with people coming and going. but holy hell after going in and realizing how HOT it was (Michael Jackson theme, of course it was hot!) I appreciated that it wasnt ridiculously crowded - plus, there was perfect room to actually DANCE and not just do the head nod thing that you have to do in a crowded dance floor.   like the non-pretentious vibe in there and the writing on the walls.   Good times!

Zn7lIByuJmQQMVTK7rNAyQ.review_text: Came here on a Friday for 90s night. Got there right before 10 to avoid paying cover. I'm pretty sure every song they played is in my iTunes library, and sang along to every jam they played like I was in junior high. Candy Rain? WHAAT.  Had so much fun watching all these drunk 20 & 30-somethings bump and grind to Snoop Doggy Dogg's "Ain't No Fun". I must've been 10 when that song debuted.

yGAUsYDiAGwDYtjpdXev9g.review_text: Went for the first time last night for the Michael Jackson vs. Prince dance party and it was a blast!! Got pretty crowded but had fans blowing in the dance floor for cool air and never waited for a drink.  Great neighborhood outing and perfect excuse to rock a Fedora!

gjhzKWsqCIrpEd9pevbKZw.review_text: A nice addition to the neighborhood.

84wLgMGWn5voJgpL6U1nIw.review_text:
The owner of this place once was invited to our apartment for drinks, and then she called her friends and took off, WITH OUR GLASSES.  ???
  Also, what's with the cover charge for a western addition bar?  And pretentious hipsters or Marina people every night of the week?  Never had a good night here, so I stopped going.
  You're better off saving your $5 and going to the Page Bar or Waziema.

w2kHG3Uw86GKoXBQitQm_Q.review_text: whatever winter ale they had there was delicious and made me tipsy. also fun live music! and rotating art. like like.

l2pLgH6mY1Fa9rbDhGzFlA.review_text: It's aight. The coffee martinis are a *very* nice way to wake up when last call rolls around, so there's that. It gets hot in there when the dance floor gets crowded and it's basically one big giant room, so take from that what you will. Friendly crowds on occasion too. It definately adds to the nightlife of the Divis corridor.  Cover charges every night of the week are super lame though. Especially if you live in the neighborhood (like me) and have to actually deal with the noise/drunk people that place produces.  Cheap-ass tall boys of Bud and damn good cucumber-infused vodka too.

5GWm51toZ6cqHjkCk-NVpg.review_text: I love, love, LOVE the infused vodkas at this place. Cucumber, pear, mixed berry, dried apricot.... all to die for. Only reason for the three-star rating is the service. One bitch of a bartender insisted on pouring me half-full martinis all night, which at $8 a pop, I found decidedly uncool. Still, I will probably be back, as the drinks are tasty and the vibe is chill.

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: Madrone is a fantastic spot - and worthy of being "your favorite local bar" or bringing out-of-towners who want to experience a good night out in SF.  I don't ever go for the live music (sorry) but rather because I love the unique, unpretentious crowd it always seems to draw... and for their drink menu. I'm a weird drinker. I often ask the bartender to just "creative something sweet" for me b/c I'm picky and don't always want my go-to greyhound. Here, all I have to do is look up at their chalk board list and read the array of fantastic, yummy concoctions and pick one (watermelon concoction, anyone?). Note: the specialty cocktails can be a bit pricey.   The bartenders here know their stuff and always seem to handle their busy bar with grace and speed.

pRBzWnFzaCEtqhYyJ2ZTDQ.review_text: i decided to get motivated on a wednesday night and make it over to madrone (a girl wanted to meet there). first off a 5buck cover. on a wednesday. you have got to be kidding. ok whatever, the girl i met got the first 3 rounds.   this place is small, but the bar is pretty big, and they had a local hiphop group playing. live music goes a long way in my book, as do jack and cokes, so ill give it a thumbs up.

-JWxDtucGhFoy7T9jwSvYA.review_text: Went to Madrone after reading about their selection of infused vodkas and seeing it was one-womaned owned. My friend and I went on a Saturday evening around 8pm, we sat at the bar. The bartenders were nice- they acted sort of aloof and serious about pouring our drinks but they softened after awhile after they found out my friend was a Alabama native. There were only like 5 other people there when we went so as far as atmosphere it was kind of dead but I think we went too early, when we were leaving we saw a DJ and a bouncer ready to collect cover so maybe its better to arrive around 10pm if you want a more club-like climate. I had the pineapple infused vodka with pomegranate juice- it was very good. My friend had cucumber infused vodka with gingerale upon recommendation from the bartender- her drink was excellent as well. We both left with a nice buzz and new spot for interesting vodka drinks. I would go again.

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: When I started going out in SF this is what I expected to see everywhere. I didn't think I would get many of the traditional night clubs of Texas or as many attempts to emulate Vegas but that is essentially mostly what you run into here. Most places just don't seem to get it right which is why you have very few highly rated dance clubs in SF and it can leave a lot to be desired.   This is one of my few places that I just have to give them credit for doing what they do better than any place I have seen in SF. This place is a hipster, artsy, dance bar and they make it work to perfection.   I never thought I would say that coming from the depths of the hip hop club scene but I appreciate all music and all dancing and while I am only reviewing their Monday night I have to say they made me feel at home.   That diversity tho? None existent. This is hipster white people central. There will be a lot of fancy mustaches, PBR's, plaid shirts or good will tees. There will be skinny jeans and plenty of black rimmed glasses and tattoos but these are the kind of hiptsers I love. its entirely white with a handful of color but these hipsters GET DOWN. Seriously I have never seen this much dancing and just general not giving a fuck and lets dance as I have seen in this place.   There are the too cool for school areas further back in the back near the seating and tvs. People are actually talking back there so if you are here to dance no need to venture. Just head up to the front and dance it up.   Let me start by saying its a MONDAY night! Seriously it is packed on Monday. Sometimes i want to go out dancing on a random night and this city can make that impossible so you get four stars just for being open and having people in SF out on a work night. The second thing is that is is totally Motown. Motown on Monday's has to be one of the coolest ideas I have ever seen. I love this era of music and I love that there are people in SF who appreciate it and are willing to dance like there is no tomorrow to a mashup of the temptations or Marvin Gaye. The first time i heard a four tops song come on I freaked out and pinched myself to make sure this was real. This place was packed and people were singling along to a four tops song and dancing in a club! I am sold. Sold.   Add to that the drinks were amazing as well. There is a huge list of specialty drinks on a chalkboard above the bar and you can order cocktails until your heart is content or until you black out.   I went there to meet someone and the whole time I was wishing I didn't know anyone and just wen't there to dance and become immersed in the scene. Art, Music, and Drinks are all coming together in one place and it is a combination that works so well.   Yes it will get crowded but never too crazy and people go home pretty early because it is a work night but I recommend sticking it out and partying with the locals. The crowds are attractive and everyone is mingling and smiling which can make a club worth it in itself. The line can be a little much and there is nothing else really in this area besides this place a few smaller stores. Also it is a bar by trade so the dancing can get out of hand and spill into the bar crowd which can lead to some awkward interactions but who cares you are here to dance on a Monday night and that's exactly what you should do.   A night focused on Motown earns five stars from me no matter what. A Monday night location pretty much seals the deal. i don't know what this place is like on a Friday or Saturday and would likely never venture over this far to see on one of those prime nights but for a weekday spot this place has everything. I never thought I would have written this before I stepped foot in this great little hidden locale.

DpwIBe02eLTuRKjNH7gLFg.review_text: Last night my bike was stolen.  Luckily, some of my friends were here and consoled me with free drinks.  Thanks, guys.

jZbkODBXFDVoZXLm28tjYQ.review_text: Duffman thinks this place sucks! The bouncers are somewhere in between jokes and jerks. The bartenders are slow, forgetful, and generally lame. The crowd is made up of neighborhood skater hipster dorks and maybe two cute girls. The DJ's aren't anything special. A cover charge is completely unnecessary. The set up inside is terrible - quite narrow, impossible to move around when busy, bad sweaty smell, and the art is pretty awful.  Duffman could go on but what is the duffpoint? Madrone is terrible and Duffman is glad he doesn't have to do Duff promotions there.

5qi5RYZ-UsKKMVsKAbYM-A.review_text: Stopped in spontaneously the other day for happy hour with a friend. The place had a really cool vibe and I especially loved the art & chalk board drink menu. Drinks were amazing and all had clever inventive names. I would recommend the Squirt Gun! Cool place, I'll be back for sure.

-bu2wcgpVdLNd8_kLmun4g.review_text: just don't go here. i used to because my friend worked there so even though there were a lot of lame people and bad music i would patronize the establishment.  well now there's another reason not to go there - namely the head honchos are lame and fired a great bartender! after years of service! just not worth helping people like that thrive.  there are plenty of other great bars in the city.  be proud of where you drink!

w49SkDLHKmSckLi6xGSP2A.review_text: the place doesnt get packed until 12 it seems, but it's nice and low key. strong drinks with cheap tab.

a5Y_gk7fFugj_FJl1g3pxw.review_text: I came to this bar on a Friday 80s night and had a blast. I was a little skeptical at having to pay a cover, which I always hate doing. The crowd was chill, fun, and diverse. The bouncers were cool. Lots of people dancing. Great music. Great reasonably priced drinks. Everyone friendly and happy. The photo booth is a plus as well. I'll definitely be back. Worth the cover charge.

8MLVjjrR1fdo8pU-WsFcxA.review_text: Great bar.  One of my fav's in the city.  You've read about the infused vodka, i don't need to say much more about that.  The tap beer is all local, and if your slumming (like I usually am) they have tall cans of Bud, or reg cans of Tecate at great prices.  I like the Sunday special the "Happy Meal" which is a PBR and shot of Fernet.    The band on Tuesday gets everyone dancing.  Can't beat Oscar Meyer who has been doing Boogaloo music forever.  The Sunday band is hot too.  Some of the same cats.  It's an open jam if you can play jazz and keep up.

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: I've never gone for the art displays, just the dancing - however, I always enjoy nights here! Drinks are creative and cheap, and there's a lot of open space for dancing.

qgvfpFKkJZ-JaLFDuy6Aag.review_text: I don't know if I'm quite qualified to write a review, because I've only been here once, but I had a mighty fine time last night.   I went for "Fo'Sho Friday," (although had I known it was called that I might not have come,) and the scene here was great. It was casual, and not at all pretentious. The music was a mix of DJ's, (Hi Alex!) and live bands, who were playing hip hop and some funkier, soulier stuff, which was easy and fun to dance to. The drinks were averagely priced, too ($5 for a well, which is just fine with me.) My only complaint, (and it's such a tiny one,) is that the dance floor is also not a dance floor, so you get that awkward combination of people trying to dance next to people trying to talk. However, as the night progressed, most of the talkers migrated towards the door-end of the space.  Looking at their calendar, it seems like offerings at Madrone vary a lot. I'd check out the calendar before heading down, to know what you're getting into. The neighborhood games and slideshows on Mondays sound fun, and Happy Hours until 9pm? All in all, I like this place. I'll be back.

2ewsQtQiRqICUdA3mGKE2w.review_text: Truth is, I've only ever been to Madrone with Rita C., and she's super fun, so that might have influenced my decision to give Madrone a 5er!  We've gone a few Mondays now, and the first one.... well let's say that I don't remember the end of the night.  Like, at all (thanks a lot, Ashley!!!!).  But that is NOT to say that I didn't have a good time!  Bartender Ash makes a mean Madras, though I hear good things about his Lemon Drops as well (order it with Chambord, it's all the rage!).  What's cool about Mondays, too, is that you can have food delivered to the bar.  We ordered pizza from Cybelle's Pizza, which took over an hour to arrive, but ehhhhh, whatev.  So then TRIVIA around 8ish!!!!  I wasn't going to stay, but then Rick the Trivia Man showed up, so I couldn't very well leave without being completely rude!  We stayed and rocked that trivia (Team Britney Spears now has 2 wins!!!  We'd love more competition, though ;).  So basically, you win drink coupons, or shots, or a pitcher of beer when you win.  And it's fun!!  Come prepared to know what happened that week in the news!  SPREAD THE WORD about trivia, it's new for Madrone and Rick needs a following!!

UqOSpuFXffTisC1ahPbaWg.review_text: 5 stars for infused vodka!!....it is sooo dreamy.

7h0bcz4LlWT_eITUdEX9eQ.review_text: this place was pretty hoppin' for a tuesday night and the mix of patrons was very diverse which was nice.    other plusses:  they had $2 red stripes all night long (and similar drink specials other week nights).  their happy hour lasts from 6 until 9pm.  they have appetizers during happy hour, too.  great dj's spin cool records every night.  local artists have their work up on the walls: check out the photography by kelly nicolaisen, right now.  she rocks!

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: Five stars to Madrone... mostly for the following two reasons....  1. They have sparks and 24oz. bud tall cans.  2. My roomate is a bar tender/bar manager there.  Oh, the room? The sound? The crowd?  Fuck.  Read #1 and #2 you think I can even remember where this place is?

TX9rMdLU0wlw4qF6s3l1YA.review_text: I don't give a fuck I know what peeps say about this place. I have been going to Madrone since it opened, shit man it used to be my living room, I don't travel in much anymore. It's changed that's fo sho BUT When I feel like talking my ass out of a cover (its good to be a chick)and  I want to get fucked up I can't beat this spot. My bartendin' buddies work me out everytime. I used to live next door and I couldn't find my stairs, now I live down the block and can't find my stairs. I *heart* Madrone, Joshua, Mike D., Melanie, Ashley...man I used to know the line up oh well. Cheers to my fucked up hang over....no more shots! WORD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

RyWKKwLzLSWi_8bZd1QWYQ.review_text: I usually stop by Madrone on Tuesdays to hear some good music and have a beer or two - the weekends are usually too crowded.   Last time I was there I decided to try the bloody mary they have advertised.   *****bloody mary review******* The bloody mary is advertised as having cucumber infused vodka, so I was kinda of excited to give it a shot. When I ordered, the bartender said they have been starting to make them with 'blue cheese'.  Wow, now that sounds kinda odd.  She did say that she made sure to warn people in-case they didn't like blue cheese.  The bar tender did put a lot of time into making it, which is always nice.  As for taste- all I can say is that I give it 5 stars on originality, but maybe only 3 for overall taste. The blue cheese just really overpowered the whole drink - maybe a bit less blue cheese?  Not sure if the drink would be really good without the blue cheese, since like I mentioned, it just overpowered it.  I'll plan to go back and try one without the blue cheese and update this review.  Till then, if you want to try an original tasting bloody mary and/or a big fan of blue cheese - give it a try. Read some of my other Bloody Mary reviews at: yelp.com/list_details?li…

Ba_cWbzh2Wghm9runQ0WUQ.review_text: 3.5 stars  My trip to SF this past weekend was planned because of the Outside Lands Music Festival. But due to last minute changes, my friends and I missed the show Friday night with Incubus and Pear Jam *sigh* but I digress. Luckily we had a Plan B that my friend checked out ahead of time.  The event they had last Friday night was "I Heart the 90's: SF's Original 90s Dance Party." I was sold with just that! I can't remember what time we got here but we had to pay a $5 cover, eh not bad at all. The bar was so randomly decorated with a Burberry printed AK-47 rifle and gold-plated Mickey Mouse on a crucifix (I have a pic but haven't uploaded it yet).   I noticed their chalkboard drink menu to the right had a bunch of infused vodkas. In total I ordered three different drinks with the infused vodkas but only really liked one of them. I'm pretty lightweight when it comes to drinking so I expected the three drinks to do me in, but nope I was completely sober. The bartenders weren't really generous when it comes to pouring drinks.  But besides the drinks the DJs were awesome! I was groovin' to the '90s jams for a couple hours straight! They played everything from Boyz II Men, Salt-N-Peppa, MC Hammer to House of Pain. It was such a treat to hear Informer by Snow and Paperboy's Ditty. Ahhh the 90's were a great decade, why can't they make music like that anymore?? Another bonus was having projectors up  where they showed some of the music videos, my attempt at recreating the dance moves wasn't very pretty =P   One thing I do have to complain about was that it was too damn HOT! We got in to SF earlier that day and somehow they just got a random heatwave that didn't leave until late at night. So it was interesting dancing next to all these sweaty bodies since there was no air conditioning. Although they did have ceiling fans that helped to cool you down if you found just the right spot on the dance floor.  Overall I had a great time and wouldn't mind coming back here on my next visit =)

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: Tuesdays:  2 dollar red stripe, 3 dollar jameson shots...need i say more?

DMFcIMcn7xNxw10CA9YLRQ.review_text: I've been here on a sat. night and a sunday night.   Sunday: Laid back,  a place to listen to live jazz and sit on nice sofas Saturday: Feels like a house party where you don't know anyone at first. There are a lot of people on the sofas which are crammed by the door. Once you get past the crowd of people to the dancing it's pretty cool. It feels a lot like a NYC bar to me  The good: BEAUTIFUL! They redo the bar every month with new art Good DJs  The bad: The bathrooms are really really gross.

wMujviQ3I4aoyEoa92BYEQ.review_text: I will have to say, Madrone is one of my favorite bars in the City.  Everyday, there is a different theme.  If you like Motown, go to Motown Mondays.  You like 80s? Check them out on Friday nights.  You like Funk, head there on Tuesdays.  They have Prince and MJ cuts on Saturday nights on some weekends.  They even have live bands that play on select nights and this guy that rocks out on the piano from 6 - 9 on some days.    The Bar has good beer and unique mixed drinks.  They change the art on the walls every so often.  This is my default bar to hit up during the week.

7NNU7DvCNGenbkGtmMxj5A.review_text: So this is a popular ass place. The first time I walked in here on a quiet night I enjoyed the atmosphere, interesting art and loud music. There's a whole wall covered in chalk cocktails pretty much all 10$ a pop and organized by liquor types. I recommend "the Luchadores" it's a super strong yummy tequila drink that is nice and spicy and comes with a dried chili pepper in it. One of these guys makes the 10$ worth it. This place has all the unique hooks one could want. Crazy sculpture, old cash registers, buy someone a drink lists, regular's drink tally's, old tv's that just play static but have images painted over them and weird music nites from DJs to jazz bands and of course the run down bathrooms covered in graffiti. In a way there's something here for everyone which in part is why I never come here, because it is sometimes too busy to handle. On nites with dancing the heat and sweat of the room can be unbearable, but in the early afternoon or rather any day before 6pm it's a fucking awesome mellow place, where the bartenders are kickass and friendly and play w/e music they want and you can chat them up or hang out with your friends. There's a cool booth at the very back of the place that you can group up on but at nite is often times reserved for someone who paid to rent it out for the nite. Which if you're in their position is pretty fucking sweet.   The owner has this fucking huge dog, like seriously I'm talking almost 6 ft long. It's this giant mastiff and you can often see the bartenders walking it around the neighborhood. I think the dog's name is Spike. he's such a sweet dog to boot.  Overall it's a not a giant space that is quite often packed to the teeth. I was surprised how busy it gets the 2nd and 3rd times I went back. On party nights expect a line around the building with a bouncer letting people in for every few out. This place is cash only so don't forget to stop at the ATM in the front. There's also tons of free postcards and ads and newspapers for art events and other cool shit in SF. The bar usually has free fortune cookies and there's pitchers of water on the far end for people. The more I describe this place the more I'm like they pretty much have everything right. Their cocktail list is pretty huge, and on top of it they've got a good beer selection, plus the cheap shit as well.   My only complaint about this place is that it's too popular to go to on the weekends, but nothing beats Madron on an afternoon.

Z5EoiNHWR1i6TjszVMsbXw.review_text: I've been coming ever since this place opened and I love it. I was surprised to find that I had not yet reviewed it. The time has come!  The space: I love the funky chairs and couches that they have all over the place. They are cozy and stylish at the same time. The seating to the right when you walk in is perfect for an intimate cocktail with one other person but also lends itself well to group mixing. I've gotten into some great conversations with people sitting there. The dancefloor in the back can be a little bit cramped but I don't mind because it adds a sense of closeness that reminds me of the old Liquid on 16th. If you can cozy up to the bar, notice the beautiful wood work behind the bar - freaking gorgeous. Another great thing about the space itself is the constantly shifting artwork. Sometime good, sometimes bad, but always interesting enough to spur a conversation about it.  The music: The music here is super super diverse. I have danced to house, bands, experimental hip hop, salsa, dancehall, Prince vs M Jackson...and hyphy. Yes....hyphy. Not musically oriented but still fun is  the board game night. Pick from a pile of board games and get hyphy with your friends. SOOOOO much fun.  The people: This place fools me every time. As a testament to the differing musics that they play, the crowd can be just as diverse. You can find a thuggish element, a Marina element and a local element all in the same space...on the same night. It's a unique combination and a temple to the diversity of the place. I love it.  The drinks: They have an awesome array of drinks. My favorites being the Canopy (an horchata cocktail) and the Rock Star (ginger beer with LOTS of Gosslings Rum). However, lately I've been going for the $3 draft Stella's - can't beat that.  All in all this is a great place to come and get a drink on a slow night with friends or with a group on a busy night where your swapping sweat with the person next to you. It's equally suitable for a thug - a yuppie - a hipster - and every type of scene in between. You can't say that about a lot of places and that's why I think Madrone ROCKS!

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: I really have no complaints about this place. I enjoyed my time there, and if there is another chance, I wouldn't mind going back. Don't bother driving there, it'll take you FOR-EV-ER to find parking, plus last time I checked, it's not the greatest plan to drive to a bar..gettin home becomes an issue.   The drinks were decent, and woo woo can't beat $2 tall Budweisers (i feel ghetto saying that). Hey, it's cheap and gets you where you need to be. The bartenders were decent, and got to you when they could.   It's great that they play movies on the wall in the back, except you don't hear it...so if you're coming to watch the movie, good luck with that. The always have different art exhibits up, so I always enjoy that.   If you get there early, you will avoid the cover charge that no one wants to pay! The djs  arrived around 10ish, and  I wouldn't say spectacular music, but it was decent. I danced, did the robo boogey that sort of thing. :)    I'm glad the DYL was held here. People were generally nice, and I had an awesome time. yay yuh!

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: Came here per a friend's recommendation and will definitely be back. Stopped in on a Thursday night and it was pretty empty except for the folks doing the free salsa lessons and a few dogs (still getting used to all the dog friendly places!). Delicious looking cocktail list (with entertaining names) and all NorCal brews on tap. Two thumbs up. Not super loud, even with the salsa folks. I like.

Lzd7FTvMOvfg9WmR4MoNxg.review_text: Fabulous cocktails, but I've gotta immediately knock one star off for the cash only nonsense.  A cash only policy when paying $15 for a cocktail is just absurd.   Otherwise, this place rules. The entire wall is criss-crossed with painters' tape, creating a rad design highlighted by a mounted deer head. Our bartender was absolutely hilarious - wouldn't be surprised if he did some standup on off nights.  And the drinks are otherworldly. In our group of friends, we sampled the Spanish Harlem (Angustora 7 years rum, Carpano Antica, Angustora orange bitters, & a cherry), an incredible mix of lavender gin, honey, cava & lemon, as well as the potent Luchadore (Mezcal Vida, Tuaca, lime, jalapeno agave, cayenne salt)  I opted for the Herbie Hancock, a gloriously refreshing libation made up of fresh watermelon, Russian standard vodka, lime, simple syrup, and guava juice.  As we were just there for happy hour, I couldn't really distinguish what the 'scene' here really is - but it seems pretty hoppin in the artist community.

7hSJUQLs6oeZIfyktP9c_Q.review_text: It takes a lot for me to say I hate a bar. And I've given Madrone more then enough chances to redeem itself, but I've given up hope. I hate this bar.  As so many have already said.... awful bartenders, a weird crowd that usually makes me feel uncomfortable, inexplicably high cover charge and temperature control/ventilation issues. Yuck, yuck, yuck.  Go to The Page instead.

rVKCodvE9XDsYyd1ShFHoQ.review_text: I don't know what's up with the wack 3.5 rating for this place; this is one of the best bars in SF.  Great music.  The best dance spot for anti-clubbers, along with Beauty Bar.

iAgeUjprA28AQDa80mDuTg.review_text: Various vodka infusions for your voracious libations.  TRY CUCUMBER-INFUSED VODKA. refreshing! death and taxes is THE BEER.   madrone is cool, low-key and they have GOOD BEATS. i don't know why it's not as packed for happy hour. you can get a mojito and a martini for $9!  check it out, weeknight or weekend. different music selections every night. from funktified jazz tuesdays to world music fridays.   no, i don't work for them.

zZhBiivvN4Iq-hyzS9XvMQ.review_text: A couple friends and I went to Madrone on a Sunday to try something different.  At first I thought it was the usual unfriendly SF bar where people talk in tight circles and you have to flash the sulky bartenders to get their attention.    However, as we began to sample the various infused vodka drinks,  including "Don't Touch My Hoo-Hoo" (of which I had two, and by that point, I probably wouldn't have cared if someone had tried to), things began to loosen up.  Some nice folks appeared and talked to us and bought us drinks.  The DJ was super cute and came out from behind her table to dance with us.  A big screen playing a goofy 60's movie featuring a blond woman with perfect bangs riding a moped kept us entertained.  I'm curious about the free pizza nights, so I'll be back. Also, on that note, why wasn't (hardly) ANY PLACE open for pizza (or whatever) at 1am on Labor Day weekend?  We are a tame city indeed.

D1Wbw8tlt8sNCq049No5pA.review_text: Madrone is probably too cool for me with my conservative fashion styles.  The place is neat though with a bunch of colorful Dr. Jekyll-esque big vodka infusion jars up behind the bar.  They have a nice menu of special drinks which all look tasty.  Good music here, but they do charge a cover.  Seems like a cool little place if you're in the neighborhood.

ptLIFLUPwg3MYt-J62s3iA.review_text: It appears that my crooked head and lanky body is much easier to spot than I realized.   Michael the owner of Madrone reached out today to thank me for visiting his bar. This is amazing customer service and should not be over looked. I am upgrading my rating to 5 stars. And not doing so because he is soliciting for a higher grade, but because he's an example of a business owner who truly values his customers and wants all of us to enjoy his bar.   I look forward to a visit again soon!

OcUC2eFhJJK9mG6K4abmXA.review_text: You have to try the cucumber infused vodka. It is delicious.  The first time I came in here I hated it, because it was super packed full of hipsters who refused to make eye contact and wouldn't move out of the way to let you walk by.  But if you come early, or on a weeknight, the mood is mellow, the music is great, and the drinks are strong.

7L2gICvrc_p3bTRq5n8qvA.review_text: I see some of the reviews complain about how crowded this place is. I wouldn't know, as I only visit during the week (hooray for being local).   The biggest unknown about visiting here is the quality of the bartending. I've been there and had a fantastic happy-hour mojito, and I've been back and had one made by the most apathetic bartender ever. (Note-- you cannot simply throw things in lazily and hope it works. Also, mojitos have lime in them, which is why you have a squeezer right on the bar!). I note that Tuesday is highly rated as the best night, which happens to be the night I ran into the good bartender.  Some or many of the bars in the city have a meat market feel to them, where you feel that almost everyone in the bar in there trying to get picked up or vice versa. This is not one of those places. It has more of a cafe with booze type atmosphere, though the above may not apply on a weekend.  Bottom line? Good place to go if you are local and want to hang. Probably not worth traveling out of the way to get to.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Love the feel of this bar! Loved the music. Loved all of the art. Loved the comfy couches. Loved the drinks, especially the Mango infused vodka. (the bartender accidentally spilled part of the first one he made, so he made another, and gave me the new one and the the rest of the old one- score!) They also have a good selection of cheap drink specials which in my opinion is pretty rare. I definitely want to come back here for happy hour, it seems like it would be really chill during the day!

NibzGjnQIre2Xq3khW5CaQ.review_text: Madrone is...ehh...ummm...Madrone.   I've been to Madrone numerous times and had fun (don't get me wrong) but the place seems out of place in NOPA (or maybe I'm out of place in NOPA).  They take credit cards, which can be convenient for someone who doesn't carry a lot of cash, and the bartenders actually make decent drinks.  Nonetheless, there are countless nights when it's a complete Sausagefest, and the ladies who do show up come on the #3 bus from Uglytown but act like hot shit (which I've never understood, but I guess they're a rare commodity so...)  It's a great place to go for a round of drinks with a large group of friends...I guess.

YcIvqCnV8qxamPe5ADYhQQ.review_text: By far worst bartenders in SF!!! Some bar back/busser body took our tables drinks and stuck their fingers in the glass as they were clearing, (which is against health code), so naturally I went to the bar and explained the situation. The very rude bartender told me I need to pay for another drink and there was nothing she could do. Then the next bartender said I was the rude one and took my newly purchased drink away. Never in my life have I experienced such terrible customer service. Luckily the gentleman next to me saw the whole interaction and bought us new drinks. Five stars to the musicians and zero to bartenders.

JhRRBFvqpEmWUXrjHjRuUA.review_text: This place can be cool.  Sometimes gets good DJs and a funky dance vibe going on.  Bump & grind with the hotties, cause it can be difficult to get a drink, especially when the bar is two or three deep.

k5VdkWr1pAMh4miQI8gXhA.review_text: Great happy hour drink specials. Spacious and chill although the music level can make it hard to have a conversation at times. But I've only been there for happy hour, I hear it can get quite rambunctious at night.

pnfVIB7UhvCQ7X2K0Q2XIw.review_text: $5 cover and a lot of weirdos.

IAxrqUQFeGzlDHQeMFktQg.review_text: Great place to go if your on Divis...The drinks are awesome! Such good mix ideas! Random crowd...Not a good place for dancing, but if you want to stand and listen to some techno with a crowd of older men and ridiculously over dressed women trying too hard its not bad...I had a great night after my tasty mixed whiskey drinks!

mOj74WFSeJm--8JFVmH8vw.review_text: I was here for the first time the other night for their 'Price vs. MJ' evening -- so all this is based only on that.  First off, I love Prince.  I love MJ.  Seriously -- these two take up a sizeable portion of my iPod shuffle's memory.  I'm even wearing a "Free MJ" shirt as I write this (no joke).  But cmon people, can no one think of any other theme?  Why are these two continuously pitted against one another for the 'ultimate mashup' evening -- a battle which seems to repeat itself every goddamn 4 days at some different venue in the city??  Maybe once a year -- something to look forward to, something to anticipate and plan an outfit for and tell your friends not to go out of town that weekend -- that's what I want.  And while we are talking about what I want: I also want space.  Especially since this uberpop mashup of the century (read: week) is the best dance music ever!!11  God, Madrone couldn't have been more crowded.  Stop letting people in.  It was 10PM and all of 50 people filled the place to the brim.  You couldn't move.  You couldn't get a drink.  You couldn't even begin to think about dancing -- the thought would take up too much space and some girl would shoot you a nasty look and 'mindlessly' box you out.  That's what I hate: when a place packs them in to the point that generally nice people turn into catty space-mongers.  "It isn't their fault," I kept telling myself, "it is Madrone's fault."  Then I hip-checked the bitch to the beat of 'Don't Stop Til You Get Enough"  OK, one last gripe, since I feel like being an asshole:  I don't usually care to give my opinion on DJs.  I wouldn't know what to do if you put me up there, so I normally go easy.  I'll comment on the TYPE of music they are playing, but that's about it.  Well, not this time.  What the hell was going on with the music?  It seriously seemed as though someone had plugged in their iPod to the sound system -- better yet, my iPod shuffle -- and was just fumbling through some Prince & MJ songs.  Transitions were confusing enough to make you stop (luckily you hadn't really been dancing anyway, given the aforementioned space issue) and then there were strange interludes of 10 minute video clips from a Hall of Fame induction.  All in all, I could see enjoying myself here if there were 15 people in the place.  Good deal on my shot & beer -- and it looked like my old living room.  But my group and I were hoping enough people would leave so that it would be tolerable, but we simply ended up being the ones with the lower threshold.  Maybe it was great after we left and freed up 5 sq feet.

LfFkMUd1jjCA_RrETCeHRw.review_text: Positives: - Fun dance floor (when it's not overcrowded) - Great lounge chairs and couches - Good happy hour deals from 4-9pm every day ($1 off drafts, $2 PBR, $3 well drinks, $4 mojitos and infused vodka)  Negatives: - Gets way too crowded around midnight.  It's not possible to move, let alone dance. - I went on Prince v. Michael night and although that's what the name says, I was hoping for a little more variety in the songs and artists.  I heard a few songs more than once over the course of the night.  - The bathrooms are inconveniently located in the only walking path, so waiting for them is a mess.  I think I'll try out Madrone on a non-Prince v. Michael night and perhaps at an earlier time when it's not so crowded.

CfV_axQI2rK0eHB9FfG_GQ.review_text: Interesting space. The bar seemed well stocked and they had lots of options but I wasn't expecting their cocktail list to be $8-$12 bucks. The space is big but there isn't a lot of seating, I guess this makes sense because they do dance parties but extra movable seating would be awesome. I'd come back for indie dance night but not adding it to my bar rotation.

PQPk3yifh1O0C7tYAmGfLg.review_text: +3 stars for being exciting, with plenty of fun art, dancing, rotating fun theme nights.  +1 stars for having great, knowledgeable bartenders who *really* know their whiskey, gin, other spirit varietals.  I goof around in these here reviews - but if more bars in SF were like Madrone I think folks would go out more and spend more cash.   Srsly.

2LIX6kOFFExqPaHy2_kRNA.user_name: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.
2LIX6kOFFExqPaHy2_kRNA.review_text: this is the bar i wish i either owned, dj'ed, bartended, and/or janitored. hipsters, please don't ruin this fine place. thanks in advance.

8amLrLmaxi-NVg6n2wB40g.review_text: I had never been there before, but have since moved my clothes and toiletries to the bar, and claimed one of the beat to hell couches as my bed.  Sorry Hun, in the world of dive bars you have to fend for yourself...enjoy the apartment.  Loved it.  Great DJ just playing relaxed music, showing the DVD about the last tour of "The Band", and most importantly $2 Red Stripes.  Hooray Beer - respect mon!  Of course, as my coworkers like to rag on me, I also enjoy those bars that are fortunate and trendy enough to have 2 inches of sand/dirt/grim/spit/etc. on the floor...it makes for great conversation.  Also - I find that I usually leave on the earlier side (like 9 - 10ish) to go somewhere else.  Not sure what happens after that.

K_Zn-LkipFGMuaR_ug2vcw.review_text: It's kind of like those As Seen on TV merchandise--everything looks better in the pictures.  I drive by this place a lot and have always wanted to check it out.
