I saw the PVM pictures here on Yelp and the place looked like a cool place to dance to some more-retro-than-your-average-club music. Well, I also thought Madrone was bigger than it actually is. The place is half-club, half-lounge, but luckily I went on an off-night, so it wasn't that packed--still crowded but there was enough room to dance. I was somewhat disappointed by the music that night--it was all trancey dance music. It would have been nice to hear some rock.  I'd like to come back again--the people here are pretty cool and low-key. You can just come in a tee and jeans and fit right in. $5 is kind of ridiculous given that it seems to be more lounge/bar than dance club, but all in all, I like the feel of Madrone.  UPDATE: I don't get out enough, so I can't say this for certain, but this must be one of the only places that plays MOTOWN! Sure, when you're there for 3 hours like I was, you're bound to hear the same songs played again and again; but still, the best part is the mellow, old-school groove in which the music puts you. Bad part about it is that it is so crowded by the end of the night! There must have been sufficient fans though because I don't remember getting all hot and sweaty as I usually get in packed clubs/bars.

DrDcxgabnswIJOA6xoE99Q.review_text: I like this place.  Good crowd. Mainly folks above/around quarter cent mark. NOT HIPSTER- good cause nowadays diveylounges similar to this one swarms of hipsters..   Good music. We went on a Friday night which was mainly hiphop. There was a live band there playing music that was a cross of meth & red, jurasic 5 and cuts coming from that era. When they weren't performing, the dj spun dope old school hip hop.  Good drinks. I've never had a gingerbeer/rum cocktail before, which is one of their specialty cocktails. It tasted like cocacola :) The bartender also made some yummy shots for us because we were celebrating someone's birthday.  Good space. There's lots of couches and seats for people to sit at if they don't feel like dancing. It wasn't too crowded. There's also artwork for sale on the walls. I was drawn to this photo someone took while they were on muni. Too bad it wasn't in my price range.  Recommended if you're looking for an artsy hip hop lounge without the pretentiousness.

7tvoeWJHPXVk1ZyPWAyTAQ.review_text: So apparently my experience with Madrone was different than most, but I really enjoyed it.  Based on my experience and after reading a number of reviews, I have some suggestions for getting the most out of Madrone.   * Start there.  I went on Saturday night, but I got there earlier, so no crowd, no cover and no bouncers.  By the time I left, it was starting to fill up, but it was a good beginning.  The drinks are cheap and the location is pretty central, making it a good meeting place for later excursions elsewhere.  I don't know the story later in the evening, but earlier on it's a good place. * Get the infused vodka.  Don't be a pussy - drink it on the rocks.  You get more bang for your buck and it's so good you can handle it, I promise.  Or if you like tall boys, go for that - it's hard to find something so quality in a bar. * Check out the art.  Yes, it is too high, but even without my glasses on I could tell it was some quality stuff and interestingly non-standard.  If you get bored or are just waiting, it is something to look at and it might even inspire you to redecorate (depending on the offerings present).  I also thoroughly enjoyed the screen with the break-dancing, but having only gone once (I mean, it was only last weekend so give me time) I don't know how regular a feature that may be.  I've only had one experience thus far, but I enjoyed it.  Though I don't want a huge crowd to show, so maybe everyone should ignore my post and go with the "it's lame" train of thought...

pY2hKxkXzepgK7uUHSol_w.review_text: I wasn't there on a crowded night. I was kind of curious to why there was so much open floor space, but people told me that I needed to come at the end of the week or on a weekend to see it all packed.   I looked around at all the different art on the walls and then my eyes hit the sign that said "$2 Tuesdays." YES PLEASE! I love a good bar that can also be nice to patron's wallets. The ambiance of the bar was a smooth/cool vibe. This is a place to be seen. The lighting is bright at the bar so you can actually see what they have to offer (unlike the darkly lit places where you basically need to bring your own flashlight), and they have it all fully stocked! The bartender was sweet and he made our drinks strong and rather quick! We ordered whisky-gingers and let me tell you, I like a bartender that can mix so well you can barely feel the bite of the hard stuff. Yum!   I will definitely be back to check out the Tuesday specials, and I really am excited to see it on a weekend night! I hear it is a great time.

7j_syb_HopcSgw5CEVoDKw.review_text: Small, fun little local place!! I love the atmosphere here and the drinks are good too.  I like to come here and grab a drink while I'm waiting for a table at NOPA.  I ended up here on NYE and had a blast, my buddy actually bar backed for them for an hour or two and got us all free drinks which was awesome.  Anyway... this is a fun little funky place which is a refreshing break from some of the Marina meat markets.

cJhX2s50PLFvy3xx0Hpw3g.review_text: Charming, eclectic furniture, shipping trunks as tables, chairs with character.  Ok, chairs with sticky goo on the upholstery, but that's part of what gives it character.  I had a martini with pomegranate in it.  Despite the fact that it's pink (I'm a strong, independent woman.  I will not drink pink drinks), it was delicious.   They were playing 80's music all night.  It's not my favorite because it brings back memories of me wearing shoulder pads and cut-off sweatshirts ala Flashdance.  It was the worst decade to grow up in, fashion-wise. Would've loved to trade it for the 70's wearing Yves St Laurent-inspired-Studio 54-Bianca Jagger swaggering outfits.  Decade 80's, with my tall, tall bangs sprayed with Aquanet somehow just doesn't convey same.  Oh, and the bouncers were not very nice.  They had the look of power hungry linebackers about them, big, hulking, and can pummel you with a flick of a finger.  They pounced on the doors of the bathrooms a few times.  Dudes, that is not nice.  Let the ladies pee in peace.....I mean, please let them pee in peace, Sirs.  Overall, it's a laid-back place to catch-up with your friends, but the fun will stem from your company and not so much from the atmosphere.

bPOwZhbJ0goXsE_-EwJ4zQ.review_text: The atmosphere is great, the decor is awesome. We had two drinks: the" SF handshake" was great and the "sopa honey" was very pedestrian.    Cash is king cause they don't do debit cards however they do have an ATM and photo booth in front.

MmltA0DVXyvVQKFzoOXeFQ.review_text: I love this place, and I've been coming here for years... like when they had salsa night on Wednesdays, which I wish they still had :/ !  One of the few bars I can come to for a drink alone, or even better, on Monday nights for Motown on Mondays with a flurry of friends, or to make new ones! I'm not sure if this is a weekly thing, but I was here a couple of Fridays ago and it was probably the best 90s music I've heard with a great crowd. I also came here for a quick happy hour drink on another week day and there was a lady playing piano and singing her heart out.   Drink specials are good, drinks are good, it's not pretentious, and not a hole in the wall. I've never ceased to be entertained here either. Hats off to you, Madrone!

ynnJh7RBOoAs7DGgjULBqQ.review_text: I really wanted to love Madrone; I really did. The drinks are delightful, art on the walls is interesting, music and events are usually fun, and very few places in SF serve an actual Ike Turner with a slap on the face. But there's one thing that I can't get over, and it's the stupid layout of the place.  You walk in, and you're immediately greeted by the dance floor. What? Where's the bar? Oh right, it's in the back, so you have to push through a thousand people dancing and sweating on you before you can order a drink.   Got your drink? Great, let's dance. The DJs are usually playing a good set, and dancing's fun as long as you don't mind the long line of people waiting for the bathroom cutting into the dance floor. Did I forget to mention the waiting area for the bathroom and the dance floor are one in the same, because honestly, why wouldn't they be?    The best part is when you're waiting in line for the bathrooms with your girlfriends, and guys take this wonderful opportunity to hit on you while still dancing, because nothing says romance forever like the combination of full bladders and awkward dance moves.

maEDOyw7sL9vaCGeKW_iog.review_text: ma-dro-ne [muh -droh -n uh ] ---noun   1. any of several evergreen trees belonging to the genus Arbutus, of the heath family, esp. A. menziesii (Pacific madrone) of western North America, having red, flaky bark and bearing edible reddish berries.   2. the pale reddish-brown wood of this tree.   Much like my affinity for trees, I also freely admit to digging this place - they serve beer and weird stuff in jars (you call it 'infused vodka', i call it 'weird stuff in jars'), they have good art on the walls, they have scrabble and other board games available at the bar, the joint is dark (but not too much so), there are couches to sit on, and there is usually a DJ or small funk combo playing in front of some sort of multi-media presentation (Speed Racer cartoons, etc) being projected on the back wall.  Better during the week when it's less populated.  Definitely hit this before dropping in on any show you're seeing at the Independent.  Checkitout

S6iUfzrWJTTbzJEj20H66w.review_text:
I always have such a luke warm time up in this joint. I don't know if it's the horrible AzN freestyle "cyphers" constantly going down, the cover charge to see DJ-iPod drop some hot Limewire beatz, or the horrible beer selection. 
  And yeah, if I want an infused Vodka i'll put a Dole fruit medley up in a bottle of Popov, y0.

oWDzbX3E9cb8bGdoeo0OPQ.review_text: i'm probably a little too yuppie for this place, but happy hour is nice; gotta love the apricot infused vodka!

hCUveROcJkaxrjtxTId8Ug.review_text: Motown on Monday was a fucking blast. Went there for my birthday last night, met some fine gentlemen, but honestly the jams are so damn good it's worth it just to go to dance. Wish I lived closer so I could go more often :)

y_zSEmjcAiMzZVeMKa7KQA.review_text: I started visiting Madrone monthly back in 2008 when I came across a Facebook ad advertising Prince vs. Michael.  Since I am a huge fan of both musicians, I rounded up some friends and we went to check it out.    We came.  We drank.  We danced.  We laughed so hard we cried.  We found the bathroom, waited ten minutes, and peed so we could comfortably laugh some more.  We found the fan.  We danced a lot more.  There are tons of regulars at the PvM (I believe it was renamed Prince and Michael after Michael Jackson's death in 2009) events and the staff likes to invent creative artist-inspired drinks to celebrate Prince and MJ.  I remember being served a drink with a single white (latex) glove once in honor of MJ.  The art displayed in the place rotates and is consistently creative and certainly adds character to the venue.  If you arrive early enough, you can grab a laser printer print-out of Prince or MJ's face glued to a popsicle stick.  Many people dress up as Prince or Michael, but it is not required.  Once you get inside, there are music videos and live performances projected onto the walls of Prince, MJ, Jackson 5, and Janet Jackson performances.  If you're anything like me, you will know every song that comes on.  The DJs will mute out music to make sure you're singing along from time to time (You may find yourself enthusiastically screaming "HEAD!!" from the Prince song around bunch of people who are unfamiliar with the lyrics when the DJ mutes the music).  Sometimes the DJs will put on some freakishly realistic masks.  My only complaint is this event started to get super popular and I found myself getting more and more smooshed by the excessive crowds inside enjoying the music and zany Prince and Michael Jackson fans.  Between that and the excessively difficult parking situation, I rarely come here anymore, but PvM will always hold a special place in my heart.  :)

fW971v8bt2_dzbiUCZ_7UQ.review_text: If I had to choose between giving Dick Cheney a full body massage or going to Madrone again, I'd reach for the massage oil.  Actually, I wouldn't.  But the wave of nausea that little scenario inspires is pretty similar to how I feel about ever going back to Madrone.  Paying a $5 cover for the pleasure of being squeezed into a room packed beyond capacity just isn't the great fun it used to be.   Madrone was the latest place to host the Prince vs. Michael Jackson dance-off, and the DJs were laying down the best tracks this side of Paisley Park.  Even so, we stayed for about 5 minutes and promptly got the fuck out.   My roommate even got one of the 3 bouncers at the door to give us back $10 out of the collective $15 we paid to get in.    We went to Waziema (which is awesome in every way) across the street for a few stiff drinks and set our Saturday night back on track.

LhrfftgTcZZrw8TbsbxQww.review_text: After giving this place four attempts I'm through with it. It's not just that the decor is dreary or that it has a preponderance of uber hipsters or that they charge a cover or that the infused drinks are not so good, the real deal killer is how rude the staff is from the door guy to the bartenders especially the bartenders -slow and rude all four times !!  Save yer nickle and don't believe the hype. The gal that owns it may be cool-thus the good press form her friends in local rags. This place is more LA than SF

z9cYL4QDlg8-hjSZcx0JtA.review_text: Okay I'm a fan because:   1. The drinks are awesome and reasonably priced. 2. The art decor is sick- Burberry design rifle!? WAHH that's just nuts & I like it.  3. Great music and live jazz band! 4. Michael Jackson vs. Prince night!?! DONE- take me away Madrone and get me shwasted!!   I had to knock down a star because the drinks are cash only and it's kind of a pain to have to pull out cash when everyone nowadays just carry their cards. Despite that, everything else is great!

PuTYlDaCCZAiigYpBJQnIQ.review_text: Funky drinks, a delightful variety of DJs and events, awesome decor, low $5 cover, a diverse crowd, art on the walls and in the front of the bar before you go in -  all in all, a damn fine location for fun.  Probably what you'd expect in a city like San Francisco, pretty much.  I like that it's an artsy dive bar that's a few steps above what you went to in college (oh, the video projection screens - that brings back memories).  I also like that the crowd loved the music on the night I went to, and as I was on the dance floor looking around at the scene and the fact everyone was enjoying themselves on a Saturday night dancing to wicked tunes, well, I said to myself, "yup, gotta Yelp this place".  Since I tend to get into dancing, the fact that I stopped to say, "yup, gotta Yelp it" should be an indication that it's worth checking out.  The only downside and the reason for not getting a 5 star is that it was incredibly crowded - which isn't in itself a reason not to go, but yes, a little claustrophobic and hot when dancing. I don't mind a crowded dance floor at all, but the whole damn space is crowded (ordering drinks, only one bathroom, not too much seating).   This is definitely not the spacious Mega One Named Dance Club (Poison? Sin? Beats? Ozone? Zen? etc.) you're used to downtown.  Not much the bar can do about the narrowness of the size, although I'm glad they had both front and back doors so if I'm there when the Big One hits at least I won't be trampled.  Just a word to the wise for those who care about those things.   However, that's a First World Problem to have - and that the place was packed is an indication that people (at least these smart folks) know a good thing when they see it.  Still worth a visit for a great SF experience.

TytarNmqFDuk11UiCj-bYg.review_text: This place kicks ass and is only a block from my house. The artists who show there are the raddest and hottest! ha, um well...you know I gotta give myself props, homey dawg g money plate. ya hear!

uTSGqJGFwngSLTSckILesw.review_text: Madrone is one of my favorite neighborhood locations. When I want a low key drink during the early evening, this is my spot. When I want to let loose and dance later in the evening, this is my spot.   The bartenders are HANDS DOWN some of the nicest in SF!! NO attitude, super friendly and fun!  Prices are great!  I love the mixed drink selection!  Full bar!

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: DYL Review Time!!  Ok, the reason why I only give this place four stars is because some of the music/mojito's I had. The mojito is my new favorite drink, and since I'm an alcoholic in training I've had an inordinate amount of them...so I know what it's supposed to taste like.   TOO MUCH ALOCHOL MAKES ME A PUKEY PANDA. There was too much alcohol in the drink! I mean, don't get me wrong, I LOVE to be a cheap date but seriously....I've had better.   The music didn't make me want to dance, which sucked for Drunk Jaime because then I was just super cockblocking obnoxious (sorry guys!)  Other than that, the location was awesome (despite the lack of Bart...closeness. Shutup! I'M SUFFERING FROM A HANGOVER), and everything just came together perfectly. If they hosted another DYL here, I would still complain about the distance-thingie, but would totally go again.   Next time, I'm going to ask for a lighter drink.   Thanks everyone for being SO AWESOME!

Z_sZ1m90s_sKvmXMkXogZQ.review_text: If this place could get get a worse review I would give it. I've never been to such a pretentious dive bar in my life. They treat women here like pieces of shit. I was accused by the doorman Emmy for trying to sneak in but he is so used to being a dick to people that he couldn't distinguish between someone who was trying to ask him an honest question. When I asked to speak to the manager, mike, he scoffed at me. It took a long time to get mike to come to the front where he didn't even listen to what had happened.  Seriously, I've never been treated with so little respect. I personally only go to place that treat their patrons with respect and where I feel my business is appreciated. This is not that type of bar.

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: Squirt Gun cocktail is delicious! a mixture of tequila, mojito-esque flavors, and a splash of Squirt grapefruit soda. Yum! $9 for a hefty glass of citrus, tangy goodness.  Getting in early is recommended if you're interested in grabbing a seat at the bar, or a table. Plus no cover if you're early as well. Very interesting artwork throughout the bar, a mixture of urban and rural, as there are bottles shaped like guns and rifles along the back wall.  The bar is small and can get crowded very easily, so get used to cozying up with your neighbors and getting a little sweaty.

5V1azKNKRbnmxu2bXDy95g.review_text: This place is overwhelming when it's really packed...you can't move.  But they have a great vodka selection including some amazing house infused vodkas.  Speaking of...try the bloody mary with house infused cucumber vodka...it has a slighty sweet pickle taste (in a good way).  You can always catch really good music here, some of my favorite local dj's perform here frequently.  The bartenders are really cool.  I'm into this place in spite of it's clown car-ness on a busy night.

ghRwENzjazf5b94m5ga5NQ.review_text: A high rating for the great mix of music, art and people.  An even higher rating for Andy - the hot guy behind the bar.    [Yes.  I am, once again, rating a place a bit sweeter because of this irresistible drink slinger.  But hey, sex(y) sells.]

xEc6S6ZTbFeNekKgWTZP9A.review_text: Great little bar in the hood, I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could.  I love the eclectic variety of music here, the diversity of the clientele, the neighborhood regulars, and the friendly bar staff.  There's something really different going on here every night - salsa lessons, live jazz, hip hop DJs.  No matter what's going on, I've always had a great time here.  I'm so glad it's stumbling distance to my home!

4HziAeBVVljDQSjpMm9nHw.review_text: I've been here several times and have had a variety of experiences. My favorite was when a friend of mine and I met my husband here after dinner a few months ago. Apparently it was someone's art opening and free wine was flowing. A lot of it. We walked in to find my husband lounging on one of the couches, gazing dreamily at the bird art around him and sporting a great big purple smile. He'd been there for hours, alone- well, just him and the birds.   Other occasions haven't been as memorable. The other night we went to hear a DJ we like and the sound was awful and waaay too quiet. It's kind of hard to dance when you can't hear the music. Plus it was completely packed so dancing wasn't going to happen anyway.   But, I like this place a lot overall. Couches are comfy, the people are good, and the drinks are decent.

6c2TTMwhC8s5cnjjE41Xzg.review_text: I usually make it to Madrone for the At Large party which has some dope djs. Mophono's tuesday party is pretty sick also, he fucking kills it everytime I see him play.   The place can get hella packed which sucks but I'll put up with it for the tall cans of budwieser. The fernet is cheap if you like drinking dogshit that taste like old trees.   It's a fun spot with minimal striper shirters although you do get some amateurs but fuck it that's expected in the city.

I0KA1puYFNaAIQo28VEbYg.review_text: This is a cool, funky little place that I highly recommend if you like good music and are looking for a place to chill.   There was a good crowd the night we went, and I thought the drinks were deeeelicious.  My favorite was the expresso martini...you gotta try it!

UbZQPC9Z7iOWaRNJ3eNdow.review_text: Love this little neighborhood art bar for tuesday nights. They have $2 pabst and $3 Jameson Shots...plus they sell tall cans of bud. (a personal favorite.) The music is always great as Dj Mophono and friends tear it up.(tuesday nights) The art is always changing and certainly never dull.  The crowd is always hip and fun and there is always dancing to be had if you just get up there and shake it. Its also a great spot to chill with comfortable couches and chairs to hang out in. Can get a tad bit crowded as it isn't the largest venue in the city but its well worth the occasional push to hear great music and drink cheap! Been a tuesday regular for quite some time!

ZM3Y7pPuKu67Q_FOLqGx7A.review_text: Well, I like the place. Whats do you want me to say? Flippin' good brew on tap. That Death& Taxes beer is verrrrry nice. I like. Do you like me? I like sex.

grY-iPjv3QUiPgaSmQWbOw.review_text: I love this place.  Was in town visiting from NY - had an awesome night here.  People were friendly - mostly a younger crowd with a nice selection of IPAs.  The video screen with a constant stream of music videos can be slightly distracting but personally I like their taste so I found it to be pretty entertaining.  All in all this place brought great vibes and I would definitely go back.

zEarwErejqXmDol-gGXDkA.review_text: This is a great bar.  Any place that sells infused vodka drinks AND Budweiser tall-boys and still manages to get away with it is good in my book.  A little over-run with SF hipsters, but I'll take that crowd to the Marina or B&T crowds that populate most of the other bars in the city.

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: I'm a fan of this spot. Probably because its close to my house and a good option for getting out, grabbing a drink and hanging out with some friends. Its a smaller space but always full of people having a good time. The music is hit or miss but that doesn't seem to deter people from hitting the dance floor. Speaking of hitting; you will also want to hit the ATM before you show up as there is a $5 cover on the weekends and the bar is cash only.

HbJtkfXOqPvuYWlnP290xQ.review_text: Mike D. makes a mean cocktail!  UPDATE: Mike D was let go and the world is a sadder place at Madrone. Booooo!

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: Went here for 90's music night and it was pretty fun I guess. Madrone is a small joint which a tiny dance floor. Paid $5 to get in. There was a pretty hefty line outside featuring a pretty good ratio of girls vs guys.  Other than that, yaaaaaawn. Nothing makes this bar unique. Come if friends want you to, but don't make it a point to visit if you live too far away.

_w1VPGRQ57sFIyNg0PXS3g.review_text: pretty pictures on the walls pretty vodkas at the bar pretty people on the floor pretty beats in the air  i think i like  ____________________________  well, liked anyway. the door people are just too annoying, too unreasonable, too stupid. the bartenders aren't much better. it's like the management said, hey, do everything you can to piss off our customers and maybe they'll come back. as pretty as the pictures are...

7_sdsi8LPCWhvtpVPjR9nQ.review_text: For some reason I've had to overcome some prejudice about this place. Despite my initial attraction to the bar, I became turned off by the ever-present cover charge and the fact that it can get particularly over-crowded. Regardless, Madrone has managed to fully win me over. It's got great art, a quality bar, and always turns out to be a blast when you get sucked into one of their various dance parties.

yFcfowj9X6C6zNd6nqK8aQ.review_text: I've come here quite a few times in the past & shame on me for getting around to reviewing it just now!  Came here for a few Prince vs. Michael nights. Ppl are REALLY into it so get ready for that. You got the middle-aged ladies reliving their high school years, and you also got a lot of the twenties, hipster crowd out to enjoy something out of the ordinary. It's very crowded on these nights, so get there early & expect to have no room for dancing. Speaking of dancing...I actually really can't stand Prince music (yeah- I SAID IT) & while I love MJ I just can't dance to that so don't expect me there again. :)  I dig the decor of this small place. It's constantly changing due to promotion of local artists paintings, poems, etc. It's a little dirty but that's all a part of its grungey charm. The bathroom is the kind you hover in, ladies, if yaknowwhatImean. The parking is mostly street too with like 1 small lot across the way you pay for.  I have also been here on 90's night and the DJ is FRESH! It's a little less crowded, def. a cool eclectic crowd full of hipsters & hiphop heads alike. I def. prefer it. I do know that Drew Barrymore has been here too :)

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I can't believe I haven't been here before! I loved the 80s 90s music, cool mixed crowd and pretty casual. I would totally come back when I'm in a dancing mood!

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: Been there once, will never voluntarily go back, especially not with the Page so close. I went there for an Onion Society for Beer Enjoyment event (I'd tell you you can sign up for the newsletters at theonion.com/content/dis… but I won't because I want it to stay secret), where the Onion will buy a keg of a sponsor's beer at a sponsor's bar.  Event starts at 6 until the keg runs dry.  Madrone didn't open until about 6:45, which led to scores of people crowded onto to the sidewalks.  Apparently the owner was being phographed for a magazine.  Once we finally got in, the beer was warm and the crowd was very cheesedickerous (something that can't be blamed on the Onion crowd). In short, the owner was given the gift of dozens of people heading to his bar for free beer at no cost to him, and he made us wait the better part of an hour on a street corner, and then served us warm Stella.  Not the best way to show a "Society for Beer Enjoyment" that you want their business. After that first pint, we high-tailed it out of there (we only stayed that long because we were meeting people who didn't have cell phones) and went to the Page and had a blast.

KmqivnDXe3mVjBtp9ZxkOQ.review_text: been here for a few times for different things but mostly for their Michael Jackson vs Prince party. oh my favorite!!! they have it here and at Milk. either place is way to small for the crowd that this party draws. none the less i was going to have a lot of fun. the place was crowded and pretty hard to get drinks. i like that for this party they always have glow sticks and mask.  -2 for the heterophobic bartender. i walk up, secure my place at the front of the bar. two guy men on either side of me but of course i was there first. so i spend a little time trying to get his attention. he finally walks up to us and takes orders for both gay guys and leaves me high and dry. i know this is san francisco and there is supposed to be this "tolerance" or diversity... or something to that effect but i am still here and willing to spend just as much as everybody else. so why do i get ignored for service because i am a straigh woman? still dont get it.  if it wasnt for that then this place would be just fine. i just hate not getting treated with respect. pet peeve i guess.

sdB59dLuUn3vNx9xk3q6vA.review_text: the owner recently contacted me given my overly harsh and rushed judgmental review, which while it wasnt the most positve response, it was clear in stating future plans for the establishment. Props for taking the time to contact a patron, even if you were livid with my review (understandable, it was very rude of me) I retract my statement because of the fact that it looks like nothing is going to change. I feel like an ass, so take the time to check this place out. Most of the people I know that read my reviews take my word for it.

3xrb0LpbaJ24Pkdyd55U8Q.review_text: I went here on a Monday, so was expecting it to be totally dead. Not only was there a pretty decent crowd there, but well drinks were $2 and there was a DJ!   Decor and vibe are eclectic and interesting, which always makes a bar stand out to me. All-around good place that I'd like to check out again on a weekend.

giPQsjuBsT4yHSqvvoXvwQ.review_text: Love the atmosphere, really great live music. I could see myself taking my friends here or even my musician dad. Definitely an all ages, and diverse crowd but so fun. Dancing, chilling at a table or the bar... And really great design. The drinks are tasty and innovative also greatly priced.

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: Good bar with decent drinks, tunes and staff.  Yummy infused vodka and quite possibly the best long island iced tea EV-ER. Occasionally their soundsystem will break down or their AC so that costs them a star.  Had a blast here and shoulda stopped drinking here instead of moving on to another bar because that resulted in me leaving a rude message and rude text to the guy I've been hooking up with.  That woulda never happened if I'd quit while I was ahead at Madrone's.  That's my advice.

QwTKenm1tadEnYIzPyakuw.review_text: Have only been here for early drinks, not crazy late night hijinks.  Apricot and cucumber martinis are amazing.  Love the old furniture.

uVh2y1lVsc8vhzLSgg_3eQ.review_text: For a tiny place, Madrone has a big heart!    Even when the place is super-crowded, the bartenders are quick but still friendly.  I also like quirky, artsy vibe. This is definitely the place to be for the monthly Prince and Michael Experience.  If you like good music, good people, good drinks, and BIG FUN - get yourself to the Madrone every 1st Saturday of the month!  :-)

hQ8To_s10kfhi2rc4js5cg.review_text: It's Tuesday night and there's a $2 cover.  WHAT THE HELL?  Two bucks?  What the random crap is that?  Aside from the absurd Tuesday cover charge I was fairly suprised that I did not loath Madrone.  Music: not too loud; crowd: not too big; drinks: not too expensive.  The caveat on drinks: LIGHT POURS.  My whiskey tonic had nary a yellowish hue.  The combination cover and light wrist on the drinks means I probably wont be returning to Madrone any time soon.

vRYZpgr8GMAMED_L-U9pqQ.review_text:
I would like to preface my review by saying that this bar received SF Weekly (or maybe the Guardian?)'s "best new bar" award for 2005. When i read that, I started feeling judgmental. Best new bar? Really? 
 I have been to Madrone several times, always out of obligation, and I've always felt the overwhelming urge to tell my party i have to use the restroom, and slip off into the evening, perhaps first grabbing a handful of the sassy little candies arranged in sassy bowls on the sassy tables. 
 Walking up the the bar, there is almost always a crowd outside that bears an unfortunate resemblance to the crowd that would hang around outside high school dances, except now with cell phones and much nicer shoes. I was excited to try a cocktail-- all the drinks on the menu look great. I ordered something ridiculous, and the bartender rolled his eyes and told me I didn't want that. I finally ended up with something in a martini glass that just wasn't right. This happened on several occasions. But beyond myself... They have a lot of events here, none of which look appealing. Maybe this bar just isn't for me. Or I am not for it.

4arlBZEnIKR5H8xlYcL6AQ.review_text: MOTOWN MONDAYS! props to timoteo gigante and gordo cabeza for making this one of my favorite neighborhood nights hands down.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: I hate leaving NB so when a friend of mine suggested this out of the way location for our evening festivities, I hesitated, bit my lip and worked out my best fake optimism muscle.   Needless to say I'm so glad I did! We had a blast! The bartenders were all very nice and accommodating (guy behind the bar who gave me the rubber band, random I know but damn you are cute and I will be back just for you!) and poured a mean vodka martini. I loved all of their cocktail selections and they had decent happy hour prices. Though it's cash only right now, there was a glitch I guess in their systems, so the credit card machine will be back in action this coming week.  The new owner is legit and after speaking with him for a little while I realized he has great plans for this place and I can't wait to see him finish them all. So, I will def be back! Thanks guys for the great night :)

LeAJ6DdNrar1OQdj4iIEeg.review_text: madrone's wednesday night happy hour w/ $1 pbr's and $3 jameson shots = a serious phucking hangover on thursday morning.  cool space, aight artwork, good bartender, and a nice selection from the dj (everything from boards of canada to james brown).  with all the fixed-gears locked up outside and everyone in the bar sporting official mission uniforms [skinny diesel jeans / old cowboy shirts / thrashed vans slip-ons] and me being kinda drunk ... i got all disoriented when we walked back out on to divisadero ... and thought to myself "when did they put a center divider on valencia street?"

1z5LVnZhXrWgsQgMDpIIzw.review_text: i love any place where i can get $2 red stripes all night and a bud tall boy for cheap.  AND if you're from the 94117 like me, Monday nights are for you - show your ID, get $2 well drinks all night.  i'd have to say that tues night is my favorite - the $2 red stripes and $3 jameson shots, DJ lifeone usually from 6-9, and the some other great DJ the rest of the night (one night it was all old skool funk-iliciousness).  they tend to have covers thur-sat after 9pm, so i like to come on the other days (when it's not so crowded and i can actually get into the bathroom) or come before 9pm, partake in their cheap drinks, and then hop off to another place.  and i always hit it before shows at the independent - better than Fly, which only serves wine/beer/shoju cocktails.  i have even been to a few art shows there.  they have a good mix of music too.  i went there for my birthday a few wednesdays ago and, they had a live hip-hop group - the place was going OFF!  i like this place - good drinks, reasonable prices (and lots of drink specials, which are hard to find in this town...), good DJs, rotating art on the walls and art openings, 94117 night, industry night, even some light eats, nice bartenders, interesting cocktails and infused vodkas, couches and puffy chairs on which to lounge (if you get there early enuf) - the only drawback is that it's pretty small and it gets a large crowd, only 2 bathrooms, so it's not for the claustrophobic or tiny-bladdered folks.

WJnEifJRkI6bCH2iw8brFg.review_text: Went to Madrone for the 1st time last nite, we really enjoyed it!   Smaller space with an attractive easy going crowd... good cocktail menu, reasonable prices ($5 cover). It was crowded, but not obnoxiously so.   Will definitely return if I'm in the area again.

CVlGVvlR436OH8Q1pHfz-Q.review_text: The bar was pretty decent. I was invited to hang out with my homie Gillian C. for her birthday, along with some familiar faces and some new faces. I can be safe to say that we all had a pretty good time mingling.   One cool thing about the bar that was pretty cool was that they allowed outside food in the bar. Little Star Pizza was perfect bar food! I had a great time and am lucky to have such great new friends!   Overall I see myself coming back sometime!

CJKrqZ3yTmmVpa_6xZeMHw.review_text: Their happy hour offerings are OK. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it is a good place to get a bit tipsy before a show at the Independent.  Good place to see people awkwardly dance to the well, awkward music.

_Ie_x7KTxHpvKHyN0toCAQ.review_text: I'm a fan! I'll admit, I was initially deterred by the crowds out front and the gold AKs and antlers. Unfortunately, my fave jacket in the world was also lifted from this bar. The bartenders were very helpful and understanding though.  That said, Beatloaf feat. The Polish Ambassador was the shit. Funky jazz, soul, or other music keeps me coming back. The Fringe indie dance party, although full of killer music, was a bit crowded. Still, when I need to get my groove on within walking distance, this is where I go for a $0 - $5 cover, Tecates, and tight beats every time. Keep up the good work.

qEdxnnadZ2tcU9JOXjnGdw.review_text: #189. We waited at least half an hour in line.  That wasn't too bad until I saw what happened when I was at the front.  There were clearly people who didn't have to line up. And the bouncers were cool with it. That's not cool for the rest of the people who just got cut in line. Outside. In the cold.  Once we finally got in, the place was disappointing. It wasn't even full. The crowd that night was kind of strange too. They were playing some funky 60s tunes that you couldn't dance to-- what happened to the old school hip hop?

aJbXWA8OuA4mx0B67dXwNw.review_text: I was cruising, yes, cruising, the other day with my homegirls and we kept on spying this bar, "the tree place"- because of the big tree in front, not because it's that name. Then we found out the name, and it's one of my favorite California native species, then, I went there and had a good time. - they re-made my drink because I didn't like it. they didn't have to! They did! I appreciated it, since I ordered poorly! - people were friendly. Someone asked about my silly shirt, another guy talked to me about how awful photography is as an art form (he was high). - that inexplicable vibe that says: feng shui. it's got the chi flowing, a lot of it - the seating space is available, but not everywhere, but occasionally. Hard to explain: I felt like I coudl stand and chat with people, or sit down and chat, and I didn't feel like it was either way predominantly. good design. - the tree is cool - it's in a nice neighborhood, near place I usually am going (Independent, i.e.)

Wo_NHSfx08F0-A_vS0M28g.review_text: This is a good bar, period. The place is laid back, has some good drinks, and always (at least the times I've been there) has great music. Yes a lot of hipsters make up a good portion of the crowd, but really what's wrong with that? At least there is some guaranteed good indie music blasting  (that is if you come by on a fringe night).   It's definitely a good bar and I'm never disappointed when I go. The only downside is that I don't live in the city, but oh well!

cMrTtttsIdlNRYGOu9NF4w.review_text: Not, bad, the drink prices were fair and the bartender. Granted, we came here on a Monday night while visiting San Francisco. There wasn't a cover or anything. And the decor is pretty nice.   I believe it was Motown Mondays. This place was dead but it was nice to have drunken friends along for the ride. They managed to keep me entertained while trying to get through Diana Ross' "Ain't No Mountain High Enough".  NOTE: there is a $20 drink minimum to use the credit card as payment.

NNPnpRtX36F_cT1Ywl4OZA.review_text: red stripe tuesdays are fabulous but the crowd is a bit much as the night rolls in.

94b0y-FFFIF8hy3SJgXd-g.review_text: When Madrone Lounge opened, time stood still. Angels came down from heaven, fairies dusted their sweet remnents along the red carpeted entrance, and unicorns pranced down Divisadero..Everything seemed right in the world and I fully became Nicole Bliss... My friends and I patroned Madrone every Thursday night for about 3 months straight. It was something out of a dream...infused vodkas from every color of the rainbow, art nouveau-esque fixtures, gorgeous re-upholstered antique sofas, bathrooms referrred to as "Water Closets", and PLENTY of SEMI-SOFT porn-like projections behind the DJ. Yes, life was good!! Of course, my heaven only lasted so long. Madrone started charging a cover & the staff became a bit bitter. Worst part is.... someone complained about the visuals being too graphic!! After that, a dark cloud covered Madrone. Angels, fairies, unicorns- all fled ( i think they missed the projections too). It's not the party it used to be, but Madrone has maintained its lounge quality housing great art. Conveniently, if you're in the hood, you can easily skip out early and watch projections in the privacy of your home  :)

XHvfw3UU2YtvvKMLV_oWSg.review_text: Always a good time. Good drinks easy to grab a cab or drive to. I was there last week for Prince vs. Michael and had a blast!   My friends and I love the drink" the dirty sanchez" ooooo weeeee! Careful on those tho- you may find yourself on a crazy escapade after a few rounds of those!!!!

09Zx184-lbV9HZDbyf1y9w.review_text: Had a great time on friday night and music was awesome! The venue doesn't require you to dress up ladies... (I'm fine either way) There was a cover charge of five bucks, drinks are moderate prices, and only take Mastercard/Visa min $20 for cards...  Parking was easier than I thought! Don't remember what kind of people there (mentioned poseurs, douchebags, hipsters) but had a great time drinking & dancing with friends!! I'm sold

m9vkagc4KEn5X47J9WGOBw.review_text: I'd like it a whole bunch better if I could stand the overwhelming stench of cleaning products that permeates the entire joint.  Are there dead bodies hidden here?  Ease the eff up already.  HORRENDOUS.

JseBksW8DVL596kJ18GGpA.review_text: A sweet little spot with some swagger to it. Very dark (I am quite attractive in this lighting), very sexy, and very close to home so I don't have far to tumble after too many cucumber martinis and/or cabernets. I make the most interesting acquaintances there. My only question--the music is almost always groovin--whycome no one dances?

IfHo9BPvVpeuzY8lnJjN-A.review_text: a great place to start off an evening on divisadero!

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: If you come here before it gets crazy crowded, this place is amazing. Comfortable couches, awesome tunes, decent drinks, no cover. If you come here after 10, it gets super crowded and you have to pay a cover...it's only $5 but still it's a small price to pay if you want to experience what it's like to be a sardine and I'm not talking about a new dance craze.  We headed here for Halloween because it was one of the best bargains in town complete with good indie music. One of the reasons I go to these kinds of places is not for the drinks - it's for the music. Call me a music snob but music is what draws me here plain and simple. Fringe played a good mix of popular hits like the Ting Tings to more obscure dance tunes like The Presets which I appreciated. There were so many good costumes I couldn't tell you who would've won the iPod touch. We left just when they started it because sadly Daniel the King of the Hipsters and Buttercup of the Powerpuff Girls had some fierce competition. My only complaint - our lame friends who all flaked out at the last minute. Oh well, we still managed to have fun and socialize with a scary baby, a dominatrix and some other interesting characters of the night. We managed to get a goodie bag of other spooky treats and toys. Overall, an evening well spent.  I'm glad they finally found a better place for the fan...because it gets really hot in there. Hooray for little artsy bars.

1oesrOIBYtaJUr2Ug5aioQ.review_text: Huge fan of Madrone. A group of us had a blast for happy hour last Friday. They have extremely reasonable drink specials: $2 tallboys of Budweiser, $3 wells, $4 infused vodka drinks...  It's the perfect combination of a bar with a little dance floor if you are so inclined to get your groove on. It definitely fills a unique niche in the neighborhood. The infused vodkas are exceptionally tasty and innovative; the "Lola" is refreshing and not too sweet (cucumber vodka, ginger beer, and soda).   Since Madrdone isn't a huge spot, I prefer it during happy hour time or on quieter nights. On Mondays, they have a great selection of board games, so you can play scrabble while sipping your Bambootini.  The music is always fun and groovy, and the antique-style couches give the bar a hip bohemian vibe.

bcPNUajyoMYAJF2IXj--Kw.review_text: Went here on a recent Saturday night. We were in town for a wedding, and friends were having a birthday here. The scene was as described below: lots of dancing, $5 cover, good drinks. The music was great. I particularly loved the cocktail menu on the wall ("For Whom the Booze Tolls"), although it's tough to enjoy a good craft cocktail while dancing the night away.  The reason this place gets an outstanding review from me is what happened *after* we left. The next morning I realized I'd lost my beloved (read: expensive) sunglasses from the previous night. After frantically trying to track them down (and remember the night before) it turns out someone had turned them in at the bar, and the staff there held onto them until I could come and pick them up. An honest wait staff - to me - is worth their weight in gold. Even better: when we came back on that quiet Sunday afternoon, we were able to appreciate all the cool art projects that we'd overlooked the night before.  We'll be back (next time... sans sunglasses.)

KyGkyqSPuJW-Sq7OXPVu2w.review_text: cool little bar. I took a girl after eating at the vinyl for the pizza hacker. Everyday Thursday is "Salsa night" so we danced salsa and it was fun. The interior of the bar is really cool with a lot of interesting art work and there is a black and white screen in the back playing boxing. the bar is cash only so remember to bring cash with you and have fun dancing to salsa if you go on a Thursday night!

_ueX3a8lqk7WPklhrH6cyg.review_text: They serve SPARKS! Enough said. I mean, jeez.  Ok, and I like the trippy movies they play on the back wall. And it's a block away from my house.

lpi6ghcBiPoUZWEN0tZ5Uw.review_text: I'm a Hard Core Prince Freak and can never get enough Prince Music in my Life and the Monthly Prince and Michael Experience gives me my FIX and then some!  I've been enjoying DJ's Dave Paul and Jeff Harris for over 9 yrs now and eventhough I moved back to San Jose a couple years ago I still try and make it to Madrone as often as I'm able to.  I dance HARD from the moment I walk in to the moment the lights come up and I'm drenched in sweat!  Madrone is the quintessential SF Bar with a multi-diverse crowd of super friendly people!  From Security to the bartenders to the fabulous Prince and MJ DJ's to the insatiable crowd, it's like NEW YEARS EVE every party!

_GVlCPjKS3eFM9NsFHv1Eg.review_text: Visited Madrone for the first time this past Friday night, after a couple hours spent gorging on sushi down the street.  Had to find a digestif, and I've eyed this place more than once as I walked past.  That neon chair has always called out to me in some way.  The DJ was spinning 90s all night...yessssss.  He had a particular love for Tribe Called Quest, and I had no complaints.  We went in about 9pm, by 10:30 the place was jammed.  I was really happy that we'd scored bar seats, and I wasn't about to give those up.  On to the important stuff: the booze!  I had a hankering for something ginger-y, lime-y, vodka-y.  That's exactly how I phrased it to the bartender, and I was appreciative that instead of an eye roll she suggested a house concoction that closely resembled my rambling description.  Went for it, loved it, drank 6 or 7 of them.  Atmosphere that night was a little young, but hey, that keeps me young too!    I wouldn't come here for a romantic chat in a warm but forgotten corner.  Then again, maybe they have "romantic chats in warm, forgotten corner" theme nights.    But I would come back with some girlfriends who love to dance.  I will be back, regardless.  I like Madrone's flavor.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: I've been to Madrone a couple of times now and I have to say that I think it is, at best, a really mediocre drinking spot. I love the art & I love the furniture (an inside source tells me that much of it was custom made for the venue) but the drinks are always poorly made & they have the audacity to charge a cover nearly every night of the week (when this is a neigborhood bar, not a destination).  Also, in one of the last times I went, the bartender insisted on playing what appeared to be his 14 year old sister's mix CD. They were playing EVANSECENCE, people. Come on, now. Still, for being a full service bar in the area, it still deserves 3 stars. But not much else.  PS - This is the ONLY place that I have ever almost gotten into a fight with some bitch. The crowd here on the weekends fucking sucks and is full of people vacationing on the Alamo Square Riviera. Hate it. I would much rather have hipsters than a bunch of trashy ass sorority girls who misunderstand how crowd flow works.

ZK25TwHV7UxzTtLXFNacig.review_text: Pick you night with care, it can get a bit weird.  Prince vs. Micheal are a sure thing, but also feel free to show up in the afternoon just to tie one on. Back when Trev was runing the bar he let us bring our bikes in. The perfect place with just enough attitude to keep you typical S.F. prick out. (See review by Jessica M)  O.k. I will admitt it, avoid the local night (the one with the zip code), a bit weird and lame, unless then you yourself are a bit weird or lame then party on mon frere.

vF9C7jqC2uPkBfTiecUeuA.review_text: Friendly bouncers, great bartenders, awesome DJ. No douchebags in the crowd to be found. Madrone's I like you. I like you a lot.

7mzACXQ5F4EduE9jF_tI-g.review_text: I may not even be qualified to write a review for Madrone for I chanced upon it while on a drunk fest, aka my birthday.  I had my birthday party at Bar 821 (incredible) and after the festivities were done there I wanted to find somewhere to dance. I was referred to Madrone. From the outside it looks like a house... but in my drunken state I did not hesitate! (I'm a poet)  I was given a long island, but I couldn't tell you if it was any good because it ended up on the ground.. party foul on my part. (But remember, it was my birthday)  So my ladies and I interrupted a skater video party with our strong desire to dance party. Seriously the DJ was playing videos of skater tricks, and all we wanted to do was dance. In our inebriated state we all moved to the front and started dancing, while skater dudes galore scowled. I would think 10 hot women shaking their things would be more entertaining than an ollie but apparently here a piece of wood and 4 wheels is better than some hot legs.  Of course that did not stop us ladies... eventually we dispersed and the only thing memorable about this bar was the skater party  we always joke about crashing.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: I love this place!  Great happy hour, great music, great vibe, nice bartenders and dancing.  Sure it gets packed, but that's what you get when you have a bar, a DJ and it's past 10 PM.

g-f_06makc0qfm2F-JTCIQ.review_text: Came here for my roommates birthday. We thought it was Prince/Michael Jackson night, but it was Best/Worst Music Video Night and they still played a lot of Michael which was awesome!   $5 cover and CASH only (the bartenders were wearing CASH ONLY t-shirts too...). Drinks were a bit pricey, BUT my mixed drink was several shots worth and tiny bit of mix.   Good place to cut loose and dance to great 80's & 90's music. Totally doesn't matter if you think you can dance or don't think you can dance as long as you're moving in whatever motion suits your fancy you'll have a good time and no one will care (and even if you want to socialize at the bar or on the outskirts without dancing, you're good to go there too).   They were speedy on requests. Played lots of danceable favorites, some well-known pop of the day, but not too much and most people kept to their groups or mingled, danced, and socialized with others. Very cool atmosphere and a lack of people dancing all over you like at other clubs, which was appreciated. Had a fun time, will go back with others every once in awhile in the future. Bars/Dance Clubs aren't really my scene but I really liked this one and want to check out the Prince/Michael Jackson night!

0niNpv8X_2I7wIWVWl3ZyA.review_text: I JUST found out about Madrone Art Bar and I can not be happier with this discovery.   My dream has always been to paint a wall in my house with chalk board paint so that I can write huge notes to myself and doodle and basically act like a little kid.  I have always been obsessed with writing on chalk boards.  My 5th grade teacher can attest to that, as she made me write my name on the board at least thrice weekly in attempt to shame me into being quiet while she was talking. HA! Joke's on YOU, Mrs. McComas.   Madrone's chalkboard wall proudly displays drinks and specials, but also showcases the drunken idiots who have left their tabs open at the bar.  I find this hilarious- even better, since my name did NOT appear on the list. Phew! ;-)  Look forward to returning her many times, especially since it's in my hood!

kSkpoSOdr8RQW50aFfV6Hw.review_text: Cool decor, art and atmosphere. Best disco ball anywhere, ever. Best neon Rakim quote anywhere, ever.  Somewhat mixed crowd.   Friendly bartenders.  Decent beer selection.   Great music and low-no cover.  Can't really go wrong here...

wVxJYUI8PXfhDOzWpyz4Sw.review_text: Popped in Last night with some very VIP clients of mine. THANK YOU so much Madrones.  My previous review STANDS 100 %. They have not seen me in months and BANG... From the owner to the door and, THE ONLY crowd to be with on a Monday In the Bay.  Thx again Madrone I know I'm a VERY tough man to plz especially if I have clients with me and YOU ROCKED !!!

3wjqn70BkV8nXzqBDLpUvQ.review_text: Things I liked about Madrone: More space than I expected  Fully stocked bar  Fun video projectors  $3 PBR  Things I did not like: The guy in the weird Michael Jackson jacket that hit on my friend and I, and then proceeded to do Jersey Shore dances for the rest of the evening.  Music was so- so  Could not figure out how to dance to Indie music... apparently booty bumps are not the way to go.   Overall this place is ok. I am going to give it another chance once 90's night rolls around because that could be glorious. Don't forget to bring cash and $5 for the cover, after 10 p.m.

A4OlhWGmq6ojWYOhdhSppQ.review_text: Delightful atmosphere. Superb drinks. Classy music. Good Lighting. Sweet company. You should go here...

C7p4AojhkDK3f6hqPSHwfg.review_text: Giant air freshened shaped in a tree that says 'bar freshener'. It explained the fresh smell.  The atmosphere is varied. When I first got there it was before the Saturday night crowd and it was totally chill, you could chat to your friends and listen to some funky beats. They have an amazing drink selection and I was in awe of there back bar- sooo much variety! I started with my usual but then decided to try one of their specialty drinks, "Ninja in the fog" or something to that effect.  Delicious! Just the right amount of sweet, when I went back for a second it was in a pint glass. All I could think was, "This is awesome and this is my last drink," because the bartenders have a heavy hand with the pour and the price is just right.  They have a variety of music very night and I must have been there for a 90's throwback night. Tons of fun and I would definitely go there again.

EwLKWYkNvuXMfpkoVR5mSA.review_text: An art bar with character. We were here on a wday and found it  buzzing with people. There is a lot of choice on the drinks menu. Oh and if you order a drink with 'slap on the face', that really means slap on the face, so watch what you order.   The place has different DJs every night, an interesting mix of drinks and some very intriguing videos on the back wall. All in all its a 5-star joint.

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Interesting flannel-wearing crowd grooving to non-hiphop music. Not a serious place to get your dance on.

R3Wi42pKvHKYH93_Q1kbHg.review_text: Had a great time here once - two stars. Maybe it's because I don't have tits, but on subsequent visits I had a helluva time trying to get a drink, and when I did finally get one, it was all wrong. Has officially become one of those places that never fail to piss me off.

FzJRCkoalWORV9MskE2CuA.review_text: Fringe isn't always good--for instance, on men's shoewear or underneath bolo ties--but Madrone hits it pretty good every 3rd Saturday.  Funky borderline un-PC art (Burberry automatic weaponry + Jesus bling), extensive bar & drinklist, cool video/music mixes, laid-back energetic crowd just out to have a good time.  Could live without the $5 cover, but honestly pretty reasonable.  Cash only.  Check website for schedule.

PZvyqN7sgHI-o4f8z7O-ZQ.review_text: No no no, this won't work at all. Hey Madrone, you're like one of those tiny yapper dogs that think they're a German Shepherd and act tougher than they are. Cuz guess what, you're a small bar in NOPA that, because you installed one of those lame projection screens, bought some swanky furniture, and placed a velvet rope outside, thinks it can charge covers on weeknights and allow your bartenders to have pretentious attitudes. So basically I'll only go here when forced, but I'll give credit where credit's due and give props for the Budweiser tall boys! But that's all the praise this bar will get.

IjG_YTj2fQKNzyQlddOwNw.review_text: Mickey Mouse on the cross. Underneath a Burberry-clad automatic rifle. This is what you get to see when you sit down at the lovely piece of wood that is the Madrone Art Lounge bar. It's a long bar and it's a long, long list of drinks on the chalkboard wall beside it. This place has a wall of booze thirty feet long and three racks high. One night I stumbled in here to find Truner Pils for a dollar a pint. I lived the dream that day.   Each night brings a different type of patron. They have a jazz jam session on Sunday nights that features some of the best players in the city. We're talking Jazz Mafia. Look it up. Thursday is salsa night, with lessons at 9 pm. Great for the señors and the señoritas. Steppin', a hot jazz-funk soul odyssey, plays every Tuesday without fail. Come meet band leader Oscar Meyers. That's right. Everyone's in love with him. The disco bomb is a mirror-encrusted Vietnam-era US Air Force 100-lb bomb. Shiny disco bomb. Very cool cylindrical lights hang above the bar. Spike is the kind of owner who has friends who are happy to make him very cool cylindrical lights; the kind of guy who covers a bomb in mirrors then hang it like the sword of Damocles over the dance floor. A cool owner makes for a cool bar, a cool bar makes for cool times, and cool times make for cool people. Spike is cool people. And the circle turns. I almost forgot about the art. In addition to the Burberry number above the bar, Madrone is always exhibiting art by mostly-local, always-excellent artists - like the shiny golden deer head with AKs for antlers. An entire wall of the bar is covered with graffiti art, and a self-portrait of the owner always holds down the left end of the bar. Like great bars? Come to Madrone. Like great people? Cone to Madrone. Like great sex? Cone to my house. At the end of the day, I love this bar and so, I hope, will you.

zORQY85qUfWiIEltLOxG1g.review_text: Event: Baby cousin's 22nd Birthday  I went here with 8 of my cousins after eating at YakiniQ BBQ for dinner.  Not a good idea:  a giant group of people dancing in a circle in a crowded bar + a hot summer night = I felt like we were a walking tub of bulgogi potpourri.  Super sexy.  -  Things that stood out: a large bin filled with yummy fortune cookies (individually packaged) by the entrance, a photobooth, a gold plated Mickey Mouse attached to a crucifix with two gold chains around his neck, a Burberry shotgun mounted above the bar, Antlers with machine guns, a giant pine tree car freshener hanging from the ceiling.  -  I also want to point out that there was an actual working breathalyzer machine right by the exit complete with business cards for different taxi cab services in case you fail the test.  I've actually never seen that before so I was highly amused.  Sidenote:  I've never really seen my baby sister drunk in a bar before.  Tonight was a first.  Sure I've seen her drink a tad here and there in Napa with the family or during Thanksgiving dinner, but never in an actual bar and never to the point where she's dancing like a not so innocent baby sister.  It was almost like the time when I was nine years old and I found out that all of the characters in Disneyland that signed my autograph book were just teenagers getting paid minimum wage dressed in costumes.  You don't understand, my world was turned upside down.  Granted she's a fresh batch of good ole' 21, I still think of her as a child.  God, I'm getting old.  -  The music was fantastic for a chill weekday night.  Old school memory lane music.  A little bit of Lucy Pearl mixed in with some Missy Elliot and Snoop Dog (or is it Snoop Lion now?) with a dash of Hi-Five's, "I Like the Way (The Kissing Game) and T.W.D.Y.'s, "Player's Holiday".  Happy Music.  -  The crowd was very diverse.  Also, I was surprise how packed the place was especially for a Wednesday night.    -  They have a nice selection of alcohol and it was not hard to miss the extensive mixed drink menu since it was clearly written in colorful chalk by the bar.  +4, I'll be back soon.  Something that I will never forget from tonight's experience: Being the responsible D.D. and hearing my baby sister give me a ridiculously drunken, somewhat distorted speech during the ride back about "living life to the fullest" that reminded me of Theon Grayjoy's YOLO speech (Games of Thrones reference, sorry guys) except rather than getting knocked on the head mid-speech, she started to drunk cry herself to sleep.  Priceless.

1e8mZOLO42C4syKPmt0dIg.review_text: Good neighborhood feel with a twist, cool art , fresh interesting drinks, always have music of some sort, the people that go there could be alittle cooler but whateves ....good place to try if your in the neighborhood.

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: Had a wonderful time here last Saturday with my best friend at the Prince vs. Michael party. Was quite chill earlier, then got packed. Great vibe.  The staff was equally great... the owner even gave my friend and I a free drink. The clientele was very hip and smiling, and positive. My friend said that one of the girls there she was dancing with offered to get her a drink. That is totally unusual, a straight girl offering another straight girl who she didn't even know a drink!  Thought that was the funniest thing in the world. But people were really cool and friendly and that was the vibe we were getting thoughout the night. The guys were cool too, a mix of straight and gay.  Plan on going back on a Monday (perhaps even tonight) to see how their Motown Mondays are! My friend loved it so much she wants to hold her birthday party there. Also went awhile back, they were having a salsa night there as well. I forgot which night, though! Great chill establishment. Can't wait to go back.

wWW8IMgEqtYoIk2Aoanywg.review_text: Just got back from Motown Monday! Very disappointed. A good friend of mine was the DJ, went to say hi and the man whose party it is, threw profanities at me and pushed me off the stage. I'm in the hood and love the people who run and bar tend here. My friend please don't assault your patrons. We support you and pay for your existence.I'm not sure who you think you are but in my world we are kind and tolerant. I'm extremely disappointed in your actions, I know Motown Mondays is working for you but take care of the people who support you. You come across as an ungrateful human being. Be nice please, we just want to have fun, talk with our friends and have a good time. Thank you Madrone for your bar.

7zxKUufAVxL45lMz2A7ypg.review_text: I went here on a Thursday night to see Emynd and Bo Bliz from Philly (Emynd is originally from the Bay tho) spin. The vibe was pretty cool. Swayzee and DJ 4AM started the night off spinning a wide assortment of music ranging from the local hyphy stuff to hip hop to mashups.  They got me hyped up. And when Emynd and Bo did their thing, I was very impressed and enjoyed myself much (all this was with Aqua Teen playing in the background). Anyhow, the bar is pretty small. It is more of a around the corner bar that a lot of cities have. They had my beer of choice, Newcastle, which is a plus in my book. They also sell tall boys as well, which I think looks gangsta when u see a lady chugging them down.  Anyhow, the decor is nice with art by local artists on sale, and suprisingly, since it got a bit packed, I didn't have to wait a while to order a drink. The people who frequent this place seem like the typical hipsters that frequent SF, so that can be a good or bad thing depending on your opinions. Plus, if that night I went there was any indication of what the crowd looks like, then I would just go there just to meet a pretty lady or two. I would go here again if I didn't have to find parking 10 blocks away, but that would mean I would have to live in SF, which unfortunately isn't going to be anytime soon.

5o1nP-wB5JI8TRH_r8BWYw.review_text: I dig the 4 to 9 pm happy hour and the infused vodkas. However, the service could have been better. There was only one bartender on a Friday night which doesn't make any sense.

OmvCi63S4nNq-glUfoaUpw.review_text: No real reason to go here. Not fun. Just not fun. And my drink was awful.

UG3CWDkQZjfK_Fhf_QtKwQ.review_text: Went here for a michael jackson dance party and the place was packed! We waited outside in line for an hour then decided to walk home but it looked really fun inside!

hZ_q-S7WaX3ZuzdbK3Pc6g.review_text: went to the Michael Jackson vs Prince there...got there late...maybe they played all the good songs there!?! it was crowded & hot like double dutch-yuck...the scene was a cross between holy cow & elbow room..or maybe blondie's?? forgot why i never went back...maybe i'll try again in a year or so.

zKm4j3JJLgnqe1F3q_qZFg.review_text: Happy hour until 9pm!!!  Ok, besides that, this place has a good, casual, artsy vibe.  But I think what really makes this place stand out are the hidden games inside the trunks  (they use the trunks for coffee tables).  I was there last week and we found Operation, Yahtzee, Scrabble, and more--it was like opening a treasure chest!

jy_RGAeAvNeCv5BxZsUWFA.review_text: I got there at about 6:30 and stayed for less than an hour so I can't really comment on the noise or drink wait after the DJ and the dancing starts. I can however say that this is a decent spot for happy hour. The decor is a little funky but warm and inviting.   They use plain black handles on the beer taps and as far as I could tell the beers available aren't listed anywhere. That would be fine if I felt comfortable asking the bartender to go through the choices but the acoustics aren't good and the bartender was busy.   When I first showed up I went up for a beer and the bartender was busy. I saw him grab a flashlight, look at the bottles of wine under the cash register, choose one, open it, grab a wine glass, wipe it out with a napkin, pour the wine, and finally serve it. While I do appreciate attention to detail that is way too many steps if you are the only bartender in a crowded bar. I suggest they open a few bottles of wine and polish the wine glasses before they open.

gmVy4kTjG9-trE_UYnfCMw.review_text: I'm pretty meh about Madrone. I was all keyed up to like it, but it ended up disappointing me a lot.   Madrone is a pretty well appointed space and I didn't find it to be quite so small as everybody else seems, but it's definitely not huge.   Some of the drinks were quite moderately priced, so I suppose that is a plus. The specialty at the bar are their infused vodkas, which my friends partook of and enjoyed. I ordered an Anchor Steam but ended up with a Prohibition after one of the two people behind the bar informed me that Anchor Steam was off. No biggie.  The real big problem is that there was only one bartender there for a rapidly crowding bar full of thirsty people. The bartender did the best she could, and we got pretty lucky scoring drinks right away, but there was such a backlog of people waiting to order that it was a real problem.   The other guy behind the counter did serve me up my beer, and he collected glasses and stuff, but he seemed more interested in talking on the phone and eating a burrito. It was pretty bizarre, because there he was standing facing the crush of people waiting to be served a drink and he is back there casually munching on his dinner. Odd.  We ended up moving on rather than wait 15 minutes for another round. Didn't seem like a big loss.

xT15DPvgtyU799LLXpKzIQ.review_text: House made infused vodka and Budweiser cannons. Some of the friendliest and interesting staff I have encountered. Some of them can even deal Texas Hold 'em. All of this and surrounded by art to look at and board games to bet on. I have had so many good times here even before the night time events start. I remember this spot when it was a great falafel joint so I have been around and love the neighborhood. Madrone was a great Addition.  I have heard that they recently changed ownership. I actually haven't been back since then, but I know that they still have the vodka and big Budweisers. I will have to check out the changes and update my review very soon.  5 stars as an early evening, after work, day after thanksgiving, xmas eve lounge.

X72fUVG-iUdOWpx1073WMw.review_text: I really wanted to like this bar because I did love the decor and the weirdly grabbing video shorts playing on the projector; however, the amount of the people stuffed into this smallish bar was ridiculous.  Luckily I didn't have to wait in the crazy long line outside (there for a birthday party, the birthday boy knew a guy) but if I did I'm pretty sure I'd take off another star.

3zWYE-sXRgbT6pHzGo8LNw.review_text: this place is a nice way to 'getchyobuzzon'  the girl i was with was getting served way stronger drinks than me though...i'm not  sure what that was about.  cash only though - heads up.

AnZGueUrGJ9sNmUoctM-dg.review_text: Went to happy hour here with friends last night.  I thought it was great - the infused vodkas are cool and they have good happy hour specials. I also love that happy hour lasts till 9 - one of the few places I've found where I can still make it to happy hour after working late! They also let you bring outside food in, which is even more appealing considering that Nopalito just opened down the street.   It was definitely pretty empty, which was perfect for us since we could just lounge and catch up.  I imagine the real crowd here comes late night.

87JTyKAl7nJUEp3U1_OT3A.review_text: i need more spots like this in my life. caught some really good underground shows here. saw "can't find a villain" here. after their set, we went out for a smoke and had a drum circle rhyming session (i don't rap btw. i was just a spectator). but some dood who lived upstairs came outside his window with no shirt on and a bongo and started playing to the beat. it was magical and mystical and all that good stuff.

VqvFTuBlltncR4qvKdxR0Q.review_text: I love madrone.  It is a nice place to go in the neighborhood.  Thursday nights can get crazy with the salsa dancing!  And it always has a throw-up smell... but other than that... awesome bar.  Squirt guns (a drink) are great for hot days...

_jXd74oZFTB4V-p2mdiKdw.review_text: Neat bar. Nice ambiance, cool drinks, fairly intimate. A good place to go with friends.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: Live music, microbrews, photobooth, crazy furniture. This place is pretty legit.  The beer was cheap and the place wasn't too crowded. I came here right after going to another bar nearby called Candybar. I liked Madrone Art Bar better.   I wish I knew about this place earlier, it's definitely a spot worth checking out. I'd recommend trying the Death & Taxes beer or the Hunter's Point Porter. I actually was thinking about having my birthday here this past June. Good spot.

CUjwFvpy5R2Hjgf02Nd_Bw.review_text:
This place reminds me of Hush-Hush before it fell under new(?) ownership and sucked.  Granted they don't have the drink specials that hush-hush used to have and this place IS classier...there's just something about the mix of people and booty shaking on a Saturday night that reminds me of my oh-so-drunk nights at the hush.
 I highly recommend "Shake Appeal"!  It was a blast - just what I wanted.

BzNqUWY6TzrZA-v0rdm7Jw.review_text: I stumbled upon this place randomly and it was everything I ever wanted... Great music, art & amazing drinks all in one place!! I can't remember the last time I went to a bar that had such a wonderful variety of old school hip hop without feeling karaoke-ish. This spot is SOLID. :)

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: After my last scathing review, the owner of this bar, Mike, emailed me on Yelp and offered to both refund my money for the horrible rip-off of a show put on by Cirque Noir AND buy me a drink!  What a nice guy!!!  And a perfect example of good service from a business.  It's nice to know that owners of businesses are receptive to constructive criticism, friendly and responsive.    I will DEFINITELY be going back to Madrone...just not on a night when Cirque Noir is performing!

yGOntxXiayDkOcrVwQDNLg.review_text: Is it a cafe?? Is it a gallery?? Is it a bar?? Is it a club??  Who knows... It's Madrone!  I've never had a bad time here, but I think that's because I only ever really go late on nights when my roommates and I have been drinking, and we really want to get out of the house, and what the hell, there's $2 Red Stripes and $3 Jameson shots.  Really, though, it's the kind of place that urban-hipsters wearing patterned hoodies and riding uber-pimped fixies congregate to get silly. Every once in a while, some Marina dipshits show up because someone's hip work friend told them about it.  To Madrone's credit, I have seen many-a b-boy dance on it's floors.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: I hadn't been here since the "change in management/scene/decore/EVERYTHING" and I must say, I enjoyed it.   The setting is still a little "cold" (high ceilings, hard to avoid) but everything else screams (or warmly imbues) comfort and chill vibes.   every night is different (apparently) but I'd happy head back for their next live jazz night.   Fun, chill, great conversation, even met some great people.   Definitely heading back soon.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I used to like this place..now it totally bites..The last time the four of us went there we each paid a cover to go in...then we bailed within 10 mins because the place had no vibe and the drinks sucked...

dFrRFcH48RIftVOQOo5r0A.review_text: i've given this joint several chances to redeem itself, but that's just not ever gonna' happen!  what's with the cover charge?  i'm not a cheap ass or anything, but the cover charge for a venue like this is just plain robbery!    the "bouncers/door guy's" are kinda' a bunch of jerk-offs!  i understand what is required form someone with  that job title, but way to keep the stereotype alive!!!!  there are plenty of medicinal marijuana clubs on divisadero... stop by one and chill the fuck out!!!!  bartenders are as slow as turtles... kinds like waiting in line @ the dmv!  the crowd can really be a mixed bag of folks, but most of the time the kids that are there just make you wish you never paid the cover charge on the first place!!!!  overall, i've had more fun drinking outside of the liquor store across the street!!!!  ***ursa major***

eRV6cKVHNqzXuESU6dAP-Q.review_text: I've always had a good time here.  Good drink specials, plenty of places to sit, and if it's too loud in one part of the room, you just move away from the speakers and you can actually have a conversation.  The Prince vs. Michael Jackson nights are fun (3rd Saturday of the month), especially if you're a child of the 80's.

a78_8i5d7UjQL-mqJXhpNg.review_text: I'm giving this place 4 stars for when there ISN'T something going on.  I haven't experienced the "club" aspect of Madrone, but I urge the intimidated to go on inside in the evening sometime.  It's a nice place to go for a drink to chat with your friends, unwind, or gear up for the night ahead.  They have these old Victorian couches that "absorb your body while the alcohol absorbs your blues" (tm)  The pours aren't super stiff, but I didn't find they were super weak either.  However, I usually just go with a glass of shitty wine or a cheap beer anyway.  The price is right here, especially during their generous happy hour:  Happy Hour Specials...(4-9pm every day) $1 off Drafts $2 PBR'S $3 well drinks $4 Mojitos and Infused Vodkas  I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for Madrone, but being nearby I'd say it's probably one of my favorite bars in the neighborhood, especially when I just feel like getting out of the house but not necessarily partying in the rip-roaring drunk, waking up in the morning hanging from a tree by my panty elastic kind of way.  Oh, but my friend went to one of the club nights and ended up hooking up with a coworker.  So there you go, I guess, four stars all around.  Cuz that shit is hot (read: HILARIOUS.)

Focppt7sUMuyz2pgkBNmQQ.review_text: This is the kinda bar you don't get all dressed up to go to.  Hey, I didn't know!?!?  Anyway, I would totally love this place if I was dressed casually and ready for a chill night.  It's dark with a bit of a dirty feel and the decor consists of a random mix of chairs and couches.  There's a small dance floor too.
