Oh, and if you're going there just for the raspberry lemon mojitos, they stop serving them after 9pm.  bummer.  We walked down to the other end of the block to Nopa for my mojito fix.

jYIBcMXtv1iF1jaBvdcz2Q.review_text: Music is super dank, every third Saturday is Indie Rock night, which I'm not into but every other time I've been there it's been rockin. Cheep beer.

nzRWr5fYr18TPDWPGxjVwA.review_text: After reading Michael P's review of Madrone, I was determined to go over here at some point to check it out for myself. After an evening that began at Zebulon went a bit sour, Madrone was posited as a suggestion, and I was more than happy to go along with it.  That late in the evening, parking off of Divis/Fell was not a problem. They charge a $5 cover at the door, and the place looks to be divided into a lounge section by the far wall facing the bar, a dance area opposite the bar, and a projector playing movies on the side. Pretty dark in there, but candlelit. The crowd was a pretty good size, the seating was comfortable (kitschy couches, wooden box trunks for tables), and the restrooms were clean enough. I can't say whether or not they took plastic since another friend bought the drinks. Seemed like a happening place, with an easygoing crowd. Music was pretty energetic also.  I'd go back here. I can't give it four stars because I didn't experience enough of it - finding myself deep in conversation for the most part and losing the retaining pin to my watch. I'll have to go back again to get the full Madrone experience, so consider this three-star review a note to myself to go back and improve on the experience by interacting more with my surroundings.

lq60zR_0DYEaazV2HbWEvg.review_text: Went here last Friday with some besties. We pretty much just had a weird time. Not bad, not good. When you're out with your friends trying to get crazy and laugh way too hard and create a bunch of inside jokes, a mediocre time won't cut it. So we weren't here too long.  Here's the rundown. We get there, pay the $5 cover and squeeze our way through the crowd. Literally a shoulder-to-shoulder mass of people. We reach the bar in the back and commence ordering (didn't have to wait too long, that was nice). I tried to get the watermelon vodka drink they have on their wall but they were out of watermelon vodka. So I got one of the other vodka drinks, can't remember the name but it had orange and lime. "This tastes like a Flintstones push-up pop!" my friend said upon sipping. He was right and this was not a bad thing.  Things got weird when we sat down.   "Are you sitting on my jacket?" -random incredibly tall guy "Uh...no." -Me "You're sitting on my jacket." -Mr. Random *standing up* "I'm not sitting on anything." -Me He proceeds to scream at his friends right next to me about losing his jacket. I look away awkwardly.  -5 minutes later-  "Is my jacket behind you?" -Hipster girl "No, there's nothing here." -Me "Where's my jacket?!" -Ms. Hipster *sighing* "I wish I could help you. Alas." -Me She questions my companions about whether her jacket is cozied up with their booties. She leaves, upset.  After these pleasant exchanges I looked around at the club: the girl two seats down giving her chair a lap dance, the couple right in front of me groping the night away, the gangster rap pounding away at my head.   We went back to my friend's apartment and watched his DVD of The Beyonce Experience. It was a better time. :P  Honestly I think it was just an off night. My friend said the music if normally way better. Give it a try, hopefully you won't find yourself involved in some crazy jacket thief ring.

0Tv2dl2O0TEQD-VGbPqwug.review_text: Madrone is alright. It's cash only. $5 cover at times. That used to bother me but wherever. Last night the Dj was good and the vibe was enjoyable. Bouncer was removing stools from the bar for some reason. $6 tall negra modelos. Single guys should come here it's the only type of place in the area if that makes sense. Art on the wall was various nude and semi nude paintings. I would not wait in line to come here though. No food options either from what I remember.

4Fyf9qPOqjpYofVqNVQfgA.review_text: Now I've done it. I've raised the bar so high that the pressure to write another poignant and hilarious review is nearly insurmountable. I can't take it so I will write a mediocre review. Not about a mediocre place but a mediocre review.  My take on this place is from a unique perspective and you will probably not have the same experience as I did. I've heard of the rude bartenders and pretentious atmosphere. Impossible I say. I had the bartender's full attention. That's because I was the only one in the place. Some guy named Bob or Bill was there for a few minutes but then he left and I was sitting there by myself at 6PM while my friend Andy bartended.  It smelled like fresh cut flowers and I felt like I was in an 1800's old west train car. There was cool art on the walls and Snow White was playing on the wall. I am not much of a mixed drink drinker but Andy convinced me to try some infused vodka. I had the cucumber vodka and the ginger vodka. The cucumber tasted cool and smooth. I almost felt like I had two slices on my eyes and I was relaxing in a spa... almost. The ginger vodka seemed like it would be better reduced and served over ice cream. If you like ginger and you like vodka then you might like this one. There were others like dried apricot*, berry, espresso*, and pear. I had none of them so you're on your own there.  I also had  couple of Death & Taxes beers but I didn't order any food. They don't make it there, they order it from somewhere else so I think the bartenders enjoy placing the food orders as much as they enjoy making mojitos. They don't.  So during the day (before 7PM) is when no one is there. If you go after that then you may have to deal with the rude bartenders or the wannabe hip-hop crowd. I can't speak to that. Otherwise I thought it was a cool place.  *New flavors tasted. I went back and tried a couple more. The espresso infused is probably better left to mixing in other drinks which is what they actually do. By itself it has all the bitterness of espresso and all the alcoholiness of vodka. Curiosity satisfied. The dried apricot...hmmm. Why dried? I don't know. It still had an edge. Maybe I was expecting more of a liqueur flavor. I could have gotten the same flavor from chewing on some dried apricots and washing it down with some vodka. Curiosity satisfied.

5N6HBoYVCGTxcU8Gje41YQ.review_text:
I avoided this place like the plague because of the look of the crowd usually loitering outside.  My mistake, this bar is pretty decent.
  There's a well stocked bar, a dj and a spot to dance, and some ratty old furniture to relax on if you want to forego the dancing in favor of quality boozing time.  The giant white tree logo in front still makes me nervous for some reason though.  What am I, supporting greenpeace drinking here?

nxPFgopmg0-cjtgyoAgcGw.review_text: I love this place!  I moved to SF two months ago and have been out in most of the neighborhoods.  They are typically saturated with dbags (like the Marina) or hipsters (the Mission), but as a whole...the bars on Divisadero are the best!  It's a diverse group of people (in my opinion) and no one is trying too hard.  The bartenders at Madrone are amazing.  Hook up great drinks and always friendly...and it's never hard to get a drink.    The place isn't huge, but I think that's what I like about it.  Also has fun decor, art and a cool piano.  Great times...definitely gonna be my new hot spot.

xsMd6OnEJ6_Np6Es0uxOIg.review_text: Woooo. I'm faded right now writing this review right now, but this club is nice. They even played some J Dilla produced track and Mos Def too. And they had a projector screen with peeps tagging too. Always wondered how they tagged on freeway over passes and now I know because of the project screen on this club showed some tight ass tagging. They really know how to mix drinks though especially those girl bartenders dressed in black. It was well worth it. Yeah. Woooooooooooo. Too crowded though to dance though and there was a line. Nice hip-hop music they played though. Two thumbs up!!!!! It's too damn crowded though (at least for tonight) to dance so I was just chillin' at the bar with my friend.  Edit: Well I have to add something now that I'm sober. They have couches at the entrance of the club so it's sort of like a lounge too. I thought it was nice that they had glasses and pitchers of water available on the bar counter top. Heh At least they're looking out for their patrons while getting them drunk.

Bc_hZIB-Yhorc1ZjLYZKOQ.review_text: Loving "Two"sdays.  But after a $2 cover, 2 hours of live funk music, and many $2 drinks, I wished there were more than 2 bathrooms.

HZM4Vyl0ztjslMT_YwKvaw.review_text: This fine establishment has a Prince v. Michael Jackson dance party once an effing month.  That is my shit.  The first time I attended said party I didn't expect such a crowd.  It was dangerous--like call the fire marshal dangerous.  But you do what you gotta to represent your favorite on the dance floor.  I will continue coming, no matter how crowded.  The trick I've discovered--and don't tell anyone this--is to rock out in front of the djs.  There's more fresh air there then in some chick's aqua net ridden hair riding up in your face, and there's a fan that you can nonchalantly point your direction.  And when those bitches get pissed that you pointed it away from them, just do it again and they'll leave you alone.  Prince v. Michael is like church.  The greatest thing is the respectfulness of the competition.  Folks that are all about the Prince aren't hating on my Michael fan-dom.  They just only sing along with the big hits.  And I offer the same.  I will dance with them to their obscure Prince songs and let them represent, but break it the eff down for my team captain.  It's a mighty respectful dance floor, except for the jocky white boys who don't know how to dance and bring a fucking cocktail onto the dance floor (not advised--get a tall can, dude.) and spill that shit all over you, then take their shirt off.  If you respect the bartenders, they will honor you and serve you like a champ.  There tends to be few behind the bar, and a lot of vying for their attention, but if, in the beginning, you are genuine and kind, and tip well, they will bypass that asshole white dude that now needs another cocktail because it's all over your skirt, to come and pour you a drink.   The bouncers are the kind of bouncers that can actually kick some ass.  They all look related, and flirt considerately, and if dude were causing problems, they would make it an un-problem.  But they let in about twice as many people should technically, and safely be in there.  So don't start a fire, ok?    There are only two bathrooms, but there are two gas stations across the way, and dudes, you can piss anywhere, so don't complain about waiting in line for the restroom, unless you plan to do illegal things off the toilet tank.  In that case, go to one of those gas stations.  Madrone has a bunch of infused booze, which I haven't had, and an extensive multi-paged menu for them.  I can't comment, as I usually stick to $3 Prohibition ales, and if the dance floor is rowdy, a tall can, or my hip flask (shhh, don't tell).  There's a pitcher and stacks of glasses (the glass kind) for your hydrational purposes, and the bar back is usually good about maintaining this, so much so don't count on stashing your glass to make his job easier.  Prince v. Michael is the best dance party I've found thus far, and it doubles as church for me, and many others.  A great lounge with art all over, old school couches and chairs for lounging, good bouncers, an industrial fan and cheap, quality beer on a Saturday night.  I don't feel right subtracting one star for the bathroom situation or the fire hazard--I've just had too much fun there.  You will too.  Just don't steal my spot on the dance floor.

Lsk_eYFxS3X5j1yvTF64Uw.review_text: This review may not really be fare but there was not other way to do the review. I would like to do a  review of Prince vs, Michael Jackson. P vs. MJ happens at Madrone about once a month. The problem that I have is that it happens at Madrone. The location as a small lounge seems like it would be great. Unfortunately because of the number of people who attend the dance party I never actually made my way to the bar (I believe that there is more than one).   I was surprised to see that Prince vs. MJ happened at such a small venue. I mean you have to take into account that there are a fare number of Prince and Michael Jackson fans, plus the additional hipsters who may show up for the sake of irony. The lounge is about the size of my studio apartment, Which means that it gets really crowded and hot  early in the night. The only semi constant way that they try to cool the place down is with a shotty electric fan that stops working even if you look at it wrong.   In short, Prince vs. MJ is a good place to start your night. You are likely to hear a lot of songs that you are not familiar with but will still make you want to shake your booty, grab your crotch, wear assless pants and/or make some sort of high pitched exclamation. But you likely will want to leave before you get packed in like a sardine.

MbfrGVXuPU35K7lwZQEqVA.review_text: I've had a great every time I've gone here. Usually the music selection is a hit (although it has had its misses) and they play a variety of stuff depending on what night it is. The cocktails are reasonably priced, however there are usually A LOT of people trying to get drinks. The downside is that there is a $5 cover on the weekends accompanied by a line. A bribe can usually get you anywhere though.

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: So... apparently this past Saturday at Madrone was Michael Jackson VS. Prince Night. The DJ was spinning hits from both artists and mixing them together. All the TVs on display were showing a lot of hip thrusting and crotch grabbing by both performers... Before I go on...   MJ, may you rest in peace. You were so awesome...   I'm not complaining. In fact, I was stoked when I found out. I'm HUGE fan of both. When Dove's Cry? Love it. Kiss? Amazing song. Bad? Sweet. Smooth Criminal? Classic. They probably have about 30 number one hits between the two of them.   Madrone sits on the corner of Divisadero and Fell. You'd have to be completely oblivious to your surroundings to miss it. It looks like an old Victorian house but don't let it fool you. The interior is anything but old fashion.   STAFF: Super nice! The bouncers are cool and the bartenders are rad. What I appreciate most at bars is when the bartenders don't big league you and/or pass you over when you've been waiting in line to get a drink. What really makes me upset is when bartenders see that you've been waiting but they keep asking hot chicks what they want before taking your order. If you get to the front of the bar, they'll notice you immediately. Mad props to them.   ATMOSPHERE: It's a fairly tiny place but not too small. Imagine a long narrow room with the bar taking up most of the left wall. They have some seating towards the back as well as a long booth that runs along the right wall. It's fairly dim inside but not too dark. The funny thing is that it feels crowded but you never get that shoulder-to-shoulder feeling. It attracts a pretty mixed crowd but from what I saw, it's dominated by preppies and hipsters. What I love most about this place is that it's a neighborhood destination for dancing. I love to dance, especially when I'm drinking.   WARNING: From what I saw, there's only one bathroom for each gender. Each bathroom only having one toilet, so the lines tend to stack up quickly. Just make sure you unload before going to Madrone or you'll have to wait at least 10 minutes when nature calls.

YII6qimAQ9RD_NByf80ZYw.review_text: On my quest to find free live music in San Francisco, I went to The Madrone Art Bar on a Tuesday.  Every Tuesday, this funky artsy place offers free live music that starts early and goes late, plus drink specials.   The Crow Eaters began the night pumping out tunes and the place was filled by the time the second band began.  Tons of people dancing.  For more details on my experience at the Madrone Art Bar and other places to see free live music in SF check out my article, "Free (or super cheap) Live Music Every Night of The Week in San Francisco" at questforzest.org/wp/zest….  Hope this helps music lovers!!

9bEZ8ZzS9F8VuPOLFdyu8A.review_text: I live in the area, Madrone's is one of my favorite bars - because of the good music and the furniture, especially. And the fact that you can bring food in, and the drink prices are very reasonable.  However, some of the bartenders have been less than nice and friendly. I left my credit card by mistake one night after I had my birthday party there, came back that next day (Monday evening) to claim it and pay my tab, and the bartender barely glanced through his stack of credit cards, shrugged, and told me it wasn't there.  Not satisfied with his reaction, I came back the next day, asked a different bartender the same thing, and got the credit card back - the first bartender clearly just didn't care enough to look through his stack of cards.   Not exactly great customer service, especially for something as sensitive as a credit card.  And the kicker? I was overcharged by 11 dollars.  Most bars, with this kind of treatment, I certainly wouldn't come back. But this bar is really nice enough that, despite the occasionally bad service, I come back from time to time.

ai8dGx2mz71_Ep46fKxngg.review_text: Madrone is ussualy at the tail end of my neighorhood crawl on a weekend since it has dancing and a full bar. Make sure to hit the ATM first as it is cash only. The music is generally hit or miss, but one of the most fun nights I have had here was a Michael Jackson vs Prince night. Even though I'm not a huge fan of either artist, its hard not to have a good time with a picture of someone's face glued to a stick.
